story: My name is Sean Murry and I am a Producer/Actor living in St. Louis, MO. I, along with my brothers, were born with a rare blood disorder called Diamond Blackfan Anemia. This medical condition has resulted in a need for an abundance of medication, multiple surgeries, and well over 100 blood transfusions throughout my life. While these transfusions are medically necessary, they can also cause iron overload, which can damage the heart and liver. You can read more about my family in a People magazine article that came out early 2018(https://people.com/human-interest/four-brothers...).As you can imagine the emotional and financial stress on families with this and other blood disorders is tremendous. The solution for many of us suffering with these challenges is as simple as finding a bone marrow donor. For the past 6 years, my family and I have been working with DKMS, which is the world’s largest bone marrow registry. My family and I have been on a mission to not only find donors for my brothers and myself, but to help find donors for the thousands of others with blood disorder related diseases and cancers fin their match and save their lives. In the last 6 years, my family's efforts have brought in 28,000 new donors registrations that have led to 116 life saving transplants. While my brothers and I have not yet found our match, we are hopeful that those phone calls will come any day now. My family through grassroots efforts, like setting up stands at churches, local sporting events, and colleges, managed to register all the donors. As a creative type, I thought about how I could do more. So, a few years ago, I started to write an outline for “Miles to Go.” I thought if I could create a T.V. show that was funny, entertaining, and insert information about how easy it is to become a bone marrow donor, more people would be inclined to see if they are a match.  We will share real stories of people whose lives have been saved by a bone marrow donation. I imagine we can have over 100,000 donors inspired to see if they are someone’s match and save even more lives.  With the encouragement of my family and agent, I have decided to jump forward and make this show happen now. I’m thrilled to have Co-founder Katharina Harf and DKMS to help advise for the project. We would like to invite you to be apart of helping us shoot the pilot, no dollar amount is too small or too large to help create this entertaining series with a mission. It is not every day a T.V show can help save lives.

story:
So, why do I want to do this?

I want to provide a high quality website & social presence that delivers effective education and entertainment.

  • I've been drumming for over 20 Years & I've been involved and growing in digital marketing for 10 years.
  • I Wanted to become a percussion educator online for many reasons.  I always felt like a strong teacher through 1 on 1 or quality content.  My old youtube channel had around 500,000 views and 500 subscribers.  The attention span through my videos was about 98%, meaning they watched entire video nearly accross the board.  
  • I do plan on setting up monetization through the google network.  Display Ads and what now.  Those funds will be rolled right back into the Google Display and Search Network to boost my visibility.  My desire to grow and keep offering everything I can at no cost to anyone.

What I Need to Get Going.

For Contributers:

  • I need quality equipment here.  There's a saying, "never trust a skinny chef", well I don't have a lot of equipment at the moment due to the ups and downs we all through in life.  Nothing special.  (liquidated a lot of gear during changes after a divorce.)  Anyways, I can't use the scraps of equipment I have now, I'd like to make a solid impression when viewers first get to my channel / website.  
  • A Good kit goes for about $1,000+
  • A Good Cymbal set goes for another $1,000+
  • Hardware I need will run me about $500
  • A mic set and interface will run another $1,000+
  • The remaining balance will go into a https website, hosting, web templates, advertising and marketing.  

What Contributors Get

  • $10 Contributors, you get my undying love.  I'm banking on you to pull me through to reaching my goal in launching this campaign 
  • $100 I will make a video of any song you request with a mention.
  • $250 Song request video with a thank you at the end of each video
  • $500  Sponsor logo before and after videos with web mentions and backlinks to your brands. + 2 Song requests for video cover.  
  • $5000: Half the earning from ads will go to you.  You can choose to roll that income into marketing to grow, or to pocket it.  You become a partner with freedrumtechniques.com 

Reduced Risks & Challenges

  • I won't be solo.  I have marketing mentors and a dev team to pull me through any technical hurdles.  We will keep everything we do "White Hat" when it comes to marketing and development.
  • Marketing Plan is set in stone.  Information architecture and research has been completed.  There is a series of beginner style videos to be made for targeting high volume searches, but intermediate and expert videos will be pumped with brand awareness marketing to attract new and old drummers alike to more advanced playing and cleaner technique.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're unable to donate at this time, any gear you're willing to donate is welcomed.  Spread the word if possible.  Get this into as many eyes as possible because I really want this to be a reality by the end of the year!  
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • or send bitcoin!

    • 35cEGbv1t4uqotQ6HBhqcqZL5n4WTEyBGD

Thank guys!

-Brennen Lesser

story:
In the year 3020 the world has split into four Kingdoms. Technology has advanced beyond metal and glass. Earth has reverted to the magnificence of stone and marble castles, with simple yet technologically adept fashion. Each Kingdom specializing in their own tech, farm, art, and war.


Dragon’s from the age of pre-time have been wiped from Earth and the other intelligent planets of the galaxies in fear of their raw power and strength amongst the stars. Or so they thought.
Skyler Gauge an 18-year-old in the United Space Core, and the last remaining of the dragon blood, is hidden by his father Lieutenant Gauge aware of his son’s fate should it be discovered, the royal blood that courses through his veins.


Just as Skyler begins to learn his true place in the universe, all is taken from him. His family, his home, his love.

 

In an instant, it is destroyed by an alien kingdom known as The Fallen, set on becoming the new universal power. In a last-ditch effort to survive the immanent implosion of his planet he manages to escape.
Lost and alone in the dark abyss of space riding shotgun on a wrecked escape pod, Skyler takes us on a journey of life, love, death and self-discovery via a series of video logs. Recalling his most visceral memories leading to his present situation and searching for Arum, the planet said to be the center of the universe. The birthplace of dragons.

 

 Driven by vengeance and love he will do anything it takes to reunite the four kingdoms. They don’t know the monster they’ve woken. A new KINGdom is coming.

story:
BLOODLINE Synopsis 

Two brothers' lives are at jeopardy when they discover they are the only two people alive with super-human abilities.

Chapter One - The Visit (Released)

In this chapter, Alex Lee (played by Blake Ridder) gets a surprise visit from his so-called brother Mao Lee (played by Rui Shang), who warns Alex he's in danger. Soon enough, danger came for them both.

Chapter Two - Run (Coming soon)

We get to find out more about the brothers' background, and why they are being hunted down. Alex comes up with a solution for an escape from Raven.
 

Not seen, but real

It's been far too long for East Asian actors to take on very minor and stereotyped roles in movies and theatres. It might have got a little bit better in America, but in the UK, I am still seeing my fellow actors being casted for very minor roles, probably a martial arts role at best. 

At the end of the day, unless it is a periodic drama (even that has a way around it), East Asians are still people just like any other actors, so why do we not get to play in any major roles? Is it really because of our looks, or is it the talent?

How can 'BLOODLINE' help

With this web series, I want to show to the movie/theatre industry that we can act, and we can act well, not just as a karate kid, or a prostitute, but as action figures and superheroes. Can you imagine watching a Marvel movie with an East Asian actor playing Spiderman? Didn't think so, and that is why I am running this campaign. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

I have so far, filmed and released the first chapter of BLOODLINE. The next chapter is already being developed. But to help my fellow East Asian actors, as well as developing this web series even more, with higher production, I will need help with the following:

  • To continue production and hiring actors and a film crew. We need around $25,000 - this should give us a minimum 12 chapters series. The cost will also go towards on-location filming, as well as upgrading to some better visual effects.
  • I've always said to myself, even if I get 20 people as fans of the web series, I will be over the moon. So for everyone who contributes to this campaign, no matter how small, they will get their name mentioned everywhere.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are stronger when we unite, so please do share this web series with everyone on social media. This will make the movement travel even faster, and one day, we will all be seen as equal. Plus, it's a pretty awesome series!

Thank you so much for reading, and I hope you are enjoying the series so far.

story:
Overview

From the bottom... on the rise to the top, Mr. James Boudreaux is set to become Memphis' first black owned brokerage firm owner. He is planning to build a life of black wealth with his best friend and business partner, Levan St. Bernard. But of course, if it's too good to be true, it probably is! James never understood the challenges that come with building a life on secrets and lies, until now. He knows what life is like in the streets but he never thought it would be worse in business. You see, in the streets, everybody gets their hands dirty. In business, you have to know how to do dirt but keep your hands clean. James is starting to realize that the most TOXIC people are those who disguise themselves as family and friends, or is it just THE MAN IN THE MIRROR? When dealing with devils, sometimes you have to become The Devil. 

 

WRITER/DIRECTOR/PRODUCER

My name is Tymika Chambliss and I've been acting in community theater and film for over 10 years and writing for over 20 years. From short stories to theater productions, writing has been a consistent passion since the age of 10. In 2014 I began drafting the storyline and character breakdowns for TOXIC. After brainstorming, researching, and praying, I decided to take my script, build a cast, shoot the trailer and pilot, and find a way to bring it to homes across the globe. As you may know, those steps, although fun and rewarding, wasn't free. I funded the entire project, thus far, out of pocket, and now I need your help to complete it. (continue below)

 

This project separates itself from others in its attention to detail. The truth is in the details. We have award winning theater actors, award winning filmmaker, award winning director, and more. Having made these connections, our story line leads us forward and we have the foundation in place to take this pilot into the television market. 

In supporting this series, you are supporting WORKING MOTHERS, WOMEN, AND MEN who are keeping their families together, while creating quality entertainment for the world.  

Given the talent and dedication to this project, we want everyone to get paid for the work they put in. As a struggling actor, I have participated in MANY projects where I was simply given a slice of pizza and credit and spent my own money on other expenses. I do not want TOXIC to be that kind of project! Our actors are professional and should be PAID for their commitment and the work they put into every passing moment in front of the camera. We want the end product to be QUALITY. 

We are making something big and we are not looking back.

 

So... why this project?

TOXIC is a story of hard work, dedication, and redemption. However, we are changing the narrative of the typical story of a black man in America. 

James Boudreaux is...

  • A black man who grew up in the hood
  • A black man whose father abandoned him 
  • A black man who found family in gang life
  • A black man who went to jail
  • A black man who decided to turn his life around
  • A black man who went to college and graduated
  • A black man who had everything against him and HE MADE IT!

TOXIC follows the life of James Boudreaux; a dreamer, fighter, father, and entrepreneur. He is determined to create black wealth and teach others along the way. Yes, he will encounter struggles, unbearable hurt, heartache, heartbreak, chaos, and scandals along the way but he is a fighter and his fight began the moment he inhaled his first breathe on this earth and the fight won't end until his dream of being the first black brokerage firm owner, in Memphis, TN is accomplished.

One of the underline themes of TOXIC is spirituality and the importance of connecting to a higher power. We wanted to be cautious in not promoting religion because religion tends to be the thread that blinds the characters but abandons the audience. No matter where a person's life takes them, they can always find guidance and solitude by being connected.

Too many times, the media has not given Black Men and Women the opportunity to create their own narrative to their own story. BlackBox Productions, minority owned and operated, found it necessary to give a voice to our stories and truth to our lives.

 

What Do We Hope To Accomplish?

  1. Seasons of undeniable, drama packed, quality entertainment
  2. Display the positive outcomes of second chances
  3. We want to show how the characters transitioned out of hopelessness into prosperity
  4. Show the audience that there are multiple paths to success and every path isn't traditional. Because life is 10% of what is thrown at you and 90% of how you choose to handle it. 
  5. Show the audience  how to increase their opportunities by expanding their network of influence.
  6. Expand our platform from YouTube to syndicated television and/or streaming platforms (ie: Netflix, Hulu, Quibi, etc.)

 

What Do The Funds Cover?

I plan to create 8 episodes per season. The goal is to film 2 full seasons.

Expense to cover:

  • PAY OUR EDITOR - editing is a very long, painstaking process.  We shoot 44 pages, per episode.  That's the equivalent of an average length 30- 40 min show!  Sorting all that out requires patience and great attention to detail.  
  • PAY OUR COLORIST - After the editing is complete, the colorist  sits down and goes shot by shot making adjustments to  the footage to make sure colors and skins tones and lighting looks the best and most consistent as it can.    
  • PAY OUR COMPOSER -  To ensure the originality of the music, per episode, we are hiring a composer and music department. I can't express how important music is to giving each episode the punch and the polish that it needs.  
  • PROMOTE THE SHOW - One important thing I have learned by producing theater productions is how important it is to set a budget for marketing.  We are going to utilize the pilot and edit it into short promotions for Instagram, FB, TikTok, Youtube, and Twitter.  We are planning a virtual launch party/screening to invite family, friends,  social media bloggers and other influencers who can give us the extra promo. We will also purchase Facebook Ads and Google Ads  to grow our audience.

Additional expenses:

  • Locations and Permits. 
  • Crew. 
  • Food. A well fed crew is a hard working crew! We believe in doing right by people.
  • Equipment + Insurance. For cameras, lights, G&E equipment, trucks, etc.
  • Art. Which includes props, set decorations, costumes., etc.
  • Actors
  • Transportation
  • Hair and Make up
  • ... and more

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate space! We are looking for incredible locations to shoot our series. If you have access to a cafe/restaurant, co-working space, conference rooms, two apartments, that you would like to allow us to use in-kind, please give us a shout!

Share this campaign with friends, family, and anyone passionate about supporting both the independent filmmakers and sustainable industries!

Donate space! We are looking for incredible locations to shoot our series. If you have access to a cafe/restaurant, co-working space, conference rooms, two apartments, that you would like to allow us to use in-kind, please give us a shout!
Share this campaign with friends, family, and anyone passionate about supporting both the independent filmmakers and sustainable industries!

story:
Greetings & Short Introduction

First of all, I would like to greet you with my luxurious portrait and then thank you immensely, in taking the time to consider donating to this project. I am Eoxander the creator of Emigration Propagation. I'm a real-life nomad /really, a real nomad... livestock and all, not the digital kind/,  living in Berlin, in love with Germany. I have lived in Germany for the past 2 years often times wondering I might as well BE an actual alien. During my time here, a stream of bizarre incidents that I personally witnessed or things that I've heard, together with my passion for animated comedies, kept boiling itself into a story and led me to create this project. 

What is this about? Humans... Us... You  know? What makes it so that we are always looking out into the universe for mysteries, when there are so much to explore within our humanity, right here on this earth. Like what makes that one asshole dislike a "Cute Puppy Compilations" or a "10 hours of white noise, black screen" /That's exactly what you asked for, dick!/ Youtube video? Cue:

Emigration Propagation

Basic Premise

Two completely opposite alien shipmates crash land in Germany. They are scared of us as we are of them. Like you know how when you see a rat or god forbid- a fucken cockroach and you scream to the high heavens... well, so do the rats and the cockroaches. Imagine seeing a giant hairless or exoskeleton-less motherfucker with a mouth that is multiple times your own body size. Yeah, that's how they feel. ANYWAY, they are immediately chased by BND agents /which is the equivalent of CIA in the US and a A/. So they must hide, but obviously they cannot get so far on their own, but Jeremy Ron befriends a bookstore owner Emma, who hides them in her apartment. But she will not be enough to save them, they must gain other allies to help them. We follow their journey as they attempt to integrate within this society and deal with daily bat-shit adventures while they question if they hate living on this AWESOME earth or love it- even with all the stupidity in it. 

 

*NOTE: THESE IMAGES&VIDEOS ARE DRAWN WITH THIS DUDE'S EXTREMELY LIMITED "SKILLS". THESE ARE MERELY MEANT TO  PROVOKE A FEEL. THE FINAL PRODUCT WILL BE DRAWN AND ANIMATED BY PROFESSIONAL ARTISTS.

Characters

The Alien Race A.K.A The U/uuu/i's: These aliens are built to be the perfect beings. They have been around for so long that they are evolved to be absolutely efficient. Kind of like... Germans. Or what they are perceived to be like /they're humans too, dick/. These creatures have been through everything our civilization has been through. So now they live in a planet they built for themselves instead of relying on nature, pffft lame. The Ui's are physically superior to us too. For instance, their limbs are the same length because if they are fleeing or are in pursuit they can run as fast as a greyhound on all fours. Their eyes are big and black because the black outer layer protects them from harmful radiations. So they can just stare into the sun as long as they want. But the most impressive part is that them being the perfect creatures they are, they don’t even have sex. No, not that kind… I mean gender: male or female. Because it is just so inefficient to depend on another sex to reproduce. You want a baby? You can squeeze one out yourself. So these creatures, should be rightly called a female. But they don't have the concept, so they can't argue with being called a dude. 

 

  • Jeremy "The Giant" Ron a.k.a Ron Jeremy: A gentle giant. A kind hearted, goofy giant alien who is considered a loser on his planet. And an idiot… He's the kind of a dude who wears a Hawaii holiday shirt with both bow and office ties. He is convinced that it makes him more human. But don’t take his gentleness for weakness. He can wreak absolute hell if you give him the reason to. He is after all, is the son of two of the most famous Ui's on planet Tiki.

 

  • Napoleon "The Asshole": Leon is abruptly named an asshole because he is just a miserable little guy. As it implies in his given name /given by Ron/ he has a Napoleon complex. But he’s not that small /and neither was Napoleon/, he’s about as tall as a regular white northern European dude, which is pretty tall. He was brought up to do no wrong. But that all changes when he discovers weed on this planet. He then becomes a paranoid, even bigger asshole with a recurring psychosis.

  • Emmeline "Emma" Carpenter: Her rich family traces their origins from Germany. But culturally she’s as German as Michael Jordan. She is many things, self described, of course: An activist, a spiritualist and a free thinker. She came to Germany because she had enough of her spoon-fed life in the U.S. So she came to Germany to discover her origins and to be fed by a silver spoon abroad. Although her bookstore doesn’t generate enough income, her being white and American, she never seem to encounter any problems with her visa.
  • Mesut Mahmut: Ah, his names meaning “Fortunate Prince”... But not really. He was named with two first names because his parents didn’t want to decide on one. He is the exact opposite of the ideal Turkish son - He is a party loving, damn-near alcoholic womanizer but most importantly – he speaks very softly. What’s even more funny is that he has ginger hair and beard. He just always looks like he’s been sleep deprived and high, even when he is not. He is an immigrant, as such relates to our duo about the struggles and hardships immigrants endure.

 

Along with these characters we have a myriad of other recurring characters with their unique stories and voices, who make up this beautiful boiling pot blend we call - Berlin. 

The World

The world we find ourselves in is the fictional and wacky version of Berlin and the world where the stereotypes are ever more stronger. Before you get mad, stereotypes are funny because it's true,... 60% of the time, every time. Don't want to spoil too much here, so we'll leave it at that.

Outside of our earth we will explore the life on our protagonists' planet The TikTikTik /pronounced dkdkdk like how a dolphin clicks/. 

  • A note on why the show is in English: I realize some of you might be asking, if it is made and based in Germany why is it not in German? Well I'll tell you why. Whether we like it or not English is the IT language. Don't believe me? Ask your child /if you have one/ or your nephews and nieces who is the coolest kid in their school... Probably the student who raps and curses in English and does TikTok videos. Also for the universal appeal, of course. 

 

How You Can Help & Your Rewards

  • We need the initial fund to get the streaming platform up and running, get a whole animation and production team and jumpstart the marketing. This is where I ask for your donations. Every little bit helps.
  • DO Check out our awesome perks, there is one for every level. From a premium account on our website to having a character modeled after your appearance. Fun stuff. 

 

We will be totally transparent about budget spending and post updates once we start spending funds, but in foresight it goes as follows:

  1. Domain/Servers: To handle ANY traffic and demand, we will be looking to secure the highest spec platform available to the budget.
  2. Animation Studio: By far the biggest spending of our budget, we will be looking to hire a talented team of animation production studio and other talents which include but not limited to: Storyboarders, a bunch of Animators and artists, Editors, Sound Designers, Art Directors, Voice Actors and a whole lot of others to make the pilot. /more episodes if we raise enough money/
  3. Business Manager: We will hire an experienced professional who is in the know-how of the streaming industry to handle potential income sources to sustain the series, and to foresee marketing and business development aspects, to grow the show and the studio. 
  4. Lawyer: We will hire an experienced media lawyer on a consulting basis to handle the licensing, media practice and all other legal stuff.

Our promise to you is that no matter how our method of income may turn out to be, one way or another our series will ALWAYS be FREE for everyone to see as long as we can afford to keep our website on.  

Even if we cannot raise the goal, we would still need every bit that we did raise so that we can begin the animation process and secure our part of the capital while still looking for a private investor to work out a partnership. 

Aim: Social Commentary

I realize you might be asking yourself "Do we need a show like this?" I certainly think we do. In a time, such as today, when there are so much division and hatred in the world we need  to learn to laugh AT ourselves, TO understand and empathize with one another. Historically, humor has always been a way for humans to better a difficult situation and ease tension, even if it meant making fun of others. More and more each day we see "Oh gee, you don't think I'm right? Do you not share my views or values, well, go hump yourself!" Cancel that, cancel this!" People's attempt to silence or "cancel" one another is a form of oppression in the digital space. There's no other way of putting it, honestly. 

Part of the reason why our show has to be on an independent platform is because of prevalence of cancel culture in our society. Networks and broadcasters are now afraid of airing some things that some people may not want to hear and will eventually try to censor the programs on their platform. 

And so I must stress, this show will contain some humor, jokes and dialogues some may consider anti-PC or Politically Incorrect. 

Aside from that, we just want to make a decent entertainment for everyone to enjoy.

The Road Ahead

Inevitably, there will be many difficulties and challenges considering that the visual medium is one of the most fragile way to entertain.

One of the most obvious problem we face is: Will people like it enough to return for future episodes?  Cause it's simple right? No viewers = No revenue = No sustenance. That question, I'm afraid, does not have a straight answer. I'm sure some people will hate it, but then again some people like cock-fights. Although what I can say with certainty is this: Our team will give everything we have got and then some, to create this show. And this is not just a blind promise. My family's livelihood and my personal integrity as a storyteller is being waged.

Worse-comes-to-worst if we have to end all operations on account of running out of funding and unable to bring on an investor /knock, knock, knock on wood/  we will release all available materials such as animated parts, behind the scenes, drawings, artworks etc, online. 

But the bottom line is, this is your product, paid for and by you, and we will not stop until we deliver your product to the best of our abilities. 

On a lighter note. IF best comes to pass and with success of the show, our studio will fund and host up-and-coming animated shows, writers and storytellers to give you even better and diverse comedy shows. 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's hard to give money away during a difficult time such as this, it's not like money grows on trees /last I checked/. What you can simply do to help us is you can spread the word with your preferred platforms, get our project noticed. Hey, you're still a fucken legend in our eyes.

story:
Will We Get There?

Competing is HARD! Breaking records is HARD! Training is EXHAUSTING! Not to mention: Travel, Lodging, Equipment, Registration Fees, and a small video crew are all EXPENSIVE. With your generosity, patronage, & sponsorship, your donations could mean the difference between nothing and 1st PLACE. 

  • Glenn Nelson & Chris Page have been competing at the Arnold Classic since 2015. 

  • Chris Page is a Navy Vet, and presently serves in the DC Fire Dept. He has previously brought home 2 Silver Medals in Sombo, and plans to bring home his first Gold Medal in Kettlebells. 

  • Glenn Nelson is a Vet & currently serves a Military Police Sergeant in the DC Army National Guard, as well as works as a Freelance Filmmaker in the DMV. He has previously brought home 1 Gold Medal in Kettlebells, and plans to bring home his 2nd.

  • This year at the Arnold Classic 2019 Sports Fest, we plan to compete once again in Men’s 2-Arm Long Cycle, with our sights on the Gold. Fitness Competition & Travel have been our passion for over a decade, and as a team, we plan to go to Columbus OH with a small film crew, document this exciting adventure, and succeed at our goals. 
  • Your contributions will make our dreams come true. They will help us with travel, lodging, registration fees, equipment costs, and paying a film crew. Not only will we bring back to GOLD, we will bring back a DOCUMENTARY. 

"If it excites you and scares you at the same time, you should do it."

What We Need & What You Get

First we need help getting equipment to train, then with registration fees, then getting to Columbus OH, then getting into the hotel, and finally filming the event while we rule the competition:

  • The 1st chunk of money is going toward the equipment needed to train with, as well as competing with. 2 sets of 16 KG Kettlebells, 2 for each Competitor. 
  • The 2nd chunk of money is basically gas money for the truck, packed with the competitors and film crew.
  • 3rd is the lodging, a hotel close to the convention center, averaging out to roughly $300 a night, as prices go up for such a momentous event in Columbus OH. 
  • 4th is the registration fees and event tickets. AKA usually charges $120 per event per category. Each competitor is entering into Men’s 2-Arm Long Cycle, 10 minutes. This competition registration usually covers the expo as well, which grants competitor access to the expo throughout the weekend, however there are additional tickets needed for the film crew. 
  • 5th is the film crew, which are being paid for the work documenting the competitors. 
  • Finally in the budget is a 10% contingency plan in case something comes up, and we always know something comes up that might bite us in the backside.

Here is the budget as it stands now:

  1. Equipment: 16kgs @ $45 X 4 = $180
  2. Gas : 417 miles to OH & back, at $.54 a mile, is $229 X 2 = $458
  3. Hotels: $300 a night X 2 = $600
  4. Registrations: $120 per competitor X 2 = $240
  5. Event Tickets: $50 X 3 Film Crew Members = $150
  6. Technical Director: $200 X 3 Days = $600
  7. CameraOp: $200 X 3 Days = $600
  8. Audio Op: $200 X 3 Days = $600
  9. 10% Contingency Plan = $342

TOTAL = $3770

We wish we had swag like most competitors & companies. We don’t, but what we will have is a documentary crew. 

  • For $1 donation, you will have access to an exclusive Blog updated daily as we train, travel, and eventually compete. Plus a “Thank You” credit in the Documentary. 
  • For $5 donation, you will have access to an exclusive Vlog, with live video updates, exclusive Twitter, Instagram, & Facebook Video segments, plus the exclusive Blog updated daily. Plus a “Special Thanks” credit in the Documentary. 
  • For $10 donation, you get a Producer Credit in the Documentary, and a Picture of you during the end credits (if you want, nothing nasty of course), with a “VERY Special Thanks” credit, not to mention the exclusive Vlog, & the exclusive Blog. 
  • For $20 donation, you get EVERYTHING mentioned above, plus, we’ll sponsor any cause or affiliation you want, within professional & appropriate reason. We’ll wear whatever logos / swag / patches / paraphernalia you want us to support.

The Impact

We are very passionate about Fitness, Competition, Traveling, and Documenting our Adventures. We are Vets, Service Members, & First Responders, and wish to bring light to those that serve before us, with us, and after us. 

  • Our dreams of competition are aimed to pay honor to our fellow Military, Firefighters, Police, & Veterans. Also working as Filmmakers & Musicians, we want to share our adventures with an outstanding high quality Documentary for the whole world to see and be inspired by. 
  • In 2015, Chris Page attended the Arnold Classic Sports Fest and competed in Sombo, and won a Silver Medal.
  • In 2016, Chris & his brother Brian returned to the Arnold, competed in Sombo, and BOTH won Silver Medals. That same day, Glenn competed in Kettlebells, 2-Arm Long Cycle, and won a Gold Medal. 
  • In 2017, Glenn returned with the Washington Wrestling Club, to document their competition in Sombo. Due to an illness, Glenn wasn’t able to compete, but instead he produced an exciting and inspiring documentary for Club. 
  • In 2019, the team is back & stronger than ever, and ready to compete for the Gold. Both Chris & Glenn are competing in Men’s 2-Arm Long Cycle, 2 x 16kgs Kettlebells. The goal is as many reps as possible in 10 minutes.

Risks & Challenges

Chris & Glenn are amateurs, we have full-time jobs and of course the day-to-day responsibilities that come along with that. Starting off as amateur competitors, they are not showered with Pro-Competitor Sponsorships, which limits the competitions they can afford to attend, not to mention the travel, room & board, fees, and everything else that comes with competing. In addition to that, the need to document the experience will require some financing as well.

  • As Vets / Service-members / First Responders, we hope to call out to our fellow companions to support us and contribute to our cause. It is to YOU that we pay honor and gratitude. If only with $1 donation, we’re $1 dollar closer to going to the Arnold. 
  • As filmmakers, we call out to our fellow filmmakers & YouTubers in the DMV to back us and help us bring home a fun & adventurous Documentary. 
  • To everyone else, if you competition, fitness, travel, adventure, or even quirky personalities, we would love you donation. Even if it’s just $1, even if it’s just sharing our campaign to all of your contacts on your social networks, we’re one more step closer to reaching our goals. 
  • We have already produced a Web Series and a Documentary from a previous adventures at the Arnold Classic, which you can view here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Spread the word, share the links, blow up your socials and as always, STAY TUNED!

Well that’s about it, we thank you all for even checking out our campaign, and can’t wait to get to the Arnold Classic in March, 2019.

The 2nd chunk of money is basically gas money for the truck, packed with the competitors and film crew.
3rd is the lodging, a hotel close to the convention center, averaging out to roughly $300 a night, as prices go up for such a momentous event in Columbus OH. 
4th is the registration fees and event tickets. AKA usually charges $120 per event per category. Each competitor is entering into Men’s 2-Arm Long Cycle, 10 minutes. This competition registration usually covers the expo as well, which grants competitor access to the expo throughout the weekend, however there are additional tickets needed for the film crew. 
5th is the film crew, which are being paid for the work documenting the competitors. 
Finally in the budget is a 10% contingency plan in case something comes up, and we always know something comes up that might bite us in the backside.

Here is the budget as it stands now:


Equipment: 16kgs @ $45 X 4 = $180

Gas : 417 miles to OH & back, at $.54 a mile, is $229 X 2 = $458

Hotels: $300 a night X 2 = $600

Registrations: $120 per competitor X 2 = $240

Event Tickets: $50 X 3 Film Crew Members = $150

Technical Director: $200 X 3 Days = $600

CameraOp: $200 X 3 Days = $600

Audio Op: $200 X 3 Days = $600

10% Contingency Plan = $342

TOTAL = $3770
We wish we had swag like most competitors & companies. We don’t, but what we will have is a documentary crew. 

For $1 donation, you will have access to an exclusive Blog updated daily as we train, travel, and eventually compete. Plus a “Thank You” credit in the Documentary. 
For $5 donation, you will have access to an exclusive Vlog, with live video updates, exclusive Twitter, Instagram, & Facebook Video segments, plus the exclusive Blog updated daily. Plus a “Special Thanks” credit in the Documentary. 
For $10 donation, you get a Producer Credit in the Documentary, and a Picture of you during the end credits (if you want, nothing nasty of course), with a “VERY Special Thanks” credit, not to mention the exclusive Vlog, & the exclusive Blog. 
For $20 donation, you get EVERYTHING mentioned above, plus, we’ll sponsor any cause or affiliation you want, within professional & appropriate reason. We’ll wear whatever logos / swag / patches / paraphernalia you want us to support.


The Impact
We are very passionate about Fitness, Competition, Traveling, and Documenting our Adventures. We are Vets, Service Members, & First Responders, and wish to bring light to those that serve before us, with us, and after us. 

Our dreams of competition are aimed to pay honor to our fellow Military, Firefighters, Police, & Veterans. Also working as Filmmakers & Musicians, we want to share our adventures with an outstanding high quality Documentary for the whole world to see and be inspired by. 
In 2015, Chris Page attended the Arnold Classic Sports Fest and competed in Sombo, and won a Silver Medal.
In 2016, Chris & his brother Brian returned to the Arnold, competed in Sombo, and BOTH won Silver Medals. That same day, Glenn competed in Kettlebells, 2-Arm Long Cycle, and won a Gold Medal. 
In 2017, Glenn returned with the Washington Wrestling Club, to document their competition in Sombo. Due to an illness, Glenn wasn’t able to compete, but instead he produced an exciting and inspiring documentary for Club. 
In 2019, the team is back & stronger than ever, and ready to compete for the Gold. Both Chris & Glenn are competing in Men’s 2-Arm Long Cycle, 2 x 16kgs Kettlebells. The goal is as many reps as possible in 10 minutes.


Risks & Challenges
Chris & Glenn are amateurs, we have full-time jobs and of course the day-to-day responsibilities that come along with that. Starting off as amateur competitors, they are not showered with Pro-Competitor Sponsorships, which limits the competitions they can afford to attend, not to mention the travel, room & board, fees, and everything else that comes with competing. In addition to that, the need to document the experience will require some financing as well.

As Vets / Service-members / First Responders, we hope to call out to our fellow companions to support us and contribute to our cause. It is to YOU that we pay honor and gratitude. If only with $1 donation, we’re $1 dollar closer to going to the Arnold. 
As filmmakers, we call out to our fellow filmmakers & YouTubers in the DMV to back us and help us bring home a fun & adventurous Documentary. 
To everyone else, if you competition, fitness, travel, adventure, or even quirky personalities, we would love you donation. Even if it’s just $1, even if it’s just sharing our campaign to all of your contacts on your social networks, we’re one more step closer to reaching our goals. 
We have already produced a Web Series and a Documentary from a previous adventures at the Arnold Classic, which you can view here.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools! Spread the word, share the links, blow up your socials and as always, STAY TUNED!

Well that’s about it, we thank you all for even checking out our campaign, and can’t wait to get to the Arnold Classic in March, 2019.

story:
Short Summary

We created Black Wall Street Burning, telling the story of the 1921 massacre in Tulsa, OK’s Greenwood district. With the series we are looking to layout just how prosperous this community was and we want to do it in a live drama.

This community housed luxury shops, a bank, multiple grocery stores, night clubs, movie theater, private planes and so much more in the early 1900’s. This community was home too many black millionaires, doctors, lawyers, and other entrepreneurs that increased the net worth of Tulsa to that which could potentially revival wall street.

This place was Wakanda before there was a Wakanda. It is our duty to show our children and even ourselves what that looked like in live action. Our hope is that this can be an inspiration to get us back to such a place. 

This series will showcase prosperity in a community of black people like no other. A hidden history wrapped with prestige and with challenges from their wroth white counterparts.

 

What We Need & What You Get

It is our goal to bring Black Wall Street series to life on your TV, phone, tablet, and computer. In order to make all of this happen we will need to raise at minimum $1.5 million dollars and you can become a part of history by helping us fund this project. We will need to rent camera equipment and lenses, lights and other filming gear. Also, we will need to hire multiple crews to man the cameras, sound, lighting and grips. Computer Generated Images (CGI) will also be need to create the cities to give an authentic look of the 1900s. We will need budget for actors/actresses, wardrobe, make up and hair. Locations will be a big part of the budget along with Travel, we plan to film as much of the series as possible in Tulsa, but those parts that need to be filmed else where will need finances.

Here are some of the raw numbers and why we need your help to bring this incredible story:

  • 2 Arri Alex Mini Camera kit rental  -  $15,712 
  • Arri Cine Lense Kit Rental  -  $27,669 
  • Camera Crew  -  $30,000
  • Lighting Crew (Gaffer)  -  $20,000
  • Sound Crew  -  $30,000
  • Computer Generated Images - $50,000
  • Locations & Travel - $100,000
  • Set Design - $250,000
  • Advertising  - $300,000
  • Post Production - $75,000

This is just a few of the cost that we have to take care of to make this the production what it needs to be to tell the history that has been hidden for so long.

 

The Impact

As many of you know who have seen the film Black Wall Street Burning, the impact that it has had on people both young and old. For so many it has been an eye opener, for others a long awaited truth that has been brought to light. That project barely scratched the surface of tell this story. This story although ends in tragedy, it is a story of great triumph, pride, and prosperity. A story like none told to little black faces that will transform generations. Your dollars will be spend on educating generations to come with a live action production geared towards entertainment wrap with true American history.

Risks & Challenges

Just like anything we do in life, we all face challenges and this is no different. I suspect we will get push back from people who do not want to see this kind of project brought to light. However, we will silence them by coming together to make our voice heard. The more of you we have behind this project the hard it will be for anyone to stop us. We will mitigate our risk by not using real names of people unless we have received consent to do so, for this is a touchy subject and we will respect all parties that were involved.

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are a few other ways you can help also:

  • Get the word out! Tell everyone you know, every dollar counts!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

The Series:

The series follows a book of witchcraft (The Grimoire) as it's passed on through time and space, leaving a significant impact on all of those who interact with it. In season 1, we meet "The Grimmies" (the lead cast) who are given the responsibility to keep the Grimoire safe and use its powers against the dark forces. Well, considering it's a book of ancient sorcery with unknown origins, coveted by many, the Grimmies were bound to come across a few shenanigans. All 12 episodes of season 1, including a prequel short film and a holiday special, were released on Youtube.

For season 2, we expand the Grimoire universe, traveling back and forth through time to explore the untold stories of those who have come across this book and how their lives were forever changed. It's scarier, it's funnier, and it's great entertainment for teens and adults.

Season 2 has already started principle photography!

We get things done, regardless of our budget, and we love the work we do. We would love your help so we can continue filming and deliver something with Great quality!

Our Purpose:

Season 1 was about fantasy. Season 2 is where the fantasy meets real life. We've new relatable stories that shine a light on real life issues (social, political, cultural and more), and we need your help to make the magic happen. Each episode this season is a standalone storyline with new actors, new themes and new experiences; it's an anthology of short films that eventually connect one way or another, leading up to a climatic conclusion.

As independent filmmakers, we also want to create collaborative job opportunities for creative people all around the nation.  This series started as a workshop for film students, and has since evolved to an international interactive experience, connecting actors and filmmakers all around the world.

Although the series will still air on our Youtube channel, Sultanic Entertainment, we are hoping to pitch it to a few networks in hopes of getting it picked up (we didn't pitch season 1 because our low budget restricted us from doing everything we hoped to do with production). Either way, we want to hear everyone's thoughts on this new season, and we'd love to continue with a season 3 eventually.

What We Need & What You Get

The Elementals (Funds):

We need to fund the basics... Actors and Filmmakers are giving their time and effort, they need to be paid and fed. Gear, props and wardrobe need to be transported to various sets. Some locations require payment. Lastly, we're hoping to collaborate with more music composers and CGI artists from all over, they need to be compensated for their work.

The Rewards (Perks):

Give a little magic, get some magic back! We've all sorts of special treats for our contributors, from shoutouts to early access to new episodes to to comic books to signed scripts to prop replicas to CGI tutorials to graphic design/videography services and more.

Get access to some exclusive limited merchandise, including a DVD boxset with special features including Deleted Scenes, Blooper Reels and Sneak Peaks behind the scenes of Grimoire. Get a specially printed physical copy of the upcoming Comic Book Series that takes place between seasons 1 & 2.

All funds go towards creating a wholesome experience. Not reaching our budget goal means less scripts, which means less actors, less stories and less episodes. With a flexible budget goal, we're hoping to film between 8-9 new episodes (each episode would be between 12-25 minutes) during the months of June/July, with the season premiere date in either October/November of this year, giving us enough time to submit the episodes for a Festival run.

The Impact

Why This Show Matters:

We're constantly striving to promote diversity, equality and social justice. We want to have a more ethnically diverse lead cast, more minorities, more characters of various backgrounds, beliefs, sexual orientations and social perspectives.

This season dabbles with some serious and sensitive issues in life that still create conflict till this day. Our intention is not to "give answers", but simply to suggest new takes on these stories. Some of our new themes include Racism, Alcoholism, Homophobia, Islamophobia, PTSD, Domestic Violence, Sexism and Agism. Yes, the series is undergoing a big makeover, taking a darker turn and tackles important matters in a new and original way.

 

Our Track Record:

Season 1 was all out-of-pocket, all of the money went into crafty, gear, transportation and props. No one got paid, yet we still give our best efforts to make the show happen, and of course it did, now streaming on Youtube and Roku. With no professional equipment, limited crew (sometimes no crew at all) and a messy schedule, we created magic, wrapping up 10 full episodes in Philadelphia PA, and becoming a well-established supernatural/fantasy web series in the city, later expanding to the US and now Los Angeles, CA.

We want to do more, give more, create more, and we want you to be part of the process from start to finish. You're not just contributing to the budget, you're part of the team, a member of the Grimoire family. This series was made for you, so take part in creating it!

Risks & Challenges

In case we don't reach our goal, we'll still film the series, but a smaller budget means less scripts, less actors, and more time to finish post production. We managed to do it for season 1 but we want season 2 to be better!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you're unable to contribute, but here are a few alternatives that can really help:

1. Spread The Word: Tell your friends, family, coworkers, neighbors, everyone you know about this project. You might find some who would like to contribute.

2. Follow us on Social Media:

  • Facebook: www.Facebook.com/GrimoireWebSeries (Like Us) The more likes we get, the more discoverable our page/posts will be. 
  • Instagram: @GrimoireWebSeries (Follow Us) Instagram has helped us gain new fans, and we'd love to welcome more.
  • Youtube: Sultanic Entertainment (Subscribe) Help us reach more subscribers so that we can start monetizing our videos. 

3. Use the Indiegogo Share Tools: Share this page and all our social media links.

4. Watch The Series: Season 1 is available for FREE on Youtube. You're welcome to watch, comment, like, share. If you're a Youtuber (or Vlogger in general) do some episode reactions to help promote the show.

5. Become Part of the Fandom: If you're a Grimoire fan, do what all fans do nowadays. Talk about the show, write about it, draw about it. Create fan art and share it. Recreate some of your favorite moments from the show. Tell us and everyone what characters you love, what characters you love to hate. Write/record episode reviews. Read and promote our upcoming comics. Dress in cosplay and tag us! Your love for the show will make it grow, enjoy and let the whole world know.

story:
Par ko ir stāsts?

Mūsdienu Latvijā gandrīz katras pilsētas ainavas neatņemama sastāvdaļa ir laimētava. Ar šo vilinošo nosaukumu, tā aicina katru garām ejošo iegriezties un saņemt savu balvu. 

Šogad 18. novembrī mūsu valsts atzīmē savu simto dzimšanas dienu. Tik apaļā jubilejā dāvanai jābūt īpašai! Ir jāpasniedz pats dārgākais - mūsu nauda! Taču ar mūsu naudu ir par maz. Tēvzeme ir pelnījusi vairāk! Četri spēlmaņi ir gatavi doties ceļā uz Latvijas laimētavām un cīnīties par lielākajiem dārgumiem, kurus pasniegt savai tēvijai šajos svētkos. Ar finansiālu atbalstu Jūs palīdzēsiet mums kopā īstenot šo ceļojumu un parādīt to uz Jūsu ekrāniem.

 

Kur aizies Jūsu nauda?

Lai iemūžinātu šo braucienu, ir nepieciešami līdzekļi, kopā - 2018 eiro! Tie vajadzīgi mikroautobusa īrei, filmēšanas komandai un viņu dienišķai iztikai, kā arī pašam galvenajam - naudai, kuru likt uz spēles!

 

Kad sāksim un cik ilgs būs ceļojums?

Ceļu plānojam uzsākt 1. oktobrī, bet pabeigt pirms Latvijas jubilejas, lai 18. novembrī svinīgā atmosfērā varam veikt laimesta pārskaitījumu Valsts Kasē.

 

Paveiksim ko īpašu!

Ja vēlaties atbalstīt projektu, lūdzu ziedojiet tā uzņemšanai kā arī pastāstiet par šo kampaņu savā ģimenē, draugu lokā, un sociālajos tīklos!

story:
Fantasy Soft Entertainment

Fantasy Soft Entertainment is in the business of inspiring a generation. With our unique, creative, and fresh ideas, we believe we can do just that. Like us, no matter who you are, no matter where you are, you can do the impossible. You can live in a world where fantasy becomes a reality.

In 2015, we released Prince Adventures: Anointed, a short film that introduced the world to the next big fantasy!


In 2017, we released Prince Adventures: Genesis, the first comic in the series, which acts as the prologue to the series! You can buy it here: https://bit.ly/2N5KXD0.



In 2018, we released Prince Adventures: Deliverance, the first light novel in the series! This book official sets up the main story! You can buy it here: https://bit.ly/2N5KXD0.

This Fall, we're going to release Prince Adventures: Wrath of the Albino Soul Minion, the second light novel in the series, and the last book before the animated series!

Next Fall, we want to release the first season, 13 episodes, of Prince Adventures, OR the first episode along with our streaming service Potarii!

Lord Satan is jealous of the Creator's power and so the two strike a bargain. If the people of Orion remain faithful to God, Satan will be banished for a time. If, within seven years time, he can turn the seven kingdoms to his side, he will be given dominion over the world. The Adversary stands ready to strike with the powers of Hell ready to do his bidding, but first he must overcome The Trinity.

Prince Adventures is specifically designed to be viewed by adults and therefore may be unsuitable for children under 17.

Go to https://www.prince-adventures.com/characters to read the bios of Prince Han, Nai, Akil, and Lord Satan!

With this campaign, we're shooting two birds with one stone. With your help, we will start a brand new video streaming service. We call it... P O T A R I I. If all goes according to plan, Prince Adventures will be its first orginal series. For more info, visit http://potarii.com/.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $800,000 to fully produce the first episode of Prince Adventures, and launch our streaming service Potarii. Here are the numbers:

  • Pre-production | $360,000 (assets, character design, storyboarding)
  • Production | $264,000 (animation)
  • Post-production | $82,240 (sound design, music, recording)
  • Potarii | 17,988 (hosting)
  • Unknown | $75,772 (advertising and marketing, travel and stay, emergencies)

Rewards:

  • EVERY DONOR GETS A CREDIT IN THE FIRST EPISODE!
  • EVERY DONOR GETS A BEHIND THE SCENES LOOK AT THE MAKING OF EPISODE 1!
  • Prince Adventures books!
  • Prince Adventures Poster!
  • Episode one soundtrack!
  •  Thank you voicemail!
  • More!

Cast & Crew

Prince Adventures has a stellar cast & crew so far!:


Roc Chen | Composer

 
Iced Blade | Theme

 

Cast & Crew Credits

Risks

This is an all-or-nothing campaign. So, we're either going to raise the money or not. If we do, some risks to the production may include:

  • Delays.
  • Act of God.
  • Losing cast & crew.
  • Deaths (hey, it happens)
  • Technical difficulties.
  • Scheduling issues.
  • Others.

THANK YOU!

For a small studio, we've come a long way. We ask that you help us create our next chapter. Remember, big things have small beginnings.
story_txt:
Fantasy Soft Entertainment

Fantasy Soft Entertainment is in the business of inspiring a generation. With our unique, creative, and fresh ideas, we believe we can do just that. Like us, no matter who you are, no matter where you are, you can do the impossible. You can live in a world where fantasy becomes a reality.
In 2015, we released Prince Adventures: Anointed, a short film that introduced the world to the next big fantasy!

In 2017, we released Prince Adventures: Genesis, the first comic in the series, which acts as the prologue to the series! You can buy it here: https://bit.ly/2N5KXD0.
In 2018, we released Prince Adventures: Deliverance, the first light novel in the series! This book official sets up the main story! You can buy it here: https://bit.ly/2N5KXD0.

This Fall, we're going to release Prince Adventures: Wrath of the Albino Soul Minion, the second light novel in the series, and the last book before the animated series!

Next Fall, we want to release the first season, 13 episodes, of Prince Adventures, OR the first episode along with our streaming service Potarii!
Lord Satan is jealous of the Creator's power and so the two strike a bargain. If the people of Orion remain faithful to God, Satan will be banished for a time. If, within seven years time, he can turn the seven kingdoms to his side, he will be given dominion over the world. The Adversary stands ready to strike with the powers of Hell ready to do his bidding, but first he must overcome The Trinity.
 Prince Adventures is specifically designed to be viewed by adults and therefore may be unsuitable for children under 17.


Go to https://www.prince-adventures.com/characters to read the bios of Prince Han, Nai, Akil, and Lord Satan!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Tasha Neal-Harris, the Creator and Director and Candace Wright, the Filmmaker, Editor and Co-Director. Together we have over 30 years of experience in writing, theater, acting and 10 years of filmmaking and editing.

We LOVE being creative and expressing all the crazy ideas in our heads! Our latest idea is a youth-driven, creepy comedy web series called The Wicked Imagination of a Teenage Kid! We have already created episode 1 and with your help, we can create the remaining 5 episodes for the first season! With this funding, we can continue to pitch to streaming sites like Netflix, Hulu and Amazon. We can also have more content to pitch to TV networks like TV One, ABC, NBC, TBS and more! We know that working with the youth is more than rewarding and this will provide positive content for our youth!

What is the Wicked Imagination of a Teenage Kid?

J.C. is a youngster who has a trait passed down to him. That trait is, that he can't eat before he goes to sleep, or whatever he sees before he goes to sleep, will come to life.......in a CREEPY WAY!  The only way that he and his friends can make the creepy things go away, is to drive them back into his imagination.  They can try to get him back to sleep, but if that doesn't work.....what will they do???  Will his imagination lead to his final bed time story??  Best thing to do is beware, and not let him fall asleep after he eats.......or something may eat you!

 

Episode 1 featured a kid eating teacher....

The episodes we are seeking funding for are;

Episode 2 is the praying mantis - A giant "praying" mantis comes to life and captures people and makes them bow down and pray to him. If they don't he will devour them.  How will J.C. and his friends stop the town from all becoming worshiping zombies to a power drunk bug that has a hilarious Arnold Schwarzenegger accent?

Episode 3 - BY DEMAND AND REQUEST.....we have cheerleaders vs vampire zombies....the name says it all.....

Episode 4 - Dentist of doom...............J.C. falls asleep in the dentist office and now his dentist is attacking people with a giant needle

Episode 5 - Animal switch up - What happens when animals have us on the menu?

Episode 6 - (You name an episode you want....if you pick the right perk).

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

So what are we asking for you say? Well, just 15, 000 to get us started! 

We appreciate your consideration and understand how valuable your dollars are! So what will we do with your contribution?

  • Most of the budget will go for Pre and Post-production
    • Sci-Fi Makeup
    • Costumes
    • Locations
    • Traveling
    • Special Effects/Color Grading
  • Actor and Crew compensation
    • We value everyone's times and efforts and would like to provide some compensation for them.
    • Currently, Candace filmed and Edited the first episode on her own. We need some help for the next five!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will make a dollar stretch! We will still need the above-mentioned items. We created the first episode with no budget, so we know how to work our finances!

The Impact

You help us help the youth!

We should understand how important the arts are in the world. Without it, we are mindless robots :O! Yes, it's true! We want to continue to inspire more creativity in kids and allow them to express themselves through film!

Going through the first episode, the actors and actresses were so excited and happy on set. They were learning a lot, not only about acting but about teamwork, critical thinking, being confident, pushing past fear and not being afraid to make mistakes. These are lifelong skills they will carry with them through their adult years!

Risks & Challenges

When's the last time you did something brave that had no risk? Right.

We more than understand that the goals and dreams we possess, especially in the entertainment industry will only be accomplished by hard work, long nights and early mornings. We have both been there and done that...several times. Being multiple business owners, parents, students, sisters and more, we know adversity and how to come out on the other side. 

We have heard no, have been turned down, have been underestimated through our lives. On the other side, we have had many success, triumphs, and accomplishments when we make it past those challenges. 

In order to get this on a network, we may not get Yes right away. So? We keep going. We will find the network that believes in us as much as we do and make it work! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! I'm sure you know someone who knows someone who knows someone who would love to contribute and help give our youth creative and positive content!

THANKS SO MUCH!!

TASHA and CANDACE

story:
Short Summary

It's short and sweet: we got a bunch of amazing actors to help us out while I begin my journey of being a real animator, and not a bump on a log calling myself outrageous nonsense like "Director" and "Executive Producer". that's right: Keith is finally teaching me how to be useful, and our new show is going to be the centerpiece of that education!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need about $1500 per episode. However, we got episode 1 covered! So this is really for episode 2! This will cover the (currently) nominal salaries of the voice actors, and the acquisition of art assets from my good artist friend, Handerson Soares (we call him "Oshigan" around the Studio). I'm doing 80-90% of the assets myself, and I have a background artist queued up on DeviantArt who will assist us further. It's a solid team, but I do not intend to pay myself directly. I hope to get YouTube to handle that part when we finally acquire "Partner Status".
  • Actors include Carey Means (Frylock of "Aqua Teen Hunger Force"), Sammi Bold, Loran Bolding, Kaylie Horsley, Joelle Aliana Ferguson, Jenna Sharpe, Julie Shields, Keith Wood, and a bevy of guest stars, like my good friend Clare Halstead, Lec Zorn, Shelby Iacometti and many, many more. All of them incredibly skilled actors who are ready to get to work bringing this to life.

  •  

  • Since this is a smaller campaign, contributors will get some fun stuff: shoutouts from our live podcast, mentions in the credits, downloadable PDFs of the scripts and more! Large contributors will receive an "Associate Producer" credit.
  • No matter how much we get, it will go into production, and you'll still get your perks, because they are digital. So no mailing, no hidden costs. 

The Impact

It's plain and simple, as I said in the video: I want to learn new skills, but hate the antiseptic environment of a classroom. So Keith is teaching me the needed programs on-the-fly. We already have 1/6 of the first episode completed, and Oshi is busting hump to get me the last assets for a few scenes. But again, 80-90% of this is me. And for YEARS, I've lacked the confidence to do this all on my own. I always felt like an impostor with my art. This is my therapy. And, if I succeed, I can help with production of the vastly more polished and expensive "Starship Moonhawk" series so we may actually release more than an episode fragment each year. Seriously, everyone wins here.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is simply that I won't have the time or finances to make a 6-10 minute episode every month because I'm scrambling to pay for all of it, and somehow maintain our household on Uber and Lyft and the occasional commissions alone. That would be tragic, because did I mention we are working with CAREY MEANS OF AQUA TEEN HUNGER FORCE? I shoulda led with that...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Show Summary

Sean O’Dell is a white man that grew up heavily influenced by the black culture. His earliest friend exposed him to hip-hop, black-led films, and at times, the struggles of the black community. Sean continued to explore the black culture throughout his life, gaining more insight and understanding from those closest to him. With the help of some of his friends, Seven Da Pantha, Orlando “Sikk” Simmons, and “MrInfoPhilly” Steve Smith, Sean will explore different communities to learn about the struggles, the victories, the pride, and the fear of living as a person of color in the United States.

They will travel the nation, with each season focusing on a different area of the country, to interview experts and discuss past events that have shaped our present, as well as current events that will someday shape our future. Through immersion into the lives of their guests, interviews, and roundtable discussions between their guests and the cast, they will not only learn about events in black culture, but also how they impact the lives of the community.

This series will give an in-depth view into the black culture that no series has ever given before. Not only will it bridge the gap between races, but it will also provide a window to members of the black community to see how their brothers and sisters live across the nation.

 

    The Impact of Your Contribution

    Your contribution will help this show become a reality, but more than that, it will help build understanding and respect across the world. In November, 2020, we shot the first episode of the Cultureless Series, the first short film, Justice For All, recorded the first podcast, and have started filming on episode 2 of the series.

    We were honored to be accepted into the Seattle Film Summit where we were placed in the top three of the Pitch Panel Finals. We had the chance to pitch to some truly great minds in the business and were recognized for the concept and spirit of the show.

    Cultureless has seen these early successes with absolutely no initial investment. All expenses
    have been paid out of pocket by Sean and Seven, as well as the blood, sweat, and dedication of
    our cast and crew to make a great show.

    What We Need & What You Get

    Here are just a few of the areas that your contributions will support:

    • Production Costs
    • Post Production and Editing
    • Advertising
    • Travel and Expenses
    • Equipment Rental

    Due to the show being on-going, the necessity of show funding is unlimited. We have, however, determined season 1 to cost approximately $100,000 to ensure we can continue the first season with the same passion and depth that we have given so far. We have started this campaign at $1,000 to ensure we can keep the campaign moving forward with stretch goals. We believe this journey deserves nothing less than our best, and with your contribution, we can provide that.

    Your contribution will not go unappreciated. To show our gratitude we have constructed multiple tiers of contribution and the tiers are stacked. This means that if you donate at the third tier contribution, you will also receive the thank you gifts for tiers 1 and 2. 

    It is important to us that each and every one of our contributors is recognized for their support, so no matter what tier you donate at, your name will be featured in a Special Thanks section in the credits of the final episode. As the tiers go higher you will enjoy access to exclusive content, special live meetings with the cast, exclusive access to an unreleased episode, and even a chance to be a part of the show!

    Risks & Challenges

    The world is facing two very real threats right now that have a significant impact on the show. The first, a pandemic. Of course, it has effected our ability to shoot new content, but we have not let it stop us. Utilizing video conferencing and social distancing live interview techniques, we have maintained a real and very impactful narrative for the show. We will continue to be creative with our raw shooting style to give the best show we can give.

    The second threat that we have faced is the very public and consistent trend of racial injustice in the United States. We would be foolish to think that this would not effect our message. Some fight to burn the bridge that we are attempting to build. The single biggest combatant to this blatant racism is bravery. We will not allow our message to be silenced by the prejudices of others and we will not allow the show the fail.

    Our only other challenge is funding. There are so many different aspects to a television show, and we have funded every one of them out-of-pocket thus far. With your help, we will triumph this obstacle as well. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, we completely understand that. Money is tight for many people and we do not want you to contribute anything that you cannot spare. If you are interested in our project, but cannot contribute monetarily, please consider sharing our campaign with others. Not only will this bring new attention to the campaign, but to the show as well. So, your voice could bring funding to the show and a new level of understanding to your community. To both, we say thank you.
     

    --Cultureless

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

This YouTube series follows two young college students that meet and eventually fall in love. This series is one of drama, comedy, romance, tragedy and everything in between. It shows the true meaning of friendship and love!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The funds that we make from this will provide equipment. Camera, Copyrights, Musical Instruments, promotional items, and incentives for the cast. 
  • If we don’t hit goal, the funds will still be used to get the stuff we need for the production.

The Impact

One night me and my friend James found this amazing song about a couple that grew there love and then a bad tragedy happened which lead the fiancé in the hospital only hours to live, The fiancée come to the hospital and calls in the nurses to get the priest to marry them before he dies because there love is forever. 

We thought about it for years, then James got an idea and called me, he said why don’t we make this is to a short script for a theater production, we did and unfortunately it didn’t go anywhere. So we thought about it and we both came up with a back story that lead up to where the song competes. 

We were so excited that we started to cast and start production immediately. Our Cast is amazing and there dedication to this production is amazing!  We ask for your help to see our production come to life. You wont regret when donating.

 

Finally, If you can’t donate, we understand! We know it a rough time these days, if you can just help us get the word out about the series it will help a lot! 

 

Thank you so much, 

From the Cast and Crew of Forever and Always

CAJM Productions
story_txt:
Short Summary
This YouTube series follows two young college students that meet and eventually fall in love. This series is one of drama, comedy, romance, tragedy and everything in between. It shows the true meaning of friendship and love!

What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

The funds that we make from this will provide equipment. Camera, Copyrights, Musical Instruments, promotional items, and incentives for the cast. 
If we don’t hit goal, the funds will still be used to get the stuff we need for the production.


The Impact
One night me and my friend James found this amazing song about a couple that grew there love and then a bad tragedy happened which lead the fiancé in the hospital only hours to live, The fiancée come to the hospital and calls in the nurses to get the priest to marry them before he dies because there love is forever. 
We thought about it for years, then James got an idea and called me, he said why don’t we make this is to a short script for a theater production, we did and unfortunately it didn’t go anywhere. So we thought about it and we both came up with a back story that lead up to where the song competes. 
We were so excited that we started to cast and start production immediately. Our Cast is amazing and there dedication to this production is amazing!  We ask for your help to see our production come to life. You wont regret when donating.

 
Finally, If you can’t donate, we understand! We know it a rough time these days, if you can just help us get the word out about the series it will help a lot! 
 
Thank you so much, 
From the Cast and Crew of Forever and Always
CAJM Productions

story:
Summary

For the past 8 months, I’ve been sharing what I’ve learned in 27 years of art study with each of you through my Facebook Live videos.  I’ve been honored and astounded by the reception these videos have received – often with over 3,000 of you tuning in to enjoy the live videos.   It has brought me an incredible amount of joy.  Through the process, I got the idea to develop this into something more, and have collaborated with Emmy-award winning producers to develop a TV show concept called "Paint Your Adventure.”  The theme of the show will be all about capturing the heart and soul of plein air painting (painting in the outdoors), while exploring adventure and honoring and preserving our nation’s parks and natural areas.  

Recently, I shared that I am a cancer survivor. Getting into the outdoors to paint and explore has had healing and inspirational benefits for me, and I want to share that experience on a broader spectrum.  

In order to make this possible, I’ll need your support.  I’m looking to raise $25,000 to fund a Pilot episode and sizzle reel of “Paint Your Adventure” which we will use to present the concept to distributors… which means that if everyone who has been enjoying my videos donated just $10, we’d easily reach our goal!  

My vision for the full series is about embracing the beauty of nature by plein air painting coupled with the adventure offered at specific locations - from horseback riding in the Rocky Mountains to hiking the Grand Canyon, to kayaking, camping and exploring Hawaii Volcanoes National Park and so on!  It’s part art instruction, part travel, part adventure.

I'd love to raise enough to allow for guests to come along this adventure with me.   Sometimes that guest may be a seasoned professional artist sharing inspiration and conversation, or the guest may be a beginner, ready to explore the joys of painting in the great outdoors for the first time.  I want to encourage others to realize the possibility of discovering a the joy and experience of painting en plein air, and discovering a new adventure that awaits!

What We Need & What You Get

We have two options for filming this Pilot and sizzle. Jeremy Salo, Emmy-winning producer of “Your Brush with Nature” on Netflix has teamed up with me to create this series.  He and his crew are based in Michigan, and for $25,000 we could shoot in the beautiful Great Lakes area, so I set the fundraising goal at $25K.  However, if we are able to raise closer to $50,000, we can film this pilot in Whitefish, Montana at Glacier National Park, which- of course would be nothing short of epic!  I’ll be in Whitefish, Montana this July doing a live painting demo at the Sunti World Art Gallery, and could film in Montana during that time.  We would need the extra funds to cover travel and accommodation costs for the crew, location fees, etc.

I am very excited about this opportunity to bring this to the world and since I am asking you for help, it is not without incentive, so I’m giving my art to top donors to thank them for their help in achieving this goal!

I will be gifting original plein air oil paintings that I have done to top donors:

$500 donated – an original 8" x 10" oil painting.

$1,000 donated – an original  "11 x 14" oil painting. 

$2,000 donated - an original 16" x 20" oil painting. 

And if you are one of those amazing souls who would like to donate $5,000, I will send you a very large spectacular landscape oil painting, approximately 24’’ x 48.” 

All things considered, if everyone that has enjoyed one of my videos gave just $10, it would more than help us get the ball rolling on this fantastic journey.  

The Impact

I’ve shared the experience of plein air painting with my 10 year old daughter, and we have created incredible memories together.  As a cancer survivor, I would also love the possibility of offering interested children of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital the opportunity to paint along with me in the restorative ambiance of nature, and feel the joy of creating a painting outside!

  • As a contributor to this project you will be helping this vision of inspiring people to get out and enjoy nature, respect and preserve our nation's natural areas, and find the renewing qualities of capturing a moment with brush and paint in the heart of stunning natural scenery.  
  • My current instructional videos have been enjoyed thousands of times by viewers and continue to grow in popularity, thus spreading the inspiration and rejuvenating qualities of being surrounded by nature, and keeping the Plein Air Movement thriving and alive.
  • Join us in creating an inspirational and exciting gateway into the world of outdoor painting and exploration!

Other Ways You Can Help

We have one month to raise the funds, as we aim to shoot this in early summer.  If you feel inspired to share this with your friends who might like to support the arts, please do.
