story:
"SUPPORT THE ARTS"

 

MUSIC, COMEDY AND ACTING NEED2KNOW SHOWS

Daniel, Samira and Sean met whilst working in the Arts industry, then COVID-19 hit, and whilst initially being put on furlough they were made redundant from their jobs. They didn’t want to sit around, so with Daniel’s 25 years’ experience in the Production/Campaigns, Samira’s 20 years in Business and Sean’s 15-year career in Media, they all put their heads together and saw how hard the Arts sector has suffered and simply wanted to ‘Support the Arts’. This led to the creation of the Need2Know shows in Music, Comedy and Acting. Through their support for all the workers and industry people they want the Arts to come back fighting.

Back in March 2020, when Covid-19 hit and the country went into full lockdown, Ronan (Elvis Costello’s younger brother) instigated ‘Artists4NHS’ as his wife was a nurse and he wanted to help and raise money for her fellow workers. He didn’t have a platform to support this, and as Daniel. Samira and Sean were in the early stages of setting up digital entertainment channel ‘Switchbox TV’ they decided to join forces and release Artists4NHS on Switchbox TV’s YouTube channel. Collectively they helped raise millions towards the final total for the NHS front line staff.

Ronan, who is Switchbox TV's Head of Music, is a musician himself, Ronan, just like many other artists had a huge number of gigs cancelled due to the pandemic. The music industry along with theatre, television and film is suffering that's why the Need2Know shows are an important vehicle to keep arts in the forefront of people’s minds. Since its inception, Ronan has gone on to interviews stars from all corners of the globe.

Need2Know Music Show – Unsigned and Signed Musicians - hosted by established singer Ronan McManus (younger brother of Elvis Costello)

Need2Know Acting Show – Up-and-coming Actors and established Actors - hosted by a respected Sky TV Presenter Rob McCaffrey

Need2Know Comedy Show – Up-and-coming and established comedians - hosted by a television personality and stand-up comic Joe Rooney aka Father Damo from (Father Ted)

 

WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO AFTER COVID

When the rules are more relaxed, we will bring all the shows to the studio where the production value will be higher. We will also be looking at the possibility of doing these interviews/gigs from musicians/comedians in front of a live studio audience. We will also be looking at putting on a live Acting Masterclass. All of these will be live and streamed through our YouTube Channel.

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH YOUR MONEY

PRODUCTION BUDGET BREAKDOWN

 

 

WHATS IN IT FOR YOU?

We’re grateful for every pound put forward and are looking forward to expressing that gratitude through these perks!

 

WHY ARE WE CROWDFUNDING?

In an ever-changing landscape of Film and TV, more and more people are taking matters into their own hands and watching content online. We're constantly inspired by filmmakers who fiercely protect their creative integrity. Doing this crowdfunding campaign our budget allows us to do exactly that. We want to remind creatives and audiences alike that there's always interest — and room — for great content. 

 

Here you will not only “Support the Arts” you will also be showing your belief in us and what we can achieve for you.

 

We’re grateful to take this route because it gives us more creative freedom and the ability to take you on that journey with us — every step of the way. Our perks will provide you with updates and opportunities to....

                                                               

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Launching a channel that produces and licenses its content is an expensive business – but you’ll be glad to know that a lot of the heavy lifting has already been completed.  The team is uniquely experienced to be able to successfully deliver great content – as well as all of the other technical and creative aspects of this project.  We’re going to make the funds we receive stretch as far as possible to make the best online content.

 

WHAT WE HAVE ACHIEVED SO FAR

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t support us with pounds then your enthusiasm and support is equally valuable - Tweet, Facebook, Linkedin, this project as much as you can. Don’t be afraid to use morse code or smoke signals. Talk about it with friends and associates at work, spreading the word about the campaign is just as important!

We’re so thankful for any support you can offer during our campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Ex British Army Military Police Detective and private security veteran, Logan McDonnell retired to Bali after fifteen years protecting Russian oligarchs and minsters, and several Indonesian generals, followed by a very successful spell as  a venture capitalist. Opening his own bar, he anticipated a relaxed life on the Island of the Gods. But some people are born magnets for trouble...

 

Unfortunately his eclectic clientele including newly qualified rookie detective, twenty-one year old Maya:

Russian gym owner, Viktor:

two ever-searching veteran surfers Lance and Bob:

and feuding bar staff Eka and Novi:

make his life a non stop comedy of errors, misunderstandings and sometimes violent conflicts, exacerbated by the occasional unsavoury characters re-emerging from Logan's past lives...

I'm so looking forward to making this ongoing online series about the life of these crazy characters at Logan's Bar in Bali.

I live here in Bali and have so many funny and scary stories to include in episodes that we can keep the audience amused and excited for years to come.

You're invited to be a part of what will become a Bali legend, set in a location that will be the 'must see' spot in Bali as visitors are invited to be real life cast members, as patrons of Logan's Bar, in the actual episodes as we shoot them.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need about US$5,000 to fund the first episode and to guarantee we'll continue onward with the first series. We have a (NetFlix approved) camera, sound and lighting set up, we have the bar, and we're busy casting. We just need the money to pay for transport, food, that kind of thing and of course, to make our set Covid-safe!

Contributors jump straight to the front of the viewing line with a free download and can elect to appear in an episode at their convenience when we're shooting!

The Impact of your help:

Your contribution will make the difference between 'go' and 'no go'. I can only organise so much for free and nobody works if you don't feed them and keep them safe. So food and safety are paramount, which needs a bit of cash to organise.

I've made several films in Indonesia and Bali in particular, including the award winning and Oscar qualifying 'The Bottom Turn' short, several members of the cast of which will be joining us in The Bar, including Best Actress award winner and Indonesian Junior Surf Champion, Cinta Hansel (daughter of legend Bruce Hansel) and Best Supporting Actor winner Troy Arrington.

It's been a horrible year and it'd be great to get working again and provide some distraction and maybe some payment to a desperate and broke bunch of people on a locked down island that's 70% dependent on tourism...

Risks & Challenges

It's a tough time for all so it's challenging to raise money for projects like this right now but we're not asking for much to get started and the biggest thing people need in their lives right now is some positivity and a good laugh.

We're all set to do this; we have a team here all eager to go; join us and let's do this!

If you're broke right now  or being extra careful with what you have, I totally understand. Please help us by getting this out to everyone you know as there are some people out there who've been luckier financially - perhaps with a secure job - and they'd like to help the rest of us in some way!

story:
Welcome to the official pitch for the new live game show that will take Pittsburgh by storm... Ready, Set, Geek!

Ready, Set, Geek! Is a weekly live show that pits 3 contestants against one another and combines knowledge, passion, persuasive argument, comedy while delving into geek and pop culture.  

Ready, Set, Geek will be a live audience show that will be held every Thursday at our home base, New Dimension Comics in Century III Mall that will also be streamed on facebook, Twitch, recorded for our YouTube channel, and for an audio podcast. 

FORMAT: The show will run a hour long with 3 different styles of play. 3 contestants will brave through 5 rounds of competition to win a grand prize. After 4 rounds, the contestant with the lowest score will be eliminated and the final 2 will head to the last round. The winner will be the person standing with the highest total points.  

THE PITCH OFF: The three contestants will be given a sealed envelope with an actor, a location or object, and a fictional title. From this list they must create a movie pitch to give the host. Whomever has the best and most entertaining pitch will be given the first point and control of the board. 

CREATIVE CONTROL: This is the real star of the show. The contestant with control of the board will choose one of the three topics provided by the host. Each contestant will choose their own answer based on the topic picked. Each contestant will be given an opening argument to defend their answer before the topic becomes open for discussion. The host will ask further questions, pursue different avenues, until final arguments are called. The host will then make the choice on which contestant provided the best argument. The winner will control the next topic and the format continues. There will be runtimes of opening statements of 60 seconds, 90 seconds rebuttals, 60 seconds closing.  

BOSS BATTLE: At the end of the Creative Control, 1 contestant has been eliminated and the two final competitors are set against one another. They will be tasked with answering 10 questions in a rapid fire format. Each question asked will have been polled by a group of people and each polled answer has one point assigned to it. (Think Family Feud point system). Whichever contestant garners the highest total at the end of the Boss Battle will be crowned the Winner.  

SO WHY ARE WE DOING THIS? Our short term goals are to create a new entertainment market in Pittsburgh and build brand awareness. We would like to have a commitment to run for at least 6 months to work out details while creating a fanbase and audience for the show. We want to have a strong social media presence along with being able to tap into the market for genre fans that we are targeting. Long term, the continued growth will open the door for further sponsors and endorsements to make the show even more economically viable with production while continuing development and growth as a brand.

ANYTHING ELSE? Not really, we believe that the Pittsburgh market is one that has a lot of opportunity and being able to provide entertainment for a hour a week working within the parameters that we have laid out can fill a very specific void. We want to be able to draw both fans, friends, comedians, and guests into our show and see just exactly how far we can go.

story:
EVERYONE WANTS TO STIFLE CREATIVITY. WE EMBRACE AND PROMOTE IT.

I'm Michael Canter and I am the founder of Jivewired TV. We've come quite a long way since very humble beginnings, and unfortunately, recently lost investment money that we were counting on receiving. Know this, we want to make this as simple as possible and ideally, if we can find 250,000 people to donate a single dollar we can move forward without worrying about outside investors. Think of it this way, for a one time donation of ONE DOLLAR you can access thousands of hours of great content - for free -  using an Apple, Roku or Amazon Fire device, on your iOS or Android devices, or by simply going to the website we are developing at http://jivewired.tv.

We certainly believe in this project as we have invested a great deal of time and money into bringing you the best indie content with no subscription fees ever. And we have great television shows and documentaries with more to come. But we still have much more to do, and that's where you come in.

This is no small feat and we are certainly grateful to all those who will help us reach our goal. In fact, if we go over our goal we'll donate half that money to charity. And for those who choose other options that come with perks and swag, so to speak, we'll pick a charity at each donation level and fund half the proceeds to each. If we are going to ask for donations we feel that paying it forward is an absolute must.

What happens if we meet our goal? We can acquire more and better content. We can develop new shows for existing series. We can get Adam a truck so he can chase tornadoes. We can create music-based shows and food truck shows and millennial-forward documentaries that focus on today's issues and challenges. Most of all we want to provide relevant, non-biased news shows. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

What will we do with $250,000 (or more)?

  • Create apps on the most popular streaming platforms available.
  • Develop new episodes for existing shows and create shows of our own.
  • Recruit college students for paid internships in all aspects of broadcast media.
  • Get Adam a Storm Chasing Truck.
  • Get a Food Truck and a VW Micro Bus for other shows we want to develop.
  • MOST OF ALL - Show big banks and venture capitalists that we can build a community of viewers and contributors that are far more invested in our success than they ever could be. 

What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

We don't like to talk about failure but I suppose it is a valid question. Let's just say - WE WILL NOT FAIL - and know that even if we fall short of our stated goal we'll use the donations we do get to soldier on under the same premise: free content available on the most relevant streaming applications so that our content can be accessed by everybody.

The Impact

How will your contribution make a difference? Let me start by saying nothing means more to us than your belief that we will be successful. By giving us at least one dollar you're telling us that you believe in the same values that we do. There are so many great independent web series that just don't get the visibility they deserve. We'd like to show those wonderful people that there are hundreds of thousands of viewers who want to see what they are offering, and give them the encouragement to follow their dreams one donated dollar at a time.

It's been a labor of love that we have finally launched on Apple TV. So many wonderful people have contributed hard work, great ideas, and a few dollars here and there to make that happen. We have seen Apple downloads increase every week and some shows are starting to gain popularity. Imagine what we could do if Jivewired TV was available on all streaming platforms?

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges come with every new venture. Most businesses fail within six months of their creation. But we've come further than 99.9% of others who have tried to accomplish what we do. It sounds strange that we need an influx of capital to get over that last hurdle. Most companies like Jivewired would need millions of dollars at this point.  To use an historical metaphor, we're 30-feet from gold but we just need a few more shovels to get there. Clearing that six-month hurdle will ensure our success. We firmly believe that.

It is important to make our content accessible to EVERYBODY to ensure that success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and we fully understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign through your social media accounts.
  • Don't be shy in using all of the wonderful Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
EVERYONE WANTS TO STIFLE CREATIVITY. WE EMBRACE AND PROMOTE IT.
I'm Michael Canter and I am the founder of Jivewired TV. We've come quite a long way since very humble beginnings, and unfortunately, recently lost investment money that we were counting on receiving. Know this, we want to make this as simple as possible and ideally, if we can find 250,000 people to donate a single dollar we can move forward without worrying about outside investors. Think of it this way, for a one time donation of ONE DOLLAR you can access thousands of hours of great content - for free -  using an Apple, Roku or Amazon Fire device, on your iOS or Android devices, or by simply going to the website we are developing at http://jivewired.tv.
We certainly believe in this project as we have invested a great deal of time and money into bringing you the best indie content with no subscription fees ever. And we have great television shows and documentaries with more to come. But we still have much more to do, and that's where you come in.

It is important to make our content accessible to EVERYBODY to ensure that success. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute financially, and we fully understand that, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign through your social media accounts.
Don't be shy in using all of the wonderful Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Positive Vibes Only

Sponsored by some of the biggest companies in the hip-hop industry such as Wu-Tang, Powerhouse 106 FM, Brink TV, and the Puff Chronicles to name a few, P.I.F.F. Magazine is the magazine that offers a promotional platform for the underground, independent, and aspiring talent. Highlighting all entertainers looking for a place in which to have their voices heard, we are the bridge between the streets and the entertainment industry. We represent all models, music artists, comedians, poets, photographers, athletes, fashion designers, dancers, and entrepreneurs of the entertainment industry. 

What makes us unique is we do not cater to industry entertainers only; we are out here everyday granting access to the best of the best up-and-coming talent of the future. We believe that up-and-coming entertainers are the most important aspect of the industry - the stories, the struggles, and most of all the survivors and warriors. We are the primary source for A&R and Industry executives who are looking for the hottest new talent around. Whether you're small-time, big-time, or just somebody who's interested in learning more about the entertainment industry and its business, we're supporting your dream and burning away all the nonsense while giving you some strong  

P.ositive I.nfluence F.or the F.uture 

 

By contributing to our campaign, you will receive benefits in many ways. If you are an advertiser or a talent manager, you will have a platform in which to offer your talent exposure to thousands of readers all over the nation. If you are an aspiring underground talent such as a music artist, model, producer, etc., you will be able to raise your public awareness by 33%. If you are simply a reader who is interested in the entertainment industry and the behind-the-scenes stories, you will receive a great magazine in which to read and be informed on the ins and outs of the industry.

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of at least $50,000 to get our magazine secured and on solid ground. Any additional amount will help us further our cause even more, but we need at least $50,000 to put together the national talent search and video series. Here is where we will be spending the money:

  • $100 - Domain Hosting
  • $300 - Secure barcode
  • $600 - 12 months of website hosting
  • $3,000 - Print Distribution
  • $3,500 - Show Production/ Editing
  • $3,500 - National Travel Expenses
  • $7,000 - Venues/ Events
  • $12,000 - Web Developer/ Designer to be hired for 12 months
  • $20,000 - Employee Salaries

THESE ARE THE PERKS YOU CAN RECEIVE BY DONATING:

Reader Incentives:

  • $1 - Thank you and your name listed in contributor credits on show and website
  • $10 - Gets you 1 year digital subscription to magazine and personal Thank You token
  • $20 - 1 yr digital subscription, personal Thank You token, 1 print copy
  • $50 - 1 yr digital subscription and print subscription, Thank You token, 1 autographed photo

Talent Incentives:

  • $25 - 2 photos placed in mag (no info/ no interview spread)
  • $35 - one 1-page spread
  • $60 - a full feature spread (interview and 4-6 photos)
  • $80 - full feature spread and 1 full page ad
  • $100 - 1-year P.I.F.F. membership

Advertiser/ Talent Manager Incentives:

$250 - 2 full page ad special

$700 - 6 months ad space

$1,200 - 1 yr ad space and 3 featured spreads for your talent

$2,000 - 2 yr ad special and full feature spreads for all of your talent

Extra Incentives:

$500 - Book a reservation to have us come and feature your city in our Talent Search

If we do not reach our entire goal, all funds donated will still be applied to the perks/ incentives offered. Therefore, if you donate and our goal is not reached, we will use the funds to do what we can to reach our target goal to its best ability and you will still receive the perks you signed up for.

The Impact

By donating and helping us reach our goal, you will be making a difference in helping to offer exposure and public awareness to underground talent and giving aspiring talents a platform in which to showcase their talent and work. Not many other magazine are designed for this; so without P.I.F.F. Magazine, underground talent may never be discovered. Please help us get the next biggest star found today!! Be donating, here's what you know:

You will help aspiring talent have a solid platform to gain exposure to their work.

We have reached an audience of 12,000+ monthly readers in just 10 months and that was with NO BUDGET!! Imagine what we can do with an actual budget!

You will have a magazine that you love and enjoy reading every month because it is something different an d something real to our audience and those interested in the entertainment industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help with financial donations, that is ok.... you can still help us by doing the following:

  • Like our Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/piffmagz/ and share the page with friends/ family.
  • Share our link to our issues at https://www.piffmag.com
  • Tell others about our magazine and our campaign and ask them if they can help us reach our goal.
  • Re-share and re-share again any posts that you see us make so that we can accomplish this goal.
  • $100 - 1-year P.I.F.F. membership

Thank you so much for all of your help! We appreciate you because without you, we wouldn't be able to be here!!

And that's all there is to it.

Like our Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/piffmagz/ and share the page with friends/ family.
Share our link to our issues at https://www.piffmag.com

Tell others about our magazine and our campaign and ask them if they can help us reach our goal.
Re-share and re-share again any posts that you see us make so that we can accomplish this goal.

Thank you so much for all of your help! We appreciate you because without you, we wouldn't be able to be here!!

story:
Web-series Overview

Title: Trigger
Genre: Mystery/Drama
Format: 7x 40 Minute Episodes
Age Rating: 16+
Logline: A group of university students and their catastrophic decisions embroil them in a series of events culminating in the murder of one of their own. Who is fated to die and who will be pushed to pull the trigger?

Summary

In development since 2019, the first season of Trigger consists of seven episodes and is ready to go into production -  with plans for a second season already drafted in case all goes to plan! To say the journey was an easy one would be an outright lie but several table reads and multiple page 0 rewrites, this gripping tale is ready to be shared with the world.

The Pilot episode works to establish the tone of the series, sets up core storylines and invites you to hopefully fall in love with the characters - even if it is for the wrong reasons. Sometimes the most toxic of characters can be our favourite… and that’s okay too.

By producing and releasing the first episode of Trigger, we are hoping to pick up momentum surrounding the series and demonstrate both its potential and its marketability. This will assist us in either reaching out to networks and producers or allow us to successfully crowd fund the rest of the series - now armed with a tangible proof of concept.

Trigger at its core explores friendly, familial and romantic dynamics in the face of deceit, betrayal and upheaval through the lens of four university students who find themselves embroiled in a disastrous chain of events which culminates in the murder of one of their own.

To do this, the series navigates between two different timelines using flash-forwards at both the beginning and the end of each episode, with the present-day narrative making up the rest of the show. This allows us to build anticipation and tension by teasing the aftermath of the murder while still concealing the identities of the victim and the shooter as we use the present timeline to reveal the chain of events which ultimately culminates in the shooting.

The ensemble protagonists (Levi, Esme, Maisie and Lexie) are four university housemates, each with a secret to their name and character arcs which will overlap with fatal consequences in the penultimate episode.

Lead Characters

Levi Azzi:

Born a Bisexual Middle Eastern Catholic, Levi’s existence itself challenges every conventional norm his family aligns itself with. Because of this, he has quite the reputation for being the black sheep of the family. Despite his family’s affluence, Levi has never been happy; in fact, he loathes not only his family’s mistreatment of him but also their views and beliefs.

Following years of self-loathing, Levi ultimately spiralled out of control and led himself down a darker path than anyone had ever foreseen. Spending his family’s wealth on parties, alcohol and drugs, Levi tanked almost every relationship in his life – from his broken family dynamic to his called-off engagement to ex-fiancée, Rachel.

The only constant presence in his life is his best friend and twin flame, Esme Meyer but they share a lot more than just a sibling dynamic… they share a dark secret that could be the undoing of them both.

 

Esme Meyer:

Forced to be a mother before she could be a sister, Esme is the eldest of five siblings and the family’s matriarch since childhood. Because of her abusive parents’ substance abuse issues, Esme matured before her years and single-handedly raise her brothers and sisters in her parent’s absence.

Although her childhood may have hardened her, Esme’s ambition and desperation to escape her broken past is concealed by her heart of gold – but when your entire childhood has been a battlefield, you know exactly when to take the shot.

While her mother, Donna, re-appears whenever a problem arises, her father Gabe disappeared completely before she turned seventeen. Initially, Esme would shoplift and steal to keep herself and her siblings fed but was eventually caught – only to be bailed out by a posh rich boy looking for a way to spend his father’s money: Levi.

The pair immediately struck up a friendship and over the years supported each other through everything… and that’s not an understatement – if Levi knows where the bodies are hidden you better believe Esme knows full well how they got there.

 

Lexie Scott:

One half of a set of twins, Lexie owns her independence in a way that intimidates everyone in her life – including her sister Cece. Confident and self-assured, Lexie does what she can to keep her comfortable lifestyle, sometimes at the cost of her friends and family.  

Lexie is driven by her need for validation, be it physical, verbal or virtual and her charisma lends itself greatly to this – although at times this can cause her to become quite arrogant and self-serving.

Constantly adapting to her surroundings, Lexie is a social butterfly who cares for anyone and everyone, sometimes a little too much. A true believer of people being a product of circumstance, Lexie sets out to mend ‘broken’ people but while she knows to apologise when she’s wrong, she also won’t back down if she believes she’s right… and she almost always is.
 

Maisie Walters:

Lost in a world where everyone she knows either abandons her or dies, Maisie clings to familiarity and her remaining loved ones with every fibre of her being.  A protective, if not misguided friend but an even scarier enemy; once you’ve crossed Maisie, there’s no coming back from it – regardless of how hard you can try.

Driven by an innate desire to belong to someone or something, Maisie is fuelled by her need for security and stability in a life where she’s had no control – sometimes at the cost of her own mental health and well-being.

Maisie is described by those who see her as a blunt Ice Queen to anyone outside of her social circle but as soon as she’s warmed to you, you’ll thaw a friend willing to go to lengths to keep your connection alive.
 

Supporting Ensemble

Rachel:

Levi’s ex-fiancée of five years and Esme’s close-friend, Rachel has been a constant presence in their life up until recently. After a difficult year of trials and tribulations, mostly dealing with Levi’s drug-use, Rachel and Levi came to a bitter end; with love, resentment and rage fuelling them both.

 

Donna:

Mother to Esme and a variety of other children, Donna Meyers was a neglectful parent at best but one disillusioned by her love for her ex-husband and Esme's father, Gabe. Esme's resentment for her childhood led her to escape the family home and so their relationship is strained, contentious and best described as a battlefield.
 

Cece:

Straight-talking and direct, Cece’s ballsy attitude is not too dissimilar to her twin sister Lexie’s but also in a completely different league of her own.  Perceptive, witty and intelligent, Cece was a prodigy encouraged by her parents to hone her intelligence and channel it into becoming a lawyer – a self-professed title she claimed at age 8.


Tyler:

Tyler, the son of renowned business mogul Aidan Robinson, is 25, money-motivated, arrogant and characteristically self-centred. Never having to work a day in his life, Tyler had grown accustomed to living a lavish lifestyle and being surrounded by the best – eventually turning to offloading drugs for cash after being cut off by his father.

Having been expelled from university for possession of Class A drugs with intent to supply, Tyler would continue relying on his dad for monetary support until physically assaulting him and consequently having all his benefits terminated. This only drove him to double down on his behaviour and selling more expensive substances for a quicker pay out.

Budget & Funding

Budget: £8,000 to film the Pilot Episode to pitch to Networks and/or secure funding for the entire first season. If we, thanks to your support, reach our target goal or exceed it, all additional funds raised will go towards fine-tuning and refining the Pilot and the development of season 1.

Breakdown of the Numbers:
£3000 for Locations
£2000 for Actors
£800 for Videographers
£400 for an Editor
£500 for Equipment & Lighting
£250 for Sound and Music
£250 for Props
£250 for Costumes & Make-up
£250 for Miscellaneous Costs
£200 for Travel
£100 for Covid-19 Precautions

 

 

A Little Background

Who am I?

A 23 year-old Lebanese-born-London-based screenwriter with a Bachelor's degree in English Literature & Creative Writing and a love for creating immersive Drama series. Over the years my worlds have consisted of everything from gripping murder mysteries and sister-witches burdened with protecting humanity to the exploration of deep-rooted familial secrets and their effects on how we think as people.

Particularly fascinated with the complex social and psychological aspects of humanity, my work tends to focus on the human psyche and our interpersonal relationships as humans through the lens of extreme circumstances and situations of desperation.

For an insight into my writing style and other works I’ve written, you are invited to browse my Script Revolution profile: https://www.scriptrevolution.com/profiles/david....


Why a web-series and not a television series?

Television is for me, as I’m sure it is for a lot of you, an escape from reality and a safe haven where all danger is fictional and entertainment is thrilling and exciting. From a very young age, it has been my dream to create immersive narratives and compelling characters that not only take the audience on a compelling journey but invites them to reflect on their own life.

However, it’s no secret that producing a tv series is extensively costly and so, for an independent creator like myself, a web-series is a much more budget friendly approach and doesn’t require the heavy production costs, celebrity talent or large media platforms an average TV series does.

Additionally, a web-series also allows for more creative freedom as the narratives and character arcs don’t have to be amended or diluted to fit certain niches - usually allowing for a more collaborative end product.  This also allows the show to act as a show reel for all the new and upcoming talents showcased on the series and those working behind the scenes.


Why Crowdfunding?

Unfortunately, with a global pandemic, the struggling economy and an ignored creative industry, it is becoming increasingly more difficult for independent artists and creators to get their foot in the door. Even with immense talent and initiative, it can be difficult if not impossible to have your voice heard let alone make it into the room.

It was for these reasons I ultimately decided that self-producing, and therefore crowdfunding, would be the best way to establish myself as a serious creator. My aim with this project is to share my work with the masses whilst also providing a paid opportunity for other up and coming talents to showcase their skills.

While her mother, Donna, re-appears whenever a problem arises, her father Gabe disappeared completely before she turned seventeen. Initially, Esme would shoplift and steal to keep herself and her siblings fed but was eventually caught – only to be bailed out by a posh rich boy looking for a way to spend his father’s money: Levi.
The pair immediately struck up a friendship and over the years supported each other through everything… and that’s not an understatement – if Levi knows where the bodies are hidden you better believe Esme knows full well how they got there.
 
Lexie Scott:
One half of a set of twins, Lexie owns her independence in a way that intimidates everyone in her life – including her sister Cece. Confident and self-assured, Lexie does what she can to keep her comfortable lifestyle, sometimes at the cost of her friends and family.  
Lexie is driven by her need for validation, be it physical, verbal or virtual and her charisma lends itself greatly to this – although at times this can cause her to become quite arrogant and self-serving.
Constantly adapting to her surroundings, Lexie is a social butterfly who cares for anyone and everyone, sometimes a little too much. A true believer of people being a product of circumstance, Lexie sets out to mend ‘broken’ people but while she knows to apologise when she’s wrong, she also won’t back down if she believes she’s right… and she almost always is. 
Maisie Walters:
Lost in a world where everyone she knows either abandons her or dies, Maisie clings to familiarity and her remaining loved ones with every fibre of her being.  A protective, if not misguided friend but an even scarier enemy; once you’ve crossed Maisie, there’s no coming back from it – regardless of how hard you can try.
Driven by an innate desire to belong to someone or something, Maisie is fuelled by her need for security and stability in a life where she’s had no control – sometimes at the cost of her own mental health and well-being.
Maisie is described by those who see her as a blunt Ice Queen to anyone outside of her social circle but as soon as she’s warmed to you, you’ll thaw a friend willing to go to lengths to keep your connection alive. 
Supporting Ensemble
Rachel:
Levi’s ex-fiancée of five years and Esme’s close-friend, Rachel has been a constant presence in their life up until recently. After a difficult year of trials and tribulations, mostly dealing with Levi’s drug-use, Rachel and Levi came to a bitter end; with love, resentment and rage fuelling them both.
 
Donna:
Mother to Esme and a variety of other children, Donna Meyers was a neglectful parent at best but one disillusioned by her love for her ex-husband and Esme's father, Gabe. Esme's resentment for her childhood led her to escape the family home and so their relationship is strained, contentious and best described as a battlefield. 
Cece:
Straight-talking and direct, Cece’s ballsy attitude is not too dissimilar to her twin sister Lexie’s but also in a completely different league of her own.  Perceptive, witty and intelligent, Cece was a prodigy encouraged by her parents to hone her intelligence and channel it into becoming a lawyer – a self-professed title she claimed at age 8.
Tyler:
Tyler, the son of renowned business mogul Aidan Robinson, is 25, money-motivated, arrogant and characteristically self-centred. Never having to work a day in his life, Tyler had grown accustomed to living a lavish lifestyle and being surrounded by the best – eventually turning to offloading drugs for cash after being cut off by his father.
Having been expelled from university for possession of Class A drugs with intent to supply, Tyler would continue relying on his dad for monetary support until physically assaulting him and consequently having all his benefits terminated. This only drove him to double down on his behaviour and selling more expensive substances for a quicker pay out.
Budget & Funding

Budget: £8,000 to film the Pilot Episode to pitch to Networks and/or secure funding for the entire first season. If we, thanks to your support, reach our target goal or exceed it, all additional funds raised will go towards fine-tuning and refining the Pilot and the development of season 1.
Breakdown of the Numbers:£3000 for Locations£2000 for Actors£800 for Videographers£400 for an Editor£500 for Equipment & Lighting£250 for Sound and Music£250 for Props£250 for Costumes & Make-up£250 for Miscellaneous Costs£200 for Travel£100 for Covid-19 Precautions
 
 

A Little Background
Who am I?
A 23 year-old Lebanese-born-London-based screenwriter with a Bachelor's degree in English Literature & Creative Writing and a love for creating immersive Drama series. Over the years my worlds have consisted of everything from gripping murder mysteries and sister-witches burdened with protecting humanity to the exploration of deep-rooted familial secrets and their effects on how we think as people.Particularly fascinated with the complex social and psychological aspects of humanity, my work tends to focus on the human psyche and our interpersonal relationships as humans through the lens of extreme circumstances and situations of desperation.For an insight into my writing style and other works I’ve written, you are invited to browse my Script Revolution profile: https://www.scriptrevolution.com/profiles/david....



Why a web-series and not a television series?
Television is for me, as I’m sure it is for a lot of you, an escape from reality and a safe haven where all danger is fictional and entertainment is thrilling and exciting. From a very young age, it has been my dream to create immersive narratives and compelling characters that not only take the audience on a compelling journey but invites them to reflect on their own life.
However, it’s no secret that producing a tv series is extensively costly and so, for an independent creator like myself, a web-series is a much more budget friendly approach and doesn’t require the heavy production costs, celebrity talent or large media platforms an average TV series does.
Additionally, a web-series also allows for more creative freedom as the narratives and character arcs don’t have to be amended or diluted to fit certain niches - usually allowing for a more collaborative end product.  This also allows the show to act as a show reel for all the new and upcoming talents showcased on the series and those working behind the scenes.



Why Crowdfunding?
Unfortunately, with a global pandemic, the struggling economy and an ignored creative industry, it is becoming increasingly more difficult for independent artists and creators to get their foot in the door. Even with immense talent and initiative, it can be difficult if not impossible to have your voice heard let alone make it into the room.It was for these reasons I ultimately decided that self-producing, and therefore crowdfunding, would be the best way to establish myself as a serious creator. My aim with this project is to share my work with the masses whilst also providing a paid opportunity for other up and coming talents to showcase their skills.

story:
Short Summary

What do The Godfather, Goodfellas, and The Sopranos have in common? yes they are gangster projects and yes they are violent but they are all about family.  The Town is an 8-12 part mini series however we are right now mainly focused on The Pilot.  This series wont just be about loyalty but will also show perspectives from both Mafia and the FBI trying to crack down the who,what,when,where, and why of everything in crime.

What We Need & What You Get

Our flexible goal of $7,000 will fund this Pilot  as well the following 

Equipment & Gear

Food

Locations

Costs for professionals

Marketing

Distribution

Festivals

With your help, we can make these films the best they can be. And if the goal isn't reached we promise to still make the best films we can with the funding we have!

And with your donation, we have a unique set of Perks available that will bring you along with us on this journey! From signed screenplays, your name in the credits, authentic signatures, our perks were designed to resonate with everyone!

The Impact

The pilot wont just help open the door for the 7-11 episodes being made but also to show the authenticity of the mob and gangster life. This wont just show loyalty but also family betrayal as well love and hate for supporters of this life. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate that is okay! You can still help by promoting our campaign, our films and our company! Anything you can do to get the word out is an amazing contribution to us and our filmmaking goals!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Topher McLean and I'm originally from Fayetteville, NC.  Since I was given my first video camera as a teenager I have desired to become a great film director.  In high school I (along with a teammate) was ranked 1st and 3rd in the state in the SkillsUSA television broadcasting competitions held at Elon University (2005 and 2006 respectively).  I continued to pursue my interest in college before going to NYC to pursue a career on Broadway.  

After 6 years of being a freelance stagehand in midtown Manhattan, and nearing my 30th birthday, I've decided the time has come to get serious about pursuing my dreams.  For that to happen, Topher TV needs some capital.  

In the first phase of the channel's upgrade, we need capital to ensure that the content can not only be created but regularly improved upon.  Phase 1 is meant to provide content for the next 5 months.  This will include (at minimum) 5 new episodes of The Reboot Series (Topher TV's current main attraction), 5 entertaining monologue performances, and 2 video essays (topics will be related to the entertainment business), and a film themed podcast.   

If I'm able to succeed in this campaign, it will mean the world to me.  I will feel more freedom in creating an interesting and entertaining product which I can build the foundation of a brand upon.  So come live vicariously through me as I attempt to make my dreams come true!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $1,000 to get started.  This money will go to a number of things which include transportation costs, paying a camera operator for each video, equipment upgrades, educational courses, and the cost of this fundraiser.  

What will you get for contributing?  Perk highlights include being able to choose what monologues I perform (some restrictions apply), getting a special personalized thank you video from me sent to you, a personal acting class (using my "actor as an instrument" philosophy) taught by me, and even a cameo during one of my videos!

The general estimated budget that I have worked out is as follows: 

-$350 Travel and Transportation:  Episodes of The Reboot Series are planned to take place in at least 3 states (can't tell you where because that would be a spoiler :p )

-$200 Digital Upload and Storage:  The volume of things that need to be filmed will exceed my current storage and upload capabilities.  This amount will offset these costs.  

-$200 Camera Operator Pay:  This will be paired with personal finances to cover the costs of having someone operate the camera when needed.  

-$150+ Equipment and Software Upgrades, Education, Props, and Other needs:  New equipment, both hardware and software, will be needed to improve the quality of the videos.  Additionally, participation at various web seminars and other classes are being planned.  Any additional funds beyond these needs will go towards props and other production costs.

In addition to what has been listed, we are also setting aside money to pay for the IndieGoGO fees and other bank fees.  

If all the funds are not raised what happens?  Well, the funds raised will be spread out appropriately to ensure the best possible content can be released.  

The Impact

Why should you care if I make Topher TV?  Well... because it's going to be HELLA ENTERTAINING, of course!  Don't believe me?  Check out recent projects produced by Topher TV on YouTube, it's only going to get better from there!

Risks & Challenges

When I produced Topher TV as a web series a couple of years ago, we had to halt production midway through the 3rd episodes production.  I've learned a lot since then, both from that experience and other experiences.  I am confident that I can deliver a far superior product than I previously have.  By reducing the number of collaborators I rely on to produce content, I am making sure that I can deliver an affordable product.  

I do expect challenges when it comes to pulling off harder shots with less experienced camera operators, but the funds raised that can go towards ensuring I can use a regular camera operator leaves me feeling confident that I can succeed and improve.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to donate?  You can still help by spreading the word!  This is going to be a very short fundraising period, so every bit of help will go a long way.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Rohmon Merchant and I am the creator and producer of Superficially Deep. I have been a mostly a hip hop artist and writer for most of my life and I and compelled by telling great stories for the world to hear. Superficially Deep is a project close to my heart because it gives a clean perspective to the traditional faith-based projects, where we share stories from a very real life, and also give a very family friendly show with the same intrigue and drama from mainstream television. With your generous contributions, we can finish the next 18 episodes of the show quicker, with better equipment and pay our actors and crew to put together a very quality show.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget that we are needing to meet is $1 Million. All of our cast and crew came to this project pro bono, and gave time, sweat equity, and personal sacrifice to be part of this project, many of them have not asked for a dime. We have also used the equipment that we had, with the knowledge we obtain to make 6 episodes of this show. Our goal however is to make 24 episodes (2 Seasons) of the show and we would like to upgrade our equipment to a more industry standard look, and pay stipends to all cast and crew involved in this project. Also to build our wardrobe, and bring in more elements like hair and make-up. 

We have many exciting Perks from great grabs from our clothing line to being actual part of the show, and even having producer credit in the show.

If we don't reach our goal; frankly that won't stop us, we are still currently working on new episodes as we speak, and with the funds we do generate, we will make it work and make sure at the very least our cast and crew have gas in their cars and that we can pay for locations to shoot.

 

The Impact

Superficially Deep tells an impactful story of young people who believe in God and have a relationship through church but live in a very real and tangible way. I believe that seeing yourself in the media and on TV is important, but when it comes to faith-based characters seem to be more 2 dimensional and unbelievable. "SD" creates characters that are more like the people we come across everyday, situations are more believable and everything isn't fixed within a matter of minutes, but it is real experiences. It shows believers as real people with real life issues; not your basic "holier-than-thou" type christian. It shows that just because you go to church doesn't mean we have it all together either, we have the same problems as most, we just have different options in which to deal with it.

This show is the first of its kind; and we are excited about that. Which is why so many people love working on this show right now. The script is ingenious, the acting is superb, and the scoop is great, it is a show you would want to watch over and over again.

Risks & Obstacles

In making this project we ran across some challenges the biggest was distribution we had 2 deals and they both fell through, the most recent being COVID shutting down a company, so we ran into the issue of getting the show out. We solved that problem hanging on to our own IP and launching our own streaming service on Roku tv's to distribute our show. Hopefully we can find other artist to collaborate with for future project, but we are out here and we are working to make this happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for any and all contributions, but if you can't please share our campaign, let's get the word, lets bring some good quality shows back on the small screen. Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word, thanks!

story: "The Dead Lands" which is a recreation of what we wanted to create with our micro web series "The Road to Nowhere" (free to watch on YouTube, Channel 30 Minute Films) but we didn't have the funds to pull it off and create the vision we had in mind. The Dead Lands is about two survivors of a camp called the Haven, 3 years after a deadly virus outbreak is released. Chase and Aaron are stranded in the place beyond the wall called The Dead Lands which is filled with infected, Division gangs and Military Quarantine groups. After being stranded, Chase and Aaron must fight their way through the dead lands to get back to The Haven while meeting some unique characters along the way. We hope that you can find in our perks or in this summery that you like, and if so please help us reach our goal by donating even if it's just 1 dollar, anything can help.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys, I'm Ati Jackson. A native of Florida, I was raised throughout Georgia my whole life. After graduating from high school in 2010, I enlisted in the US Army. In 2013, I decided to retire and return back to Georgia. In May of 2015, I decided to move to Los Angeles to pursue my vision of becoming an actor.  After receiving my degree in Acting for Film, I began to develop my first independent project, Black Tea. Now that the project is coming to fruition, I would like to invite you all to get involved! I believe in not waiting for opportunities, but creating them.

My passion for this story stems from:

  • My love for poetry and the way I was able to incorporate it in this story in such a huge way.
  • It shines light on more elements of the African American community than what is known to be perceived as reality.

Creating this story is far beyond me. The lives that it will impact, and has already impacted is why I'm choosing to do this, but I can't do it alone. I am so grateful for the opportunity to share a piece of myself with you, and even more grateful for everyone who will help me do so. Thank you so much for believing in my vision.

What your funding will go to:

  • Filming permits and insurances
  • Filming equipment (basic lights and scarlet).
  • Filming locations (Los Angeles)
  • Festival Entry Fees
  • Other general filming expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is great, but it isn't everything!

  • If you cannot financially contribute, that's okay! You can also share this campaign with all of your friends and family. We want you all to be just as excited as we are!

story:
Our mission is to bring a  better life experience  to the Senior  Community  by entertaining, providing knowledge,  and  by  enhancing  our  subscriber’s  lives. Our  network focuses  on  the  50 or  better  population  along  with  their  families  and friends. You can watch our network on Roku TV. The Golden Network team consists of award winning entertainment producers, actors, directors, entertainers, and artists.

This fundraiser is to assist production of a new series called “Window On Our World” (WOW). This educational program will highlight many of the unknown aspects of the United States’ Moon landing in 1969.  NASA’s Fred Peters, now 85, was the Supervising Spacecraft Project Engineer for designing and building the Moon Lander. He will chronicle this incredible NASA feat of 52 years ago in the forthcoming WOW production. Since NASA has renewed interest in space exploration, this series will help to introduce new viewers to the space program and its beginnings.

Mr. Peters recently said, “I spent a hundreds of hours helping to develop the Apollo project and enjoyed every minute of it.” Mr. Peters will inform viewers by providing his insights in a way that will help you feel the adventure and excitement he felt about this project.  He never had much interest in science fiction but he was very interested in rockets. As such, as the Team Supervisor and Project Engineer, he and his team helped to build the rocket and Moon Lander that was the most life changing and exciting historic event of the day.  Mr. Peters worked in the Space Program for over 36 years.  After the Apollo Program Mr. Peters was assigned to the Skylab Program Office as Project Engineer for the Skylab Orbital Workshop.  The Skylab Program’s end began a change in Mr. Peters’ career with a move into management positions for planning and scheduling in the Space Transportation Systems Program Office, the Orbiter Project Office and the Payloads Project Office.  A short time was spent out of NASA in the private sector but he returned to NASA to be assigned as Resident Manager for Work Package 2 of the International Space Station at the McDonald Douglas plant in Huntington Beach, California.  His last assignment was as the NASA/JSC representative to the California Space Institute at the University of California San Diego.  He retired from NASA in 1997.

Golden Network.TV (GNTV) will explore the effort it took to get to the Moon in an eight (8) episode series called, “Window on Our World” (WOW).  Our seniors, their families, and friends will learn the inside scoop of what really happened behind the scenes.  You will be told many interesting and fascinating things that were never made public.

Mr. Peters will discuss the importance of the Apollo project and why it was of interest to the United States and the World. He will also explain why it is important to you and what the space programs offshoot of great products have done to make life so much better for all.

President John F. Kennedy was not kidding when he said, "Going to the Moon was hard".

Much of the technology needed to get to the lunar surface and return did not exist at the time of Kennedy’s famous 1962 speech. Much was unknown. As NASA’s Apollo missions were being planned, there was concern that the lunar module might sink into the Moon’s surface or become stuck in it.  As it turned out, the surface was hard and supported the lunar module without any problems.

NASA had to start from scratch by inventing space travel. In 1961, there was no rocket big enough to go to the Moon, hence the development of the Saturn V rocket. There were no spaceships that could land on the Moon. No computer was small enough or fast enough to do the math necessary to fly to the Moon, and no computers anywhere in the world. There were no spacesuits or space food. In the early years of the program, people were furiously doing the engineering and making the technological developments to make it possible to fly in space.

Why was the Apollo Program Important? These trips helped NASA to explore other worlds later on. Apollo also provided our first detailed look at another planetary body. It showed us how special the Earth-Moon system is. It was the Apollo 11 mission that demonstrated convincingly for the first time how ancient the Moon is. The samples brought back were over 3 billion years old.

Project Apollo's goals went beyond landing Americans on the Moon and returning them safely to Earth. They included establishing the technology to meet other national interests in space and achieving preeminence in space for the United States.

NASA met that challenge with the Apollo program. It was the first time human beings left Earth orbit and visited another world. These missions made it possible to explore more distant worlds later on.

Directors such as twelve-time Emmy Award-nominee and four-time Emmy Award winner, Sheldon I. Altfeld, who has been an actor, writer, producer, and director in Hollywood since 1950, is anticipated to be working on this project.  His extensive credits have spanned every aspect of the entertainment industry, including radio, television, motion pictures, stage productions, and recording.  Full bio available on request.

One of the Producers of the show is Mr. Ron Kramer.  With over 35 years in the entertainment industry, Mr. Kramer has achieved major success in music, film, and television. He was Senior Vice President of Music Publishing at Capitol Records/EMI, where he supervised all of Capitol Record’s music publishing companies, with offices in Los Angeles, New York, Nashville, and Toronto.  Mr. Kramer was Associate Producer of the Grammy Awards for more than ten years and is a past Chairman of the Board of the National Academy of Recording Arts & Sciences.  Full bio available on request.

Become a supporter of this fantastic project.  Help Golden Network.TV’s,  Window on Our World (WOW) become a reality, and let the man who lived the dream, take you back to the origins of the US Space Program and help you to relive all of the excitement and adventure to learn new things.

This crowdfunding project will enable us to begin and complete filming of the pilot as the first step in the entire series.

Temma Keatan Hammond, the President, and CEO of Golden Network.TV worked with industry leaders from the start of many projects. She has designed and built Silver Mirage Studios, the first soundproof studio in Las Vegas, which served clients such as Martin Scorsese, Robert De Niro, Harry Blackstone Jr., and Whoopi Goldberg. Temma also formed Silver Star Studios, Inc., which was the largest soundstage and entertainment center in Nevada, with clients such as Samuel L. Jackson, BB King, Andre Agassi, Jackie Chan, American Sweethearts, The Mexican, Mac 10, Little Bow Wow, George Clooney, General Motors, and Pizza Hut.

Your support will create a big impact.

I know what our empowering stories about our space program can be. Being the recipient of many awards including the 2006 through 2011 Platinum, Gold and Bronze Telly Award (local Emmy) and Bronze Remi Award from the Worldfest, Houston International Film Festival and EMPixx Gold and Platinum Awards.

Risks & Challenges.

There are always issues that must be dealt with on any project and, while working with other very talented people on my projects, I have been able to work thru issues and get all projects completed. I have over forty years of extensive entertainment experience in producing, directing, writing, and company management for film, network television, corporate/government video, interactive video, stage, and radio.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please spread the word on social media, tell your friends, tell your neighbors, tell anyone who you think might be interested! While Goldennetwork.tv will work to spread the word, your help and signal boost is huge and word of mouth will help a great deal! Your continued support will be greatly appreciated.

Sponsors will receive the following Perks for helping to fund this project. Anticipated distribution of Perks will be December 2021.
story_txt:
Our mission is to bring a  better life experience  to the Senior  Community  by entertaining, providing knowledge,  and  by  enhancing  our  subscriber’s  lives. Our  network focuses  on  the  50 or  better  population  along  with  their  families  and friends. You can watch our network on Roku TV. The Golden Network team consists of award winning entertainment producers, actors, directors, entertainers, and artists.
This fundraiser is to assist production of a new series called “Window On Our World” (WOW). This educational program will highlight many of the unknown aspects of the United States’ Moon landing in 1969.  NASA’s Fred Peters, now 85, was the Supervising Spacecraft Project Engineer for designing and building the Moon Lander. He will chronicle this incredible NASA feat of 52 years ago in the forthcoming WOW production. Since NASA has renewed interest in space exploration, this series will help to introduce new viewers to the space program and its beginnings.
Mr. Peters recently said, “I spent a hundreds of hours helping to develop the Apollo project and enjoyed every minute of it.” Mr. Peters will inform viewers by providing his insights in a way that will help you feel the adventure and excitement he felt about this project.  He never had much interest in science fiction but he was very interested in rockets. As such, as the Team Supervisor and Project Engineer, he and his team helped to build the rocket and Moon Lander that was the most life changing and exciting historic event of the day.  Mr. Peters worked in the Space Program for over 36 years.  After the Apollo Program Mr. Peters was assigned to the Skylab Program Office as Project Engineer for the Skylab Orbital Workshop.  The Skylab Program’s end began a change in Mr. Peters’ career with a move into management positions for planning and scheduling in the Space Transportation Systems Program Office, the Orbiter Project Office and the Payloads Project Office.  A short time was spent out of NASA in the private sector but he returned to NASA to be assigned as Resident Manager for Work Package 2 of the International Space Station at the McDonald Douglas plant in Huntington Beach, California.  His last assignment was as the NASA/JSC representative to the California Space Institute at the University of California San Diego.  He retired from NASA in 1997.
Golden Network.TV (GNTV) will explore the effort it took to get to the Moon in an eight (8) episode series called, “Window on Our World” (WOW).  Our seniors, their families, and friends will learn the inside scoop of what really happened behind the scenes.  You will be told many interesting and fascinating things that were never made public.
Mr. Peters will discuss the importance of the Apollo project and why it was of interest to the United States and the World. He will also explain why it is important to you and what the space programs offshoot of great products have done to make life so much better for all.
President John F. Kennedy was not kidding when he said, "Going to the Moon was hard".

NASA had to start from scratch by inventing space travel. In 1961, there was no rocket big enough to go to the Moon, hence the development of the Saturn V rocket. There were no spaceships that could land on the Moon. No computer was small enough or fast enough to do the math necessary to fly to the Moon, and no computers anywhere in the world. There were no spacesuits or space food. In the early years of the program, people were furiously doing the engineering and making the technological developments to make it possible to fly in space.
Why was the Apollo Program Important? These trips helped NASA to explore other worlds later on. Apollo also provided our first detailed look at another planetary body. It showed us how special the Earth-Moon system is. It was the Apollo 11 mission that demonstrated convincingly for the first time how ancient the Moon is. The samples brought back were over 3 billion years old.
Project Apollo's goals went beyond landing Americans on the Moon and returning them safely to Earth. They included establishing the technology to meet other national interests in space and achieving preeminence in space for the United States.
NASA met that challenge with the Apollo program. It was the first time human beings left Earth orbit and visited another world. These missions made it possible to explore more distant worlds later on.

One of the Producers of the show is Mr. Ron Kramer.  With over 35 years in the entertainment industry, Mr. Kramer has achieved major success in music, film, and television. He was Senior Vice President of Music Publishing at Capitol Records/EMI, where he supervised all of Capitol Record’s music publishing companies, with offices in Los Angeles, New York, Nashville, and Toronto.  Mr. Kramer was Associate Producer of the Grammy Awards for more than ten years and is a past Chairman of the Board of the National Academy of Recording Arts & Sciences.  Full bio available on request.

story:
I love to dance, I love people and I love stories. I pitched my idea of a talk show to a friend and he was on board immediately. He brought a couple of friends and I brought a couple of friends and we created a solid team of creatives with a common goal of bringing something different to the talk show world. 

We have been working extremely hard to debut our first show on June 1st, 2020 8:00 pm PST on KP Media TV on Roku. We need your help asap to provide a space for the show. At this time, it’s in an apartment dining room. We need equipment to increase production value. We also need resources for marketing and promotional assistance. 

Giving to our show would mean that you not only believe in us but you also want us to thrive. We are so grateful to be seen and for our voice to be heard. We know we have something special Let Your Love Be Real Talk Show is for you and us a refreshing wave of kindness, joy, and laughter. 

We started this campaign because we know in our hearts that we are the change we are seeking. Thank you for reading this far and for giving towards our show. Please share our campaign far and wide. We are excited to meet you along our journey.

story:
What Is This?

Fishbowl Show is a volunteer comedy sketch group aimed to provide a platform for Perth creatives to produce content on a regular basis. It all began as a vision between a few young individuals who shared a love for comedy and filmmaking. We were eager to hone our craft, collaborate with our peers and above all else, create funny content. So, we got to work and quickly grew. Now, with 5 sketches produced and more scripts in the pipeline, we have more ideas and are even more pumped to create more content!

However, with filmmaking also come many expenses. With your help, we can keep this platform alive, develop it and create more opportunities!

 

Our Work

Our sketches range anywhere from 1 minutes to 6 minutes of various format and topic but all with a comedic theme. Our latest sketch, Undercover Worker was chosen as an Official Selection in Australia's Funniest Shorts Festival that is screening in Bunbury, Western Australia as a part of CinefestOZ this August 25. 

 

Meet the Team

PRODUCER - Quin Ooi

From a young age, you can often find Quin glued to a screen watching films, TV shows, documentaries, and videos. She loves the ability to convey stories while challenging common communication barriers and dreams of producing content that can affect the lives of its audience in any positive way. After graduating from a degree in Broadcasting and Film Production, she continued to pursue various opportunities and now has experience in the camera, editing, and producing department. She has produced for an independent community TV station as a Production Coordinator, crewed for productions (most recently a fan-made short film, Batgirl Returns), covered sports events such as the Western Australia Football League (WAFL) and promotional videos for businesses. 

DIRECTOR, CINEMATOGRAPHER & EDITOR - Oliver Dear

Oliver has been creating videos at an early age. He loves both production and post-production roles; and takes on a variety of roles in both departments. Although recently graduated, he has already worked on a list of films such as Go Karts in the camera department, They Are Waiting as Script Supervisor, In The Clouds as Script Supervisor, Dollhouse as Data Wrangler and Editor, and ABC's TV Series, The Heights as a one-day camera attachment. His post-production work includes corporate videos, documentaries and many of our very own sketches. 

SOUND RECORDIST & DESIGNER - Diego Espinoza

Diego loves music and was a drummer in his teenage years. His involvement in film began when he was approached to help on productions by friends while studying Sound Production in Murdoch University. Since then, he never looked back and has been involved in various projects. In 2017, he was nominated for best sound design at NexGen Film Festival. He has worked on various short films, corporate shoots for Transperth, Water Corporation and Perth Film School, and recently on the Behind-The-Scenes of Michael Bolton's album recording in Perth.

WRITERS (from left to right)

Todd Saunders

Todd was born and raised in Perth, Western Australia. He currently is a university student in his final year pursuing Creative and Professional Writing and thinking about going on to do his PhD. Dean has always had an interest in comedy shows growing up watching shows such as F.R.I.E.N.D.S. and Seinfeld. He hopes to write children’s books in the future. 

Dean Lovatt

Dean Lovatt is a highly versatile actor with extensive theatrical experience. Dean has been working professionally since 2008 and in that time has found himself in a wide variety of roles both on and off stage. Dean has created Bogan Shakespeare for Perth's annual Fringe Festival, hosted improv shows and appeared in TV commercials. Dean is a charismatic, career-minded, driven performer and a genuine asset to any project he is involved in. 

Stephen Fletcher

Stephen is a recently graduated university student, aspiring filmmaker and comedy writer. His
interest in comedy is as mysterious as his unexplained accent (he actually got it from watching a lot of American television). He had his debut in the creative field when he acted in his high school production of Peter Pan where he was the only Asian child in the Darling family. His favourite in comedy writing so far has been getting to vent about driving habits that incredibly frustrates him which were all featured in Minimum Underdrive, a sketch Stephen wrote. 

Alexander Circosta (Head Writer)

After graduating from Murdoch University with a Bachelor of Laws and a Bachelor of Creative Arts, Alexander went to Los Angeles to study acting and improvisational comedy. Upon returning to Australia, Alexander began pursuing acting and comedy full time and has appeared on Stage, Television and in Feature Films. He is a Raw Comedy State Finalist,  the headwriter on The Fishbowl Show, teaches corporate improvisational courses and won the Act Belong Commit WA State Award in 2017 for his work promoting mental health and wellbeing. He also love movies and has an uncanny ability to quote them verbatim. 

Alex Christophers

Alex is a writer, actor, comedian and your worst nightmare. Born and raised in Perth, Western Australia, Alex has been making people laugh his whole life until one day he realised “these jerks should pay me for this.” He started performing on stage in 2017 with the Improv comedy group, Only the Human, doing shows like "The Improv Showdown" and “The Improv Family.” Alex Joined The Fishbowl Show as a Writer and Actor, and has worked on many of our sketches such as Two Beers and Undercover Worker.

Rory Machell

Rory is a Triple Threat; being an actor, writer, improvisor, stand up comedian, highly skilled in Excel & the best employee you can get for night shifts. The only thing larger than his ego is the sun that revolves around him. You may have seen him at his play last fringe “Rory Machell’s Christmas In July (In January) Snowed In Spectacular”, his wrestling-based improv night “The Improv Showdown”, on Infinite Jest’s Podcast “Brief Interviews with Hideous Men” or performing in Perth’s Stand Up rooms. When not performing, you can find him telling people to like his Facebook page, buy his merch & that you knew him back when he wasn’t as famous.

 

How Will the Money Be Spent?

All cast & crew participate on a voluntary basis. Productions come with a long list of expenses. With 10 scripts to film, we have carefully planned our budget to ensure it is as cost-efficient as possible. All funds will go into production costs such as:

  • Food - Productions are often long hours. We want to ensure our cast & crew are always on top of their game by being well fed and hydrated while on set. This will be the largest aspect of the budget.
  • Equipment - In order to be as cost-efficient as we can, most equipment has been sourced and arranged with no charges. However, not all equipment will be available to us for free and as such, a small percentage of the budget will be used to cover such expenses. 
  • Set Design & Props - We do our best to use existing materials to be cost-efficient. However, that may not always be the case and a small percentage of our budget is set aside for this. 
  • Distribution - We also want to give our sketches the best visibility it can get. A small percentage of the budget will be used to meet submission fees for film festivals.
  • And producing the perks we are offering! - Tshirts, caps, stickers! A percentage of the budget will go into producing the awesome perks we have in line for you!

 

Can't Contribute Financially? 

That's okay! We understand that not everyone can contribute to the campaign in cash. There are many other ways you can help:

  • Follow us on YouTube, Instagram and Facebook for updates and behind the scenes
  • Tell your friends, family, pets... share it with everyone!
  • Know someone we can collaborate with? Link us up!
  • Know a movie screening, space or avenue we can share news of the Fishbowl Show in? Link us up!

We appreciate all contributions in helping us keep this platform alive. As one of our cast member from our sketch, Bragging Blokes said, "Did someone order a Falafel? Because that's a wrap!"
