story:
Once upon a time...

there was a young motion design team who had a dream: after several exciting digital agency projects they wanted to create a brand new community-based web series together with fellow creative minds! And the whole story started on a full-moon night…

Our team members are the settlers of Indiville. And now we are inviting you to populate this special WONDERWORLD: the People of Indiville are actually YOU, GUYS! ONLYYY YOUUUUU!

 

Our plan is to create the complete first season of Indiville: a 12-part series with 12 unique star characters. (The number of episodes is provisory, the more of you want to participate, the happier we are!) So this is basically a great casting opportunity for the new upcoming stars of the crowdsourcing scene.

 

Do you have a special craftship, an idea to share, or a strong personal dream story you want to make happen, or maybe a cause you want to spread the word about? Choose one of our perks, and appear on Indiville! Why not become even the Mayor of Indiville? It's an open spot! Go for it! :)  We will add your personality to the episode, and you can decide on how the story evolves.

You can reach thousands of potential supporters OF YOURS in an entertaining ad-free and effective way, with your unique charming animated character and through a funny storyline!

Let’s conquer all the seven (or more) digital continents together! People of Indiville, UNITE NOW!

 

 

You’ll be part of a super series - among all the superheroes we are looking for!

Are you a digital nomad juggler, a young and restless creative mind? Your place is in Indiville!

You will be involved in the creative process all along (if you would like to) - plus you are more than welcome to share and present your Indiville episode on platforms and channels of your choice.

This is the point! We need your support, but at the same time, you will be backing a common creative cause as well.

We would like you to trust us with building the cool next-generation world of Indiville!

We need funds for the production process: to understand your idea, build your story, draw your character, develop the animatic, and of course, do the top notch motion design. This is a time and energy-consuming procedure, as many of you surely know. Back us so that we can produce the best quality there is!

8. Our team's background

We are working at Brandlift, a full service digital agency, passionate about many things: Game of Thrones, videogames, great causes, and of course, animation! We created several motion design projects, including the multi award winner Brave Book, the first social media fairy tale, alongside with ACG. Brave Book was created for charity fund raising: when a celebrity started writing the fairy tale, and the follow-up was decided on social media platforms by the readers themselves.

Episode Zero

- fictional plot -

John is sewing his next collection of clothes, when he accidentally sticks his finger. Smelling the drop of blood from far far away, suddenly a thirsty little vampire appears. As he opens his mouth, John starts cleaning his teeth with his yarn! And ta-da: a whole pigeon, a rabbit and a 16th-century Duchesse have been buried there all along! Now they are all set completely free!

The little vampire is so happy, that he helps designing and sewing John's entire new collection. They even hold a fashion show at the vampire's castle. The design store's slogan now is: Taste for timeless. More and more little hipster vampires start helping with sewing and designing, while pigeons deliver the pieces of clothes that are finished! New castles pop up on the world map, as the brand starts blooming.

 

9. Risks and challenges

Our risks include: gaps in communication, the time and effort needed to assess our contributors’ storyline. The production process might take longer than expected.

 

But we are as excited as a six year old girl wanting to win the beauty contest in West Virginia!

 

10. Timeline

 

2016 - January - the idea of Indiville is conceived under the moonlight

2016 - March - we start sketching up Indiville's universe

2016 - October - our storyboard is ready

2016 - December - the first animatics and animated excerpts come to life

2017 - March - preparing to launch of the Indiegogo campaign

2017 - Summer - estimated development of the first season’s episodes

By the end of 2017: estimated launch of the complete Season 1

2018: preparing and creating Season 2 of Indiville
story_txt: Once upon a time...there was a young motion design team who had a dream: after several exciting digital agency projects they wanted to create a brand new community-based web series together with fellow creative minds! And the whole story started on a full-moon night…Our team members are the settlers of Indiville. And now we are inviting you to populate this special WONDERWORLD: the People of Indiville are actually YOU, GUYS! ONLYYY YOUUUUU! Our plan is to create the complete first season of Indiville: a 12-part series with 12 unique star characters. (The number of episodes is provisory, the more of you want to participate, the happier we are!) So this is basically a great casting opportunity for the new upcoming stars of the crowdsourcing scene. Do you have a special craftship, an idea to share, or a strong personal dream story you want to make happen, or maybe a cause you want to spread the word about? Choose one of our perks, and appear on Indiville! Why not become even the Mayor of Indiville? It's an open spot! Go for it! :)  We will add your personality to the episode, and you can decide on how the story evolves.You can reach thousands of potential supporters OF YOURS in an entertaining ad-free and effective way, with your unique charming animated character and through a funny storyline!Let’s conquer all the seven (or more) digital continents together! People of Indiville, UNITE NOW!  You’ll be part of a super series - among all the superheroes we are looking for!Are you a digital nomad juggler, a young and restless creative mind? Your place is in Indiville!You will be involved in the creative process all along (if you would like to) - plus you are more than welcome to share and present your Indiville episode on platforms and channels of your choice.This is the point! We need your support, but at the same time, you will be backing a common creative cause as well.We would like you to trust us with building the cool next-generation world of Indiville!We need funds for the production process: to understand your idea, build your story, draw your character, develop the animatic, and of course, do the top notch motion design. This is a time and energy-consuming procedure, as many of you surely know. Back us so that we can produce the best quality there is!8. Our team's backgroundWe are working at Brandlift, a full service digital agency, passionate about many things: Game of Thrones, videogames, great causes, and of course, animation! We created several motion design projects, including the multi award winner Brave Book, the first social media fairy tale, alongside with ACG. Brave Book was created for charity fund raising: when a celebrity started writing the fairy tale, and the follow-up was decided on social media platforms by the readers themselves.Episode Zero- fictional plot -John is sewing his next collection of clothes, when he accidentally sticks his finger. Smelling the drop of blood from far far away, suddenly a thirsty little vampire appears. As he opens his mouth, John starts cleaning his teeth with his yarn! And ta-da: a whole pigeon, a rabbit and a 16th-century Duchesse have been buried there all along! Now they are all set completely free!The little vampire is so happy, that he helps designing and sewing John's entire new collection. They even hold a fashion show at the vampire's castle. The design store's slogan now is: Taste for timeless. More and more little hipster vampires start helping with sewing and designing, while pigeons deliver the pieces of clothes that are finished! New castles pop up on the world map, as the brand starts blooming. 9. Risks and challengesOur risks include: gaps in communication, the time and effort needed to assess our contributors’ storyline. The production process might take longer than expected. But we are as excited as a six year old girl wanting to win the beauty contest in West Virginia! 10. Timeline 2016 - January - the idea of Indiville is conceived under the moonlight2016 - March - we start sketching up Indiville's universe2016 - October - our storyboard is ready2016 - December - the first animatics and animated excerpts come to life2017 - March - preparing to launch of the Indiegogo campaign2017 - Summer - estimated development of the first season’s episodesBy the end of 2017: estimated launch of the complete Season 12018: preparing and creating Season 2 of Indiville

story:
Hell Inc - Where You Get What You Deserve

We are a band of passionate filmmakers, actors, writers and comedians who have come together to bring the world an off beat, funny, and highly politically incorrect sitcom. 

Vinnie's life is miserable. He's been busting his chops for nearly 7000 years, worked to the bone in the corporation that is Hell. And yet, he gets no reward other than a snooty new dead woman to look after. 

6 episodes of this comedy will be shot in 2019. We're a non profit, indie group so any contribution we will get will go towards actor's lunches, equipment and lights. 

Hell Inc is the brainchild of Ronika, our head writer and producer, who has slaved overt he script for the better part of 2018 and now wants to make it become a reality. 

We are all in it for the passion of filmmaking and because making people laugh is the best way to get close to them. 

One Hell of a Ride

We are deep into preproduction, with the first rehearsals done and everyone cast and on board. 

We are currently still looking for a few key locations. 

The rest of our (as of yet, non-existent) budget will go towards: 

Editing: The edit is the life blood of each production, as the script is the bone structure. Without a solid and highly qualified editor we are doomed to mediocre results. We won't have that, and if it's the last thing we do!

Camera and Lights: Since we are all involved in the indie film business, we do have equipment available to us, but... it's old. It's got little aches and pains. So any funds we will receive will help us get/rent better cameras to bring you even closer into Hell! 

Our main goal here is to bring you a comedy that will get your heart thumping and get your fists clenched. You will love to hate these quirky characters. We sure do!

Every cent we are given will go into this project. It will be made, regardless of how much contribution we receive. But it will be made a lot better with your help!

 

Want to come to Hell?

Find us on Facebook, on Twitter, on YouTube. If you're in Dublin, come meet us for a coffee or help us on set!

story:
Hi, my name is John Servedio and this is our story.

I was a high school student that dreamed of creating and directing short films and sketches to entertain and provide some levity in the harsh political climate that we live in today. Due to my financial limitations and lack of crew, I was unable to bring my vision to the small screen. But recently, I had the epiphany that there are plenty of students, like myself, who are interested in careers as filmmakers and actors. They shared my drive and passion for a project like this one and I realized that we just needed someone to take this idea and bring it to life. I took that responsibility into my own hands, and when others showed interest, I knew the sky was the limit. With the help from my dear friends Autumn Bishop (my project manager and AD) and Jon Ovadia (my creative consultant and another AD), I set out to produce the projects I have written. Our only limitation at the moment is one of finances. With your donations, we would be able to create an opportunity that these young actors and film makers won't receive in many other places. They will get to create and have experience on an actual film set, experience that is necessary to success in such a cut throat industry. Your donations are the first step to a bright future. Every and all donations matter, no matter how small.  Thank you!

story:
Hitman Hobbies: The Magic of Friendship is a comedy action web series that follows Liam Angelo Bertolli, an early 30s illustrator and hitman, who also happens to be a Brony. Liam is hired by construction boss Celeste Marconi to take out The Black Market Organist. Celeste also encourages Liam to make friends along the way.

What is a Brony? A brony is a fan of My Little Pony that is outside the target demographic of little girls.

Our aim with this web series is to convey the importance of friendships in daily life and that no one should face anything alone.

The inspiration for the web series is primarily drawn from the monologue Hitman Hobbies by Emma Strong; which is about a guy who absolutely loves My Little Pony. As well, Hitman Hobbies: The Magic of Friendship is inspired by Marvel’s Daredevil and My Little Pony.

With this unique combination of inspiration, even though Hitman Hobbies: The Magic of Friendship is a comedy, there are a lot of dark, moody aspects to it. It has the light friendly humour of My Little Pony with the dark undertones and realism of Marvel’s Daredevil.

Liam Angelo Bertolli (Francesco De Francesco) is about to get the answers he needs from the tied up Marcus Blake (Trevor Neskovski)

Progress

We are currently in full swing of pre-production. We have secured the entire cast with excellent actors who are motivated and thrilled to be a part of the project.

***UPDATE***
July 11, 2017
Hitman Hobbies: The Magic of Friendship is EXCITED to announce that it will feature the My Little Pony inspired music of Notion. You can check out all his awesome music by clicking the YouTube video below or head on over to his Bandcamp page at https://notion128.bandcamp.com/

We’ll be keeping this page updated with our progress, including pictures, actors and general project developments.

In addition to that, if we reach our goal we will be giving out rewards and opening new tiers with some AWESOME STUFF.

Budget

Much as we’d like to, we can’t fund this web series alone. The money raised on IndieGoGo will go towards actors, costumes, props, and locations. Even though Hitman Hobbies: The Magic of Friendship is a web series, we aim to create a web series of the highest quality. We are passionate about the project and would really want to have that reflected into the final product.

story:
Who We Are & What We Need

We are seeking $10,000 in funding to cover production of the trailer for RIF. This trailer will be used to shop the multi-episode series around to major networks for full-scale production. At the moment we have significant interest in producing the show, but our potential funders aren't interested in the small-scale production of the trailer. That's where you come in!

Our Team

We have brought together a skilled team of professionals to produce and sell RIF:

Saudia Davis is an artist, social entrepreneur, and a film producer based out of Chicago. She prides herself on creating spaces in which artists can play with their talents and reach their full potential. In 2009 she founded Smart Pants are Leaders (SPAL), an organization that drives youth empowerment through arts & gardening. More recently, she lead efforts to restore a 1000-seat theater on the West side of Chicago and open it to the community. Saudia brings over 20 years of film and television experience to the RIF team and has spent her time both in front of and behind the camera. Above all, Saudia prides herself in nurturing new talent and encouraging greatness through art. 

Jacque Rabie is a Los Angles-based filmmaker studying Directing at Chapman University. From a young age, heʼs loved storytelling - beginning with game design and the release of several iOS apps, and ending up as a narrative and commercial director. He has worked on over 40 narrative shorts and directed commercials for startups such as Breadr and Tovala.

Samantha Kurtz is a production designer based out of Los Angeles. Sheʼs currently a sophomore at Chapman University and works as a production designer. She began her career as an art PA and eventually worked her way up to art directing sets with a crew of hundreds. With this, sheʼs ready to take on a new passion project and create a gritty aesthetic with costumes and design that match the gritty world of RIF.

Kevin Pontrelli is our narrative Director of Photography. He has worked on hundreds of sets as a 1st AC, key grip, best boy, and has experience with every other piece of camera department. His experience as a DP extends to shooting upperclassman projects at Chapman, to numerous collaborations with Jacque such as on the Tovala commercial. His dramatic, low-key lighting style is a perfect match for RIF.

Your Impact

Your contributions make all the difference! We made sure to bring together some of the best talent to create the world of RIF and we want to be able to provide them with the best equipment for the job. 

Your contributions help us with the following: 

  • Cameras & tech
  • Cast & crew
  • Set Design
  • Legal Fees
  • Admin Fees

Risks & Challenges

At the moment, our only challenge is raising our targeted funding. While we are confident in our project, we understand that sometimes fundraisers fall short of their goal. That being said, we are a team of driven & experienced artists who are passionate about making RIF a reality. Whatever funds we are able to gather, we will put to work on this project in the best way we can. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our campaign on social media & tell your friends!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mickael Gold. I moved to Los Angeles a few years ago because I grew up watching films from the 80s set in this beautiful city of angels. Unfortunately, now in the movies they do not pay it justice enough. I saw a lack of motivational messages in all of the recent blockbusters. The main characters are not really goals to reach and that is what we want to change. I want to show the young generations that there are new heights to reach. Millennials have no idea what it is like to be respected, have honor, dignity, pride, or other values that the generation before was supposed to teach us. Instead they decided to undermine us and keep us assisted.

The series is about an actor who gets his life turned around. "After getting a role stolen, Jackson, a young wannabe actor, finds himself driving a tough guy producer around the beautiful yet dangerous city of Angels, the same city where he last saw his father."

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is funding for the production. Ironically we do not require fundings for the general needs of a production because frankly what is behind the camera doesn't necessarily matter as much as what's in front of the camera.

We need to find houses to show life of celebrities in LA; sports car; luxury clothes. All of that needs to be perfect. The show needs to do exactly what it is, "SHOW". Instead of only seeing celebrity lifestyle on Instagram, imagine if there was a series that described you how a young actor full dream actually reach that lifestyle by not giving up.

The Impact

This series that we are producing is not just for entertainment purposes, but also to rise up to the best version of each of ourselves. Think about all of those great films and series from 40 years ago that pushed us to be better people and to not blindly accept our fate. Help us show the rest of the world that it gets brighter at the end of the tunnel.

I already produced one short film that successfully shared the idea in mind. You can find it on Youtube. Although I have experiences, this show is totally new and is like never seen before

A series that is about luxury lifestyle, intense car chases, breathtaking panoramic view of the city of Angels, and many other characteristic that we miss from the films and tv shows in the 80s.

Risks & Challenges

I presented this show to a production company and they told me that the impact was not real, that it will not be relatable for anyone. Their answer shows how much I need to make this project happen. People do not want to believe anymore, they do not want to dream anymore. Recently, production companies have just made franchises that already worked before because it is not risky, but that is not how we can change our everyday life. The world is not well right now, because humanity is not well. Everyone is sitting on their couch, binge-watching the same thing over and over again. Films and shows that have either brutal and horrific violence, or overdramatic suicide stories, and yes all of this is current in our society but people don't necessarily want to watch their regular life. I want to show the audience a more OPTIMISTIC point of view and I can assure you that I will do it anyway even if I have to film it with my phone and spend all of my savings.

Other Ways You Can Help

The best part of this fundraising campaign is that I do not necessarily ask for money.  I exposed to you exactly what we were missing, so you as an investor can either send us money in exchange for different benefits, or find us what we are looking for (mansions, sports car, luxury clothes...). Share it on social media, email us if you find something. Get involved with this project because it is the kind of project you would love to binge-watch. Imagine the satisfaction when you will see this show on Hulu, Youtube, Netflix, Amazon and other streaming platforms and you will be able to say you made it happen.

story:
Thank you for visiting our IndieGoGo page!

What is Karma?

Karma is a passion project of ours that has been years in the making. It’s a web series about life, love, loss, mystery, moving on, and playing with the cards you’ve been dealt. It’s heart-wrenching, funny, suspenseful, and supernatural. The first season will consist of 8 episodes.

Last summer, we were able to bring the pilot to life… it was a lot of fun, a lot of work, and incredibly rewarding. It is being released TOMORROW, Sunday November 15, 2020 at 5:15pm EST! (At which point it will be live on this page!)

Help us with our vision

We need help with funding for things like props, wardrobe, renting locations and equipment, and providing food and beverage for cast and crew.

Our modest goal of $2000 will supplement our own investment to finish season one.

Any money raised above and beyond our goal will go towards funding season two… we already have lots of ideas!

If we don’t reach our goal, we will “play with the cards we’ve been dealt” (see what we did there?) and finish this season with the highest quality possible.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge in filming an independent web series is scheduling. We’re all working for free – so it’s hard to ask our cast and crew to skip a day of work to come work on the series for free. Likewise, our editor has to prioritize paid gigs over our unpaid series… understandable.

Scheduling can be a major struggle, which leads to delays in releasing episodes. Currently, our goal is to film as much as we can over winter, finish production in the spring, and release the rest of the first season in one episode per week increments over summer 2021.

If scheduling is a major roadblock and we find ourselves behind, we will release half of the season in summer, take a couple months to catch up, and then release the rest of season one in the fall.

Regardless of how it works out, the rest of Karma season one is coming – so stay tuned!

What’s in it for you?

Every dollar counts! The price of a coffee and bagel at Tim Hortons makes a huge difference to us. Every dollar donated earns our sincere gratitude and appreciation for helping us do what we love and work on this project we are all so passionate about.

We also offer perks ranging from a simple thank you, to exclusive content, to promotion in our videos… make sure to check them out!

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough, we understand! If you can’t contribute financially, you can help us by sharing our campaign with friends or posting to your social media.

Use the IndieGoGo share tools and post on all your social media.

Follow us on Instagram and share our posts to your story.

Every bit of exposure helps!

If you’ve read all the way to the bottom, thank you so much!

Don’t forget to share!
story_txt: Thank you for visiting our IndieGoGo page!What is Karma?Karma is a passion project of ours that has been years in the making. It’s a web series about life, love, loss, mystery, moving on, and playing with the cards you’ve been dealt. It’s heart-wrenching, funny, suspenseful, and supernatural. The first season will consist of 8 episodes.Last summer, we were able to bring the pilot to life… it was a lot of fun, a lot of work, and incredibly rewarding. It is being released TOMORROW, Sunday November 15, 2020 at 5:15pm EST! (At which point it will be live on this page!)Help us with our visionWe need help with funding for things like props, wardrobe, renting locations and equipment, and providing food and beverage for cast and crew.Our modest goal of $2000 will supplement our own investment to finish season one.Any money raised above and beyond our goal will go towards funding season two… we already have lots of ideas!If we don’t reach our goal, we will “play with the cards we’ve been dealt” (see what we did there?) and finish this season with the highest quality possible.Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge in filming an independent web series is scheduling. We’re all working for free – so it’s hard to ask our cast and crew to skip a day of work to come work on the series for free. Likewise, our editor has to prioritize paid gigs over our unpaid series… understandable.Scheduling can be a major struggle, which leads to delays in releasing episodes. Currently, our goal is to film as much as we can over winter, finish production in the spring, and release the rest of the first season in one episode per week increments over summer 2021.If scheduling is a major roadblock and we find ourselves behind, we will release half of the season in summer, take a couple months to catch up, and then release the rest of season one in the fall.Regardless of how it works out, the rest of Karma season one is coming – so stay tuned!What’s in it for you?Every dollar counts! The price of a coffee and bagel at Tim Hortons makes a huge difference to us. Every dollar donated earns our sincere gratitude and appreciation for helping us do what we love and work on this project we are all so passionate about.We also offer perks ranging from a simple thank you, to exclusive content, to promotion in our videos… make sure to check them out!Other Ways You Can HelpTimes are tough, we understand! If you can’t contribute financially, you can help us by sharing our campaign with friends or posting to your social media.Use the IndieGoGo share tools and post on all your social media.Follow us on Instagram and share our posts to your story.Every bit of exposure helps!If you’ve read all the way to the bottom, thank you so much!Don’t forget to share!

story:
Short Summary

(RE)WILD MOTHERHOOD- Mothers have been taught to believe that a wild childhood is magic, but a wild motherhood is selfish, childish, somehow wrong - and that’s not true. I want the stories of these magical wild mamas to help dispel these myths. (RE)WILD MOTHERHOOD is a web series that aims to tell stories that haven't been told before. Too often women- mother's voices are overlooked in the outdoor community. Motherhood outdoors is often dismissed as not "epic" enough, not "wild" enough- when in reality the journey of motherhood is one of the wildest stories we can tell. 

What We Need 

The primary expense is travel- in order to tell various stories with a diverse cast of women we need to be able to get to these stories.

Production costs

** None of the money will go to paying any sort of salaries- all $$ goes directly to production of the series.**

The Impact

This series seeks to promote dialogue about motherhood and inclusivity not just in the outdoors but in all areas of life.

It will share stories from mamas from all financial, cultural, and personal backgrounds, women of all religions, colors and sexual orientations, mamas with one child and mamas with many, women who travel the world for adventure and the mamas whose backyard is where they seek their wildness.

This series aims to represent motherhood in all of it’s magic and many layers shared through the lens of the wild outdoors.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Submit your story/ follow the series journey on Instagram @rewild_motherhood

Follow the series on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvtMx_nQfxxvMT...

SPREAD THE WORD//SHARE THE LOVE

story:
A group of young Florida girls wants to pursue hockey. Comical drama quickly arises as the girls and their quirky parents embark on a road to sports equality.

You can help them get there. 

I began writing Thin Ice over six years ago. It started as a film script, but I quickly realized that the characters and their cause deserve much more than an hour and a half of limelight. The story is fictional. It's significance is real.

I grew up in a lot of ice rinks, both professional and recreational. My household was (is) full of avid NHL fans, and my little sister began playing the sport at a very young age. I saw my fair share of practices, tournaments, and team events. I witnessed first-hand the discouragement and sexism that those young Florida girls faced. I saw their parents struggle to combat those doubts and instead teach their girls about defying the odds and staying strong.

That fight is truly the root of Thin Ice. While the show is comically entertaining, it's truth lies within it's cause. The message of encouragement and passion is something I full-heartedly stand behind. You can help me bring it to light.  

Contribute 

Filming will take place by the end of 2019. The finished pilot will then be brought to distribution companies and streaming services for consideration. Your contribution will help us get there, be it $1 or $1,000. To learn how to be more involved, check out the "Perks" section of the campaign. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No worries! You can share this campaign with family/friends. Be on the lookout for the release of the show!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Beat Goes On:

The Beat Goes On follows Jamie, a working-class northern teenager going through the ups and downs of everyday teen life. From heartaches to nose-breaks, we see Jamie and his friends growing up on the streets of Manchester, searching for a purpose and the meaning of everything going on around them. 

Beautifully shot in Manchester, it will give the audience an authentic experience of life in the northern capital whilst also understanding the lifestyle habits of a teenager in today's society. The series will also address crucial social issues, such as sexual harassment and mental health in young men, approaching subjects that are often neglected and not discussed in the public eye. 

My name is Brad Whitford, and I'm a Film Production student at Salford University. I'm 20 years old and I've grown up a stone's throw away from Manchester.  Writing has been my passion from an early age, and my dream has always been to see one of my creations come to life and for it to have an impact on people. I'm in love with Film & TV and to get the chance to produce this sitcom would be a dream come true. 

Where the money goes:

Crew & Casting Costs: For this production, we will have at least 18 members of cast and crew. To make sure that the show is the best it can be, experience will be preferred, thus leading to higher costs, but overall a much better and more professional production!

Equipment Costs: We will be renting equipment to shoot with from an external supplier, for 5 days (intended shooting length). This includes; 2x Camera's, 2x Shotgun Mics, 2x Body Mics, 2x Tripods, Shoulder Rig, 50mm Prime Lens and a 70-200mm Telephoto Lens. All of these are necessary to produce the slickest and most clean cut show possible. 

Catering: A well-fed cast and crew makes a happy one! Working on a low budget means that it would cost quite a chunk more to shoot for more than 5 days, therefore making sure the cast and crew are happy and healthy means that productivity stays high and deadlines are met.

Props/Clothing: Clothing is an essential part of any show as it sets the tone for the character, and allows them to express themselves boldly but silently. Being set in Manchester, you can probably guess the vibe of most of the outfits that will be in the show. Abbie Killen, a Fashion graduate from UAL will be the lead Fashion Consultant, giving some much needed expertise and insight into what someone wears can say about them.

Insurance: Boring I know, but entirely necessary in order to stick to the budget. At least if something does go wrong we are adequately covered, meaning that productivity and the budget doesn't take a hit.

Check out the perks section to see what you can earn for your contribution

Other Ways You Can Help:

Can't donate? Don't worry! There are other ways you can still help:

Share this campaign - Spread the word!

Use of equipment - If you have any of the equipment listed above or any old equipment that you don't have use for anymore, please get in touch! Any sort of equipment is brilliant :)

Know anyone?- If you know someone who might be interested in helping with the distribution, marketing and/or any roles in the crew, get in touch!

story:
For what we crowdfund

  • rental cameras
  • rental sound recorders
  • rental lights
  • salary for team
  • food during shooting
  • PC for editing
  • be in use cars for testdrives

 

Only together

     Like you, I love cars, travel, adventure, invention. And I really want to create a great project for you. Moreover, you can participate in it, both remotely and directly!
     Each of you can move this project forward.
     It is very important! Only together we can create a great show, viewing which people can relax, have fun, laugh and learn something new.
      All those who support the project, will be indicated in gratitude.

 

We collect - you get

   We need start-up capital. After collecting that we will be able to shoot independently new and interesting releases of the show.
     In some perks you can get a unique content, pre-releases, to bring your ideas to the show, even star in an episode of the show!
      We calculated the minimum budget, with which we will make a high-quality show.
      If we do not reach the required capital, although I do not want assume it, we will make the most out of what will be collected.

 

Real

     In this project, each team member will be engaged in only by the fact that he loves. This means that everything will be done with love. Here is no place for pretense and tautness. Only sincerity!

 

Other ways you can help

If you can't support the project financially for some reason, you can help us by telling about our project the greatest number of people!
We will be very appreciate any help in the promotion of our company :)

story:
The Journey

Hello. I was born Rae Hartwell. I married a man and 18 years later (the age of 37 years to be exact) I came out of the closet as a lesbian. Recently in 2018, I began my  transition from female to male taking on the name Rai Silvr.  Friends told me I should write a book about my life. Well let's just say, I kinda took their advice, mixed in a massive twist, and out popped this intriguing creation called GRiP.

GRiP is a crime-based psychological thriller that features a transgender male by the name of Trey Moore struggling against the dark impulse or drive manifesting itself as raw lust and obsession. 

  • The production team at Silvr Stream Media are seeking funding to finance Season One of GRiP. 
  • Your contribution will bring GRiP, its characters, and a must watch, never been told storyline to life. 

NEEDS

We need between 150-250k to fully fund the pilot pay for all inclusive cost of production and to cover some marketing, promotions, and technology expenses to expand GRiP's reach to audiences world wide. Part of the funds will also help kick start a merchandising budget for complimentary products on GRiP the Series's existing website.

  • Production Crew and Equipment Rental for 7-10 Days of Filming
  • Lighting and Sound Equipment
  • Post Production (Editing, Special Effects, etc)
  • Music (licensing, songwriting, and recording)
  • Art/Stunt/Insurance/Permission (Set Design, Stunt Coordination, Insurance to Cover for Accidents and Damages, Registration Fees, Licensing Fees etc)
  • Legal (Entertainment Attorney Retainer Fee) 

For your Contribution of $250 or more

  • Receive an Official GRIP T-Shirt (black)
  • Receive an Official Cast Signed Poster
  • Receive Digital Download Of Official Trailer

Risks & Challenges

There is a certain amount of risk involved in launching a unique television pilot especially with the complexity of the main character being transgender. However this is what also makes it exciting to participate in because of its ground breaking qualities. 

But Here are a Few Ways We are Mitigating the Risk:

  1. Identifying Target Audience and engaging them through Social Media
  2. Soft Promotion and Branding to Test the Current Market
  3. Building a Social Media and Web Based Presence.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We need your help getting the word out about GRiP.  Help us spread together word about our campaign.
  • Share our campaign with friends and family. 

And that's all there is to it. We appreciate your support.

story:
The Story

His family on the brink of ruin, Lt. Commander Marcus DeVol takes command of the destroyer/escort starship Chimera in a last attempt to restore his status by running down pirates and blacklisted vessels for prize money. It's a "safe" job by military standards, but a change of orders just before cast-off will send Marcus and his crew far from home and into very real danger.

Marcus has few illusions about his purchased commission. An academic, he is untested as a leader of men, and his curious mix of officers and crew regard him with a wary eye. Like Chimera herself, they've been pieced together based more on Marcus' tight budget than their experience and reliability. Many of them are foreigners with pasts who have joined the service for a clean slate. Some are more competent than others; few of them have seen real combat.

In the course of their mission, they will encounter both friend and foe, and venture into uncharted territories whose occupants each come with their own strange agendas. Marcus and his crew will soon be tested by combat, by uncertainty, and by fear, as every leg of their journey and every encounter brings a new set of unknowns and challenges. Into The Void is a journey deep into the blackness of hostile space, where nothing is certain.

 

The Show

The year is 2641. Humanity has spread out and colonized the galaxy. Some colonies remain loyal to their masters, others rebel or request independence. Instead of monolithic United Federations ruling the galaxy, individual worlds play host to many nations, each with their own culture, traditions, and territorial claims in space.

Into The Void  is, first and foremost, a story of characters, of military men far from home and cut off from family and loved ones -- imagine a submarine movie, set in space. We've even made a deliberate effort to strip down the tech and avoid the usual gimmicks. No aliens, no laser guns, no holographic interfaces, no fusion reactors... and NO SHIELDS -- these guys are going to have to rely on heavy armor, countermeasures, and strategy to survive. Chimera is not a wealthy vessel; her crew is making do with both limited provisions and materials during their perilous mission. There will be action, but it will always be in service of the story.

 

Why Fund Us?

"Machinations Entertainment" is a husband and wife team. Actors, musicians, additional artists -- everyone is a hired hand or volunteer. While we've been able to create the assets and infrastructure to produce the show, we still need to be able to pay our actors, crew, and artists for their contributions to the project. The initial plan was to produce the pilot episode with our own money, and then use that as a proof of concept to run a large crowdfunding campaign to fund a whole season of the show. Sadly, life has a way of happening, and we simply don't have the funds to do this completely on our own. We need your help!

What We Need Money for:
  • To pay the cast.
  • Additional costumes.
  • Continued cost of CGI/VFX software (most developers have moved to subscription based services).
  • Some additional camera/lighting gear.
  • A couple of props.
  • A space larger than my basement to set up my portable greenscreen studio for the shoot.
  • Sound FX/Music.
  • On set food. Actors must eat to survive.

 

About Us

My name's Michael Gates, and I've wanted to make movies since I was a kid. By my teens, I had already taken up computer graphics and had begun making short videos, which eventually evolved into two feature length live action/CGI animated films. But those were just practice: home movies, really. I've come a long way since then, making a curious career that has allowed me to build a set of skills that put me in a position to create something truly unique. I've been a reporter for a local newspaper, videographer for a ski resort, independent video editor & videographer, and CGI/VFX artist.

My wife, Laura, has an entirely different background. A teacher by trade educated in Chemistry, today, she's raising our two boys, and volunteering in a whole host of causes. We've wanted to produce film projects together pretty much since we met; we've been developing Into The Void on the side for almost 5 years, and the time has now come to make it happen!

 

Impact and Ambition

Every episode of INTO THE VOID will be at least 20 - 30 minutes long, with the pilot clocking in at at lest 60. This gives us the space to tell complete stories within episode, rather than relying on ten or more 3-minute installments to form a whole. These sound like grand ambitions, but the strides of digital technology are making shows like this more and more possible every year. The entire show will be shot on green screen and composited into virtual sets, a technique long since common to feature films and becoming steadily more so on television. I've already built the 11 sets needed for the pilot episode, as well as all the ship exteriors. I've storyboarded the entire episode from start to finish using digital dummies on the completed sets; everything from lighting to lens lengths to camera placement/movement to physical onset measurements has been figured out. I just have to shoot according to the plan, drop the footage in, and tighten up the edit.

I've searched all over and I've found nothing like what we're trying to do. With this show, there's a chance to make a real splash on the internet with an absorbing, broad scope, low-budget show aimed at intelligent, thinking adults, yet entertaining for just about anyone.

 

In Conclusion

Whether you choose to donate or not, we hope you'll subscribe to our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram feeds, as well as our Youtube channel. If INTO THE VOID sounds like something you'd like to see, you can support our project by helping us get the word out:

  • Use IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word.
  • Follow us, share our posts, and invite others to follow us on social media:

TWITTER: @seriesinto

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/Into-The-Void-Series-2...

INSTAGRAM: @intothevoidseries

  • Share links to our project with others you know who might be interested.

Thanks for taking the time to read our pitch, and we hope you'll consider helping us get this ambitious project off the ground!
story_txt:
The Story
His family on the brink of ruin, Lt. Commander Marcus DeVol takes command of the destroyer/escort starship Chimera in a last attempt to restore his status by running down pirates and blacklisted vessels for prize money. It's a "safe" job by military standards, but a change of orders just before cast-off will send Marcus and his crew far from home and into very real danger.

Marcus has few illusions about his purchased commission. An academic, he is untested as a leader of men, and his curious mix of officers and crew regard him with a wary eye. Like Chimera herself, they've been pieced together based more on Marcus' tight budget than their experience and reliability. Many of them are foreigners with pasts who have joined the service for a clean slate. Some are more competent than others; few of them have seen real combat.

In the course of their mission, they will encounter both friend and foe, and venture into uncharted territories whose occupants each come with their own strange agendas. Marcus and his crew will soon be tested by combat, by uncertainty, and by fear, as every leg of their journey and every encounter brings a new set of unknowns and challenges. Into The Void is a journey deep into the blackness of hostile space, where nothing is certain.
 
The Show

The year is 2641. Humanity has spread out and colonized the galaxy. Some colonies remain loyal to their masters, others rebel or request independence. Instead of monolithic United Federations ruling the galaxy, individual worlds play host to many nations, each with their own culture, traditions, and territorial claims in space.

Into The Void  is, first and foremost, a story of characters, of military men far from home and cut off from family and loved ones -- imagine a submarine movie, set in space. We've even made a deliberate effort to strip down the tech and avoid the usual gimmicks. No aliens, no laser guns, no holographic interfaces, no fusion reactors... and NO SHIELDS -- these guys are going to have to rely on heavy armor, countermeasures, and strategy to survive. Chimera is not a wealthy vessel; her crew is making do with both limited provisions and materials during their perilous mission. There will be action, but it will always be in service of the story.

 
Why Fund Us?
"Machinations Entertainment" is a husband and wife team. Actors, musicians, additional artists -- everyone is a hired hand or volunteer. While we've been able to create the assets and infrastructure to produce the show, we still need to be able to pay our actors, crew, and artists for their contributions to the project. The initial plan was to produce the pilot episode with our own money, and then use that as a proof of concept to run a large crowdfunding campaign to fund a whole season of the show. Sadly, life has a way of happening, and we simply don't have the funds to do this completely on our own. We need your help!
What We Need Money for:
To pay the cast.
Additional costumes.
Continued cost of CGI/VFX software (most developers have moved to subscription based services).
Some additional camera/lighting gear.
A couple of props.
A space larger than my basement to set up my portable greenscreen studio for the shoot.
Sound FX/Music.
On set food. Actors must eat to survive.

 
About Us

My name's Michael Gates, and I've wanted to make movies since I was a kid. By my teens, I had already taken up computer graphics and had begun making short videos, which eventually evolved into two feature length live action/CGI animated films. But those were just practice: home movies, really. I've come a long way since then, making a curious career that has allowed me to build a set of skills that put me in a position to create something truly unique. I've been a reporter for a local newspaper, videographer for a ski resort, independent video editor & videographer, and CGI/VFX artist.
My wife, Laura, has an entirely different background. A teacher by trade educated in Chemistry, today, she's raising our two boys, and volunteering in a whole host of causes. We've wanted to produce film projects together pretty much since we met; we've been developing Into The Void on the side for almost 5 years, and the time has now come to make it happen!


 
Impact and Ambition
Every episode of INTO THE VOID will be at least 20 - 30 minutes long, with the pilot clocking in at at lest 60. This gives us the space to tell complete stories within episode, rather than relying on ten or more 3-minute installments to form a whole. These sound like grand ambitions, but the strides of digital technology are making shows like this more and more possible every year. The entire show will be shot on green screen and composited into virtual sets, a technique long since common to feature films and becoming steadily more so on television. I've already built the 11 sets needed for the pilot episode, as well as all the ship exteriors. I've storyboarded the entire episode from start to finish using digital dummies on the completed sets; everything from lighting to lens lengths to camera placement/movement to physical onset measurements has been figured out. I just have to shoot according to the plan, drop the footage in, and tighten up the edit.
I've searched all over and I've found nothing like what we're trying to do. With this show, there's a chance to make a real splash on the internet with an absorbing, broad scope, low-budget show aimed at intelligent, thinking adults, yet entertaining for just about anyone.
 
In Conclusion
Whether you choose to donate or not, we hope you'll subscribe to our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram feeds, as well as our Youtube channel. If INTO THE VOID sounds like something you'd like to see, you can support our project by helping us get the word out:


Use IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word.
Follow us, share our posts, and invite others to follow us on social media:

TWITTER: @seriesinto
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/Into-The-Void-Series-2...
INSTAGRAM: @intothevoidseries
Share links to our project with others you know who might be interested.
Thanks for taking the time to read our pitch, and we hope you'll consider helping us get this ambitious project off the ground!

story:
What is Let's Be Friends...?

Let’s Be Friends... is a dramedy about the challenges that come with the discovery of your identity. Currently, we are raising money to film the Pilot Episode where roommates Lex and Charlie navigate their complexly layered friendship during an eventful house party, culminating with an uncomfortable discovery for each of them: they are definitely not straight.

The series is a humorous following of the friends as they grapple with the idea and execution of learning to be gay, and navigate the ramifications of their parallel-but-very-different experiences with this have on their friendship and personal identities.

This production is dedicated to: Female Empowerment. Female Creativity. Female Stories. In particular Queer Females. There is a huge, important push for diversity in entertainment right now, and this production is committed to this both in front of and behind the camera.

It is vitally important that the nuances of Lex and Charlie's experiences are brought to light, and that can only be done by having queer women responsible for bringing them to life.

This story is by queer women, about queer women, and for anyone because struggling with who you are and how to feel like yourself in this world is something that anyone can relate to. Also, it's funny and a good story, and anyone can enjoy that!

Our production team is built around women who can directly relate to this story, and our focus is on capturing a visceral feeling. Let's Be Friends... is an exploration of innovative storytelling that is not normally seen in this kind of short, digital format.

Through collaborative utilization of artistic creativity and expression, we will create a unique, expressive tone that highlights the truth, humor, and beauty of the story. Follow us on Instagram for updates @LBFseries

The Team:

Sam Henning (Writer/Executive Producer/"Charlie")

I'm Sam Henning, the creator of Let's Be Friends... As a former child actor who grew up working in the collaborative New York theatre scene, the power of creating community and social change through art is an endless wealth of inspiration for me. I want to bring the sense of creative community and passion that I have found working on live theatre in New York and Chicago to my work in the film and television industry in Los Angeles.  I began writing LBF nearly five years ago with just the spark of an idea and a desire to work on a script with complex, diverse characters that my friends and I could relate to. Since then, the project has grown along with my ambitions for it, and I am grateful beyond words to everyone who is coming together to making this vision a reality. I'm on social media @samkhenning 

Landry Allbright (Co-Producer/"Lex")

Landry is an accomplished actor, writer and producer herself who recently completed her short film, Kill the Boyfriend, which she successfully funded on this very site. You may recognize her from her work as a child actor in Con Air, How the Grinch Stole Christmas, Malcolm in the Middle, or Will and Grace, or more recently from Adam Ruins Everything or S.W.A.T. -  or amongst many other places! In many ways, she's been the missing piece behind this project, and having her talent and insight in its development has been instrumental.

Olivia Saccomanno (Director)

Olivia recently co-founded a theatre company along with our leads and co-directed them in a queer women's production of Almost, Maine that was also funded through IndieGoGo. She has an MFA from the University of Connecticut and is an accomplished actor herself. Her insight never fails or be poignant and profound, and her ability to lead with sensitivity and care is instrumental to this project.

Katharine White (Director of Photography)

Katharine White is an award-winning cinematographer with experience in film, music video, and commercials. When not on set she cooks, bakes, and eats many pies. She is an amateur herbalist, homebrewer, book collector, and cat wrangler.

Alma Sever (Composer)

Alma is a multi-talented composer, songwriter, violinist, guitarist, and all-around badass.  Finding her instrument early on, she studied classical music and toured internationally with her youth symphony. After performing for years as a guest artist with nationally touring bands in Colorado, she began fleshing out her compositional experience by writing music for bands that ranged from folk, roots reggae, jam bands, and alternative rock. 

Sarah Hinchcliff ("Morgan")

Sarah is an actor, podcaster, and mental health advocate. She earned her BFA from AMDA and is active in the LA theatre scene. Recently, she performed in all-female productions of Macbeth and A Midsummer Nights Dream with Shakes on the Deck. You may also recognize her from many comedy sketches on the web. She's on social media @FatSarahForPrez

Joshua Walker ("Michael")

Joshua is a farm boy from Barnwell, SC. After graduating from Winthrop University, he traveled to take part in the thriving theatre scene in Minneapolis, MN. Upon moving to Los Angeles, Joshua created The Social Renaissance Project through which he has created a number of short films and web projects in an attempt to raise awareness on societal issues in America.

Sam Tank ("Chad")

Sam Tank was born and raised in Minneapolis, Minnesota. He earned his BFA in Acting from The Theatre School at DePaul University in Chicago. He studies at Stuart Rogers' Studios in North Hollywood. Upcoming projects include "Home" a film in which he co-wrote and starred in.

Lauren Bencomo (Hair & Makeup)

Lauren is an accomplished makeup artist who began working in LA in 2012.  Her various artistic nuances show in her ability to make any face her canvas and create beauty in a number of ways. Lauren has been a personal to several celebrity clients and her ambitious spirit has allowed her to be a part of many amazing projects - including this one!

Ryan Miller (Producer/AD)

Ryan has served as a beacon of light in getting this project made. He's read more drafts of our scripts than anyone else and has been a major supporter of this project for years, continuously lending his expertise in navigating production. He works for REP Interactive and has logged countless hours producing, writing, and directing for their clients. He is a graduate of the film program at NYU Tisch.

What We Need & What You'll Get:

While your contribution helps us to fund our pilot episode, it also serves as a way to begin building the community that will collaborate on and share in this story. Our perks are designed to provide you with opportunities to get directly involved in the project because sharing ownership of this is incredibly important to us. 

Believe it or not, $15,000 is actually a small price tag for a production like this. We have some amazing actors and crew members who are dedicating their time, talents, and resources to Let's Be Friends... for little to nothing out of belief in this project. However, to do their talents and this story justice, we still need to afford:

  • Equipment Rentals (Camera, Lighting, Sound, Electrical, etc.)
  • Insurance (Required by SAG)
  • Payroll Fees
  • Filming Permits
  • Post Production (Editing, Color Correction, Sound Mixing, Etc.)
  • Feeding the Cast & Crew during production
  • Props, Set Dressing, Wardrobe, etc.
  • Fundraising Fees 
  • Festival Submissions

Our hope is to raise over $15,000 so that we can do more with this pilot and/or film more of the already written content for the series. There are some incredible characters and events in future episodes, so the more we raise, the more we will do. We are running an all-or-nothing campaign though, so if we do not meet our goal, we do not get any funds. It's extremely important for us to hit $15,000!

The minimum donation of just $10 gets you a link to download the pilot when it is completed, but larger donations offer opportunities for access to behind the scenes content, hand-made friendship bracelets, an "Easter egg" in the pilot, naming a character, an invitation to a premier event, and producer credit. Every contribution is hugely helpful, and super crucial in allowing us to keep momentum in this fundraiser, build a community, and give a voice and platform to this series. We have big plans for it going forward, and we cannot wait to get started!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out! If you have a friend who you think would be interested in this project, let them know! Share our campaign on social media, post about it, text about it, call your friends on the phone or send an email. It's cliche, but that really is the most helpful thing you can do!

Getting the word out about Let's Be Friends... is just as important as raising the money to shoot it. We want everyone to be as excited as we are to see this made!

We are also looking to bring more crew members on board as we work through pre-production during this campaign, so if you or someone you know is a queer woman working in "the industry," definitely reach out with your interest.

story:
Short Summary

  • The creators of Neapolitan are Sally Thames and Greg Voelkel. Sally and Greg are both from South Carolina and go to college in Chicago. We've teamed up with some friends to start a production team to get funding for the projects that we are desperate to make. In school it's hard to get cast and hard to find people to make the things you write. So, why not make it yourself? That's the goal. Contributors will help us to get access to the technology required to  create our projects, costumes and locations to make sure our projects look as wonderful as they can, and promote our content to audiences we might not otherwise reach. 

Risks & Challenges

  • We know that we are asking a lot. And we might not make our goal. But we will make these projects. We are determined and excited about everything we have planned. Your donation will just make it a lot easier for us to start, and more importantly, to finish.  

​Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, we totally understand. But sharing our campaign with your friends and family is super helpful! Thanks so much!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I’m Bella, the writer and creator of the BABY MAMA DRAMA: WEB SERIES! Having received my B.A. in Multimedia and Filmmaking in 2015 from NJCU, I’ve been putting sincere effort into fulfilling my passion, gaining experience and creating art with the skills I have been blessed to learn while doing what I love most – STORY TELLING. With that in mind, I joined a community of like-minded artists to connect and collaborate with and became a member of the Black TV & Film Collective. Through my membership, I was able to network with extremely talented, local artists whose dreams were on par with that of my own; their dedication to their craft enabling them to collaborate on the BMD project for little to nothing which is a huge blessing considering season one of BMD is very low budget and was produced with funds that were solely from my pocket. Considering I am a “starving” artist like most who don’t get paid to do what they love; I am forever grateful for resources like the BTVFC and Indie-Gogo that help artist like myself make our dreams come true. 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is necessary for the production of BMD season 2 as I am no longer in the position to fund production for the web-series myself for a number of reasons – one being what is currently transpiring due to Covid-19. Speaking of, I sincerely apologize to those who may be having a hard time financially and otherwise getting through this trying time. It is not my aim to be insensitive in asking for financial assistance considering, however, season 2 has been in the making for months before the pandemic became a hindrance; and with the effort put in by the BMD team, it would hurt me to disappoint those who have made an effort from day one to take the series where we know it can go. That disappointment would be magnified if I could not find some way to bring BABY MAMA DRAMA season 2 to the fans. 

We love our fans SO MUCH and have been listening to their suggestions and requests for an even bigger and better season 2! Your contributions will help us deliver the following:  

  • LONGER EPISODES! - ALL episodes in season 2 will be at LEAST 15 min! (Episodes in season 1 were 8-12 min) 
  • MORE EPISODES – We are bringing you EIGHT (8) all new episodes! (Season 1 we only had 6) 
  • MORE CHARACTERS – We’ve had to cast THIRTEEN (13) new characters for season 2 – including the kids of the main cast that the fans have been asking for. 

Contributors will enable me to feed my very deserving cast and crew while on set; have access to better locations; rent more equipment for an even more cinematic production to expand on the quality fans have grown to love; pay some of our “starving” artists a little something for their time and effort; as well as props and set design to assist with visual storytelling.  

The Impact

We have determined we would need about $7,000 to produce season 2 the way we envision it and the way our fans deserve to see it. And because we understand how big of a deal that is to raise, we have come up with some awesome perks to reward those who are fortunate and kind enough to donate – how do these babies sound? 

 How cool would it be to see your name in the credits with a “Special Thanks” shout out? Or would you like to be ON SET during production during one of our shoot days and see how fun filmmaking is behind the scenes? Or how about a small speaking role that’ll produce footage for you to add to your acting reel and experience to add to your resume? Or would you like to rub elbows with the cast, crew and other fans/supporters of BMD at our season 2 premier party?

The blessing of Indie-Gogo is that production for BMD will still receive whatever funds we raise should we not reach our goal of 7k and no matter the amount, it will go towards production of season 2 – being applied to remaining locations to be secured and equipment rentals like cameras, microphones, dollys, etc, but most importantly, FOOD haha. 

Risks & Challenges

What is currently transpiring throughout the country due to Covid-19, our project is experiencing a serious delay. We run the risk of not meeting our goal while attempting to raise funds during a pandemic however it is very important to us to bring our supporters a season 2! As the series creator, I am hoping that no matter the outcome, we are able to push forward and produce an even more entertaining and successful season.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a monetary contribution at this time, we completely understand! Because BABY MAMA DRAMA already represents a collection of artists, we are also open to accepting collaborations as your form as generosity. If you are a makeup artist, fashion designer make beats or music you would like to have featured on season 2, please send inquiries and submissions to babymamadrama.webseries@gmail.com

Hello, I’m Bella, the writer and creator of the BABY MAMA DRAMA: WEB SERIES! Having received my B.A. in Multimedia and Filmmaking in 2015 from NJCU, I’ve been putting sincere effort into fulfilling my passion, gaining experience and creating art with the skills I have been blessed to learn while doing what I love most – STORY TELLING. With that in mind, I joined a community of like-minded artists to connect and collaborate with and became a member of the Black TV & Film Collective. Through my membership, I was able to network with extremely talented, local artists whose dreams were on par with that of my own; their dedication to their craft enabling them to collaborate on the BMD project for little to nothing which is a huge blessing considering season one of BMD is very low budget and was produced with funds that were solely from my pocket. Considering I am a “starving” artist like most who don’t get paid to do what they love; I am forever grateful for resources like the BTVFC and Indie-Gogo that help artist like myself make our dreams come true. 

What We Need & What You Get
This campaign is necessary for the production of BMD season 2 as I am no longer in the position to fund production for the web-series myself for a number of reasons – one being what is currently transpiring due to Covid-19. Speaking of, I sincerely apologize to those who may be having a hard time financially and otherwise getting through this trying time. It is not my aim to be insensitive in asking for financial assistance considering, however, season 2 has been in the making for months before the pandemic became a hindrance; and with the effort put in by the BMD team, it would hurt me to disappoint those who have made an effort from day one to take the series where we know it can go. That disappointment would be magnified if I could not find some way to bring BABY MAMA DRAMA season 2 to the fans. 
We love our fans SO MUCH and have been listening to their suggestions and requests for an even bigger and better season 2! Your contributions will help us deliver the following:  

LONGER EPISODES! - ALL episodes in season 2 will be at LEAST 15 min! (Episodes in season 1 were 8-12 min) 
MORE EPISODES – We are bringing you EIGHT (8) all new episodes! (Season 1 we only had 6) 
MORE CHARACTERS – We’ve had to cast THIRTEEN (13) new characters for season 2 – including the kids of the main cast that the fans have been asking for. 

Contributors will enable me to feed my very deserving cast and crew while on set; have access to better locations; rent more equipment for an even more cinematic production to expand on the quality fans have grown to love; pay some of our “starving” artists a little something for their time and effort; as well as props and set design to assist with visual storytelling.  
The Impact
We have determined we would need about $7,000 to produce season 2 the way we envision it and the way our fans deserve to see it. And because we understand how big of a deal that is to raise, we have come up with some awesome perks to reward those who are fortunate and kind enough to donate – how do these babies sound? 
 How cool would it be to see your name in the credits with a “Special Thanks” shout out? Or would you like to be ON SET during production during one of our shoot days and see how fun filmmaking is behind the scenes? Or how about a small speaking role that’ll produce footage for you to add to your acting reel and experience to add to your resume? Or would you like to rub elbows with the cast, crew and other fans/supporters of BMD at our season 2 premier party?
The blessing of Indie-Gogo is that production for BMD will still receive whatever funds we raise should we not reach our goal of 7k and no matter the amount, it will go towards production of season 2 – being applied to remaining locations to be secured and equipment rentals like cameras, microphones, dollys, etc, but most importantly, FOOD haha. 

Risks & Challenges
What is currently transpiring throughout the country due to Covid-19, our project is experiencing a serious delay. We run the risk of not meeting our goal while attempting to raise funds during a pandemic however it is very important to us to bring our supporters a season 2! As the series creator, I am hoping that no matter the outcome, we are able to push forward and produce an even more entertaining and successful season.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to make a monetary contribution at this time, we completely understand! Because BABY MAMA DRAMA already represents a collection of artists, we are also open to accepting collaborations as your form as generosity. If you are a makeup artist, fashion designer make beats or music you would like to have featured on season 2, please send inquiries and submissions to babymamadrama.webseries@gmail.com

story:
Bref résumé

Je m'appelle Alexandre Blais-Graveline et je suis un réalisateur et scénariste dans la ville de Sherbrooke. J'étudie en travail social, ce qui fait que je peux exploiter les thèmes des différentes problématiques sociales de notre société dans la websérie. J'ai réalisé et/ou écris plusieurs court-métrages, dont un qui a gagné le prix du meilleur court-métrage. Je suis réputé pour mon talent de scénarisation, car j'ai la capacité à emmener des sujets sensibles, taboux, percutants et humains qui viennent toucher nos émotions et nous prendre par les tripes.

Le projet Psycho est extrêmement important pour moi, car j'y mets de tout mon coeur et ma passion. J'y exploite des thèmes humains et je me sers du cinéma afin de pouvoir sensibiliser la population face aux différentes problématiques sociales. Psycho est également la preuve qu'on peut faire du bon cinéma avec peu de budget. 

Avec l'argent amassé lors de cette collecte de fonds, nous pourrons rendre l'expérience Psycho encore plus percutante. 

Nous sommes une grosse équipe travaillant sur le projet. Cette saison 2 sera produite par Diversion Images et écrite et réalisation par moi.

Il y aura une trentaine de comédiens d'expérience qui travailleront sur le projet.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons besoin d'un montant minimal de 2000$ (env.350$/épisode) afin de pouvoir payer les frais de voyagement, d'équipement, de location de lieu, etc.

Votre aide nous est très précieuse. Si chacun donnait un petit don, aussi minime qu'il soit, nous pourrions facilement atteindre notre objectif

 L'impact

La série a un grand impact pour ceux qui la regardent. Elle sensibilise face à divers problématiques (santé mentale,toxicomanie, consentement sexuel, intimidation, violence, pauvreté, etc)

La saison 1 a également pu être présenté à la Maison du cinéma, dans la ville de Sherbrooke, lors d'une projection spéciale. 

Plusieurs entrevues ont été faites afin de pouvoir rejoindre un plus grand public.

Les avis sont unanimes: cette série doit être connu du plus grand nombre de gens possibles.

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Si vous ne pouvez pas donner d'argent pour la réalisation de la saison 2 de la websérie, vous pouvez quand même nous aider!

-En partageant la campagne de financement dans votre réseau.

-Parler de série à vos amis, familles, collègues, connaissances, etc.

-Regarder la saison 1 sur la page Facebook de la série: https://www.facebook.com/psycholaserie/

Merci beaucoup!!!
