story:
Reverend Thunder is a former priest who turned his back on God after his wife and toddler daughter were killed in a hit and run accident, the driver was never caught.

These days the good Reverend is the President of the notorious outlaw biker gang, The Disciples. He wields a chainsaw to get his point across. (He can also see evil on people, like a thin shadow that continually swirls around the person. Once it's on you, the shadow never leaves. Only death can save your soul.)

 

The Mad Mexican - no one knows Turnbull’s Christian name, or where he comes from, only that he arrived from South of the border. The only facts are these…his father was a half-assed wrestler in the Lucha Libre Underground known as El Baño. When he was just thirteen Turnbull was recruited into drug kingpin El Chapo’s vicious army of thugs where he developed his dislike for the bad guys surrounding him. After being forced to put his beloved pit bull “Malo el Hijo de Punta” into a dog fight, Turnbull turned the tables and before the fight concluded he had annihilated every living soul in the room, but not before his precious “de Punta” had been torn to shreds. Ever since, he has vowed to punish anyone who wrongs the innocent. In Mexico he is simply known by the moniker his trusted pooch once carried, which in English translates to “Bad Motherfucker.” 

 

As an infant, Monk was left on the doorstep of Buddhist monastery seated high atop a Himalayan Mountain. He trained in the ways of the Dalai Lama until he was a teenager. It was then the monastery came under attack by the Red Army invading Nepal. He managed to escape and make his way to America where he made money by battling in underground fight clubs. Monk gained a reputation for his soft demeanor outside the ring and his request to only battle evil doers. Contrary to his impeccable fighting skills Monk detests violence of any kind, except when confronted with the darkest side of man, then he slaughters without prejudice.

 

Redtop is a true meat-eater, skull-crusher with a ferocious appetite to kick ass and never take a name . He grew up in the streets of Brooklyn, N.Y.. As a child, Redtop's parents were murdered in front of him by a couple of wise guys. In classic Redtop fashion, at only ten years old, he hunted down all those responsible and murdered them with a hand axe. His vicious nature is only outdone by his surprising kindness to those in need. He has been seen holding the door for a lady and handing out a few bucks to the homeless. On the flip side, if you're an evil dick, Redtop loves nothing more than tequila after killin' motherfuckers.

 

Cochise is a full-blooded Cherokee Indian who grew up on a reservation in Oklahoma. His father was a drunken gambler with a tendency for violence. His mother was a hard working waitress. One night in a drunken rage his father nearly beat his mother to death with a large black dildo. Without thinking, Cochise grabbed a machete and returned to the favor to his dear old dad, leaving him all but dead. The incident landed Cochise in juvy where he spent the remainder of his formative years in gladiator academy's across the Midwest. Cochise began to stand out as he developed his own brand of frontier justice - if you're a good guy, Cochise has your back, but if you prefer running' with the devil, well, then a good ol' fashioned scalping' is comin' your way, machete style.

 

Solomon King is a wolf in wolf's clothing. He's tough, cool, and calculating. Whatever good deed he may seem to do there is always an anterior motive behind it. Can't blame him though, Solomon comes from that kind of stock. His dad was President of The Death Merchants (TDM), a violent gang of sociopaths who used to run the drugs, the hookers, the whole city. His father had a rep for being brutal and two-faced, a trait that lead to his eventual murder in prison. Solomon would make his mean ol' papa proud, rising up to become Warlord of The Reapers. For a time, they ran the same way TDM did, viciously.

That is until Reverend Thunder and The Disciples arrived on the scene and began dispensing their own unique brand of street justice - protect the weak, punish the oppressors.

Much to the dismay of Solomon and The Reapers, The Disciples proved too strong. So, for the moment, The Reapers and The Disciples are in a truce. But, nothing lasts forever.

 

The heart of The Disciples, Amy took to living on the streets as a young teenager to get off the grid after using a steak knife to circumcise two thugs who raped her alcoholic, widowed mother. She sold drugs and hooked to get by, becoming a nasty little junkie with a penchant for violence. But, when she was nineteen her life would change forever when Reverend Thunder picked her up, dusted off the sewer, got her clean, and out of the life. His love and kindness awoke the sleeping sweetheart inside Amy. She is now a popular stripper with a heart of gold. She and the good Reverend are planning to start a family and buy a house at the beach - until her disappearance.

 

The Disciples tells the story of Reverend Thunder, a priest who is able to see evil. The Reverend  turned his back on God years ago when his wife and toddler daughter were killed by a hit and run. These days the good Reverend is the leader of the outlaw biker gang The Disciples, who are on a mission to clean up the city and make the streets safe again.

The Reverend’s descent into hell begins upon the abduction of his newly pregnant stripper girlfriend, Amy. Walking home from work late one night, Amy is abducted by two masked assailants. Being the bad ass she is, Amy escapes her captors in a cornfield only to be immediately knocked out and abducted by two redneck brothers. She then awakens in an old barn while being raped. Amy quickly frees herself and kills the two brothers with no remorse. At that moment, her original captors stand at the barn door ready to take her back. A brutal battle ensues but this time Amy does not prevail.

Solomon King, war lord of rival gang The Reapers, gives The Reverend Thunder a snuff film, one of his Soldiers came into possession of, in which Amy is brutally tortured and murdered. The Reverend and the rest of The Disciples mount up, hit the streets and lay waste to anyone who has any information leading to those responsible for Amy’s murder, landing them on the doorstep of a suburban home caught in the clutches of a demonic possession.  

This same night, something sinister has been unfolding within the walls of this cursed suburban home. The young couple currently living in the home are visited by the previous owner, Andrew, who tells a wretched story involving the vicious murder of his younger brother and several friends within the home just a few short years ago. Andrew believes these innocent teenagers were slain by a demonic entity that was in the midst of chasing down Snake, a violent outlaw from the old west who stole a secret map called The Crusader’s Key which enabled him to escape from Hell. 

Snake’s new found freedom was quickly cut short by the demon, sending to bring him back to Hell. The map, however, was not retrieved by the evil entity, leaving it to be found by Andrew. Without the map in it’s possession the evil spirit remained, possessing whoever resides under this roof and forcing them to commit horrendous acts of violence and murder. 

The couple disposes of Andrew and deals with a pissed demon just as The Disciples come calling. Once inside the home, The Disciples find photographic evidence of them from 1846 in the Old West with Snake. Not sure what to make of this they question the couple and learn of Snake’s adventure and how he came into possession of a magical map used by Crusaders, God’s secret army. The map, known as The Crusader’s Key, is God’s key to the universe, enabling who ever possesses it’s power the ability to travel through space, time, life, death, Heaven and even Hell. With the power the map possesses Reverend Thunder realizes The Disciples may be able to go to Hell and save Amy.

As the demon rears his vicious head, The Disciples discover they are trapped inside the home with no way out. They come to the conclusion the map is their only escape from this nightmare. The only problem is, you have to die for the map to work. One by one, The Disciples are taken out in gruesome fashion by this relentless demon. In the end, Reverend Thunder must battle his one of his own, who becomes possessed by the evil spirit, to defeat the unholy saint and use the map’s power to go to Hell and save the soul of Amy and The Disciples. The good Reverend digs deep to regain his faith enabling him to exorcise the demon long enough to obtain the map and slice his own throat, sending him straight into the gates of Hell.

With the map clutched tight in his hand, Snake rises from the ground in the Arizona Territory, circa 1846. Not far behind, The Disciples and Amy rise from the Earth. A small troop of Army Soldiers witness this terrifying spectacle. A Colonel steps up, pulls a pistol, and demands some answers. Snake snatches the pistol from the Colonel and shoots him in the face. The Disciples then take the Soldiers weapons and horses and ride off into the sunset in search of - The Crusaders.

 

Yes, 60k is a lot but, we are crafting a show that will rival anything seen on any network. This budget allows us the ability to reach out to top name talent and crew, as well as A list effects houses culminating in a fully realized television series at the highest level.

With your contribution to the pilot you will be laying the foundation for what is to become an epic horror adventure like nothing seen before. The Disciples is the first stage of a planned universe in which our heroes transcend from mere outlaw bikers to mankind's last hope in an epic battle between good and evil, while drinking a lot of tequila along the way. "Nothin' wrong with a little fun." - Reverend Thunder

Here is a taste of what is to come...

 

In 2016 horror movies accounted for over 475M at the US box office alone. Horror is the most bankable genre in the motion picture industry, even if no big star or name directors are attached to the project. 

This year horror films have again continuously outperformed all expectations. Stephen King's "IT", an Rrated horror feature, has grossed over 300 million domestically on a 35M budget. IT has become the highest grossing, most successful horror film of all time, passing the former king of horror The Exorcist. 

On television, the Netflix horror series Stranger Things was such a hit the company is raising there prices before the release of season 2 on October 27th. 

Horror is everywhere, and it just keeps getting bigger. The Disciples has the real potential of becoming the next big horror series and you could be the reason. Your contribution, no matter the amount, brings this project one step closer to production. And if you can't afford to contribute but like the project please pass along this campaign to others you think may be interested. Indiegogo has excellent  tools to share this link. 

So please help us create something wholly unique that horror fans the world over can enjoy.

story:
BENEATH THE STARS – Watch Episode 01 of 06 ↓

http://www.facebook.com/beneaththestarsseries/

We chose Indiegogo because there is no better way for people to come together to tell a story that needs to be told. All of us can join our voices and let others know we want this to end. We're here because a lot us are very passionately involved in doing what we can to bring a story like this to it's conclusion.

The PERKS is the answer. Every dollar you contribute will go directly into making this happen. Whether it’s a little or a lot, the meaningful number is how many of us can come together to finally reach the finish line of this show. So please, just as important as your contribution is to convince your friends and family to join us on this journey! Share your enthusiasm through twitter, facebook, email, a phone call, or a good old fashion face-to-face chat. The more people join, the faster we can finish this!

Beneath The Stars will always and forever be available to view for FREE! You are not going to have to pay a fee to watch any of the episodes. If you have internet access, then you'll always be able to enjoy it. This is why your collaboration in ending this is so vital. Your participation will always and forever be the reason why this show was able to reach it's climax!

Here's an approximation of what it will cost to finish the remaining episodes through this Indiegogo campaign; Indiegogo 8%, Perks Cost 24%, Pre-Production 11%, Production 38% and Post-Production 19%.

Words can't express how thankful we are that there are others who are just as passionate to end this. A lot of times one feels alone, as if there is nothing one can do. But having faith and knowing that deep inside if you simply continue believing that good things will come, eventually they will. I know that if we all raise our voices together we will put an end to this.

Frequently Asked Questions!

Q:  When can I get my Perk?

A:  You will receive an email requesting your VOTE! All other PERKS have an estimated delivery month listed. We will notify you immediately of any delays.

Q: Can I upgrade my Perk?

A: As of now, Indiegogo does not have a built in function for this. If you want to upgrade to a higher perk level, simply contribute the difference between your original payment and your desired new Perk level. Be sure to contact us to let us know so we can update your record.

Q: What if I forgot to add shipping for my Canadian or International order?

A: Simply contribute the difference and contact us to let us know it is for the shipping to Canada or International delivery. For US Funders no additional amount is needed since this has been taken into account on the base perk amount. 

Q:  How do I tell you what T-Shirt size I need?

A:  We will send you an email requesting  the cut and size you want once the campaign comes to an end.

Q: When is the series taping?

The series will be taping during November 2017.

story:
Scoring Oceanside Show Pitch


We are creating a TV show that breaks the norm and exploits the issues going on in America.  


I love criminal justice and i feel very strongly about the issues going on in the world and i wanna make a difference by using this show to bring  change and open peoples eyes to controversial issues and give them a new perspective coming from a republican, christian and former sworn in officer, this show touches on addiction, sex trafficking political corruption, mental health and abuse all which i have personal experiences with and would love to see the world unite and confront these issues head on.


Ginny Edwards is one of the leads in this show she is a lot like me actually she is me, she's a was on her way to the olympics before she meets curtis jackson and gives up to be with him and create a life, now in my case it was theatre, but the experiences i had from abuse and gaslighting form my ex, was traumatizing and happens all over the world and needs to be addressed.



 

We first meet 16 year old Ginny edwards surfing the waves in oceanside california she's practicing for the olympics competition, while she's practicing there's a new drug hitting the streets of oceanside killing college kids, her father FBI agent Jesse Edwards is brought on the case to get to the bottom of it, while distracted by the case 17 Year old Curtis jackson tries to get ginny back causing ginny's best friend travis hamilton to agree to a challenge that could potentially be a death wish.



 

Oceanside is a diverse beach town powered by it’s beachfront and passion for surfing, but under the surface darker tides are turning, an undertow of government corruptions, sex trafficking, and illicit drugs wash over this beachfront town. A rise to political power 

Leveraged between figure heads and the mafia. An Ambitious Special Agent Jesse Edwards is caught in the eye of the storm when his teenage daughter is kidnapped and trafficked by the mafia, with blood in the water He struggles to keep the pieces of his family together, but with faith and christianity on their side can their faith prevail?

story:
Bienvenido

¡ Hola! Mi nombre es Francisco Retamal, más conocido por mi segundo nombre que es Alejandro.

Desde el año 2016 soy estudiante de Ingeniería Civil Informática, aunque las neurociencias son una de las disciplinas científicas que por estos días cada vez me están despertando más interés.

( link a mi certificado de alumno)

Pensando en cómo puedo dar dirección a este interés, es que encauzarlo desde el emprendimiento me pareció una gran idea, ya que al desarrollar investigación, tener mi propia empresa para financiarlo es lo que podría darle mayor libertad y alcance.

Más allá de mi interés por las neurociencias, he observado un problema muy claro en Chile. He observado que mientras en otros países existen científicos popularmente reconocidos a nivel mundial como son el caso de Michio Kaku y Neil DeGrasse Tyson( que son portada de revistas, invitados a programas de televisión y protagonistas de conferencias que son documentadas en video y vistas masivamente a través de canales como YouTube o charlas TED), al igual que científicos ya fallecidos como Stephen Hawking o el mítico Carl Sagan; en nuestro país, a pesar de que tenemos científicos de talla mundial, ocurre que casi nadie los conoce.

Recuerdo que uno de los varios motivos por los que elegí estudiar donde estoy, fue que Eric Goles hace clases aquí. Sin embargo, desde que comencé mi carrera, de vez en cuando le pregunto a otros alumnos acaso lo conocen y me impresiona como prácticamente nadie tiene la menor idea de quién es él.

¡ Es hora de cambiar esto!

... así es como nace Científico Chileno. El proyecto de serie documental en video, asociado a un sitio web núcleo, cuyo objetivo es difundir la vida y obra de nuestros sobresalientes científicos chilenos.

La idea original supone 2 temporadas, de las cuales la primera temporada constará de 12 capítulos de larga duración, cada uno de ellos destinado exclusivamente a revisar la vida y obra de un único científico que se desempeñe actualmente como académico en mi Universidad.

Esta campaña de Indiegogo está orientada a la realización de esta primera temporada.

En mi Universidad desempeñan su labor imponentes científicos con estudios doctorales y posgrado, de vasta trayectoria y producción científica de calidad suprema. Solo por mencionar a alguno, está el caso de Eric Goles:

  • Eric Goles: Premio Nacional de ciencias. Puso en alto el nombre de Chile con sus aportes en Matemáticas Discretas en la Universidad de Chile. Fue conocido por ser conductor del programa Enlaces de TVN en los 90's. Ex-presidente del CONYCIT para el gobierno de Chile. Participó en la fundación del Instituto de Sistemas Complejos de Valparaíso. ( enlaces externos: Eric Goles en wikipedia, Eric Goles en Mentes Brillantes)

También se pueden encontrar los casos de Andrés Concha Saldias, John Anthony Atkinson o Eduardo Moreno, entre muchos otros, que han realizado aportes invaluables tanto para Chile como al mundo cada uno en su disciplina.

( enlace externo: Bernardo González publica estudio en revista de la Academia Nacional de Ciencias de Estados Unidos. 1 Marzo 2019.)

Qué necesita el proyecto y qué obtienes al apoyarlo

Debo decir que antes de crear esta campaña en Indiegogo, la decisión ya estaba tomada:

¡ La primera temporada de Científico Chileno se rodará sí o sí!

Sin embargo, hay algunos requerimientos necesarios para darle una calidad adecuada a un proyecto audiovisual de este tipo.

Elementos técnicos, tales como cámaras de calidad, estabilizadores de cámara, trípodes y micrófonos. Elementos de los cuales no dispongo.

Elementos técnicos

Actualmente dispongo de una cámara Sony Cybershot DSC-WX350 que tiene la capacidad de grabar video en Full HD y que podría ser suficiente para llevar adelante la serie. Además de una cámara GoPro y mi celular Samsung J4, con los que puedo conseguir grabaciones de similar calidad. Sin embargo, lo ideal es tener una cámara Reflex o al menos una cámara como la Sony Semiprofesional DSC-HX350 cuyo valor es aproximadamente de $250.000.

( enlace externo: Michael Gondry rueda un corto con un iphone)

Más importante aún, sería tener al menos un trípode para alguna de las cámaras, que es algo relativamente barato: no más allá de $30.000.

Otros elementos técnicos relevantes, además de un par de trípodes, son una tarjeta de memoria SD( $10.000~$40.000) o un estabilizador de cámara( el Feiyutech G6 Plus cuesta alrededor de $180.000, otros pueden variar desde los más básicos como el Fantaseal o un Neewer que van entre los $15.000 a $50.000, a los electrónicos más avanzados como el Moza AirCross, Zhiyun Crane o el DJI Ronin que varían entre los $250.00 y $500.000).

Todos estos, elementos de los cuales no dispongo en este momento.

Más adelante, al final de esta página podrás revisar los detalles relativos a todos estos elementos... pero lo más relevante y costoso, no son los elementos técnicos, sino que es el elemento humano que corresponderá a una cifra cercana al 80% del presupuesto total.

El elemento humano

Durante la primera quincena de Febrero estuve recolectando información disponible en internet de algunos profesores, y algo como descargar y ordenar los papers únicamente del profesor Eduardo Moreno, es una tarea que puede demandar una día completo de trabajo. Y para qué hablar respecto a estudiar en profundidad los papers, tarea que me demandaría al menos una semana de trabajo por cada uno de los más de 12 académicos estudiados( la selección final es de 12 científicos).

Además de esto, entre mucha gente más, es necesario un entrevistador que tenga buena dicción y preferentemente experiencia con las cámaras, quien pretendo que sea un estudiante de la carrera de periodismo.

El 2018 conversé con un estudiante de periodismo que fue mi compañero en una asignatura que los ingenieros compartimos con otras carreras. Él tiene experiencia de varios años como Youtuber, y se mostró muy interesado en participar. Pero el tiempo en la Universidad es apremiante y el interés de mi compañero acarrea las dudas respectivas a este problema, en vistas de participar. Yo mismo me veré limitado al avanzar en este proyecto una vez comiencen las clases en Marzo del presente año. Así que como cualquier trabajo, remunerar el trabajo del estudiante que decida ser partícipe del proyecto será un incentivo de importancia en pos de dar profesionalismo a este.

( Para ver el presupuesto meta de la campaña, click aquí )

->> Qué obtienes con tu apoyo <<-

Lo primero y más relevante que obtendrás al apoyar este proyecto, será la satisfacción de estar contribuyendo a que nuestros científicos y su relevante trabajo( de calidad internacional) sean reconocidos a nivel nacional, lo cuál por sí solo ayudará a fomentar el desarrollo de la ciencia en nuestro país.

Además de eso, obtendrás una recompensa detallada en la columna derecha de esta página, acorde al monto de tu aporte. Para ver en qué consiste cada recompensa, debes hacer click en la imagen correspondiente a la recompensa que quieres conocer.... o mira los siguienes videos:

 
 
 

 

 

Programa de retribución: Y por último, porque quiero retribuir tu colaboración y para que te intereses en que este proyecto en verdad sea exitoso: El 25% de todo lo que recaude el proyecto "Científico Chileno"( todo lo que recaude que no provenga de esta campaña de Indiegogo), estará dirigido a retribuir las donaciones realizadas en esta campaña y hasta completar al menos el doble de la donación inicial que hayas entregado.

Las ganancias del proyecto provendrán principalmente del patrocinio de empresas cuya publicidad aparecerá en la serie y el sitio web, suscripciones de pago al sitio web CientificoChileno.cl para acceso a material complementario de la serie, y cualquier otro evento que tenga relación directa con el proyecto, tales como entrevistas, shows y marchandising.

El impacto

Pocas personas saben la calidad e importancia del trabajo de nuestros científicos.

Un solo ejemplo de esto, es el desconocimiento de Cesar Hidalgo( no quiero ser repetitivo en mencionar a Eric Goles) quién es el único chileno que se ha convertido en profesor en la Universidad más importante del mundo en Ingeniería y ciencias, el MIT. Cesar Hidalgo junto a Ricardo Hausmann( Venezolano, profesor de Harvard) entre otros, crearon el "Atlas of economic complexity", y quién junto a su equipo del MIT desarrollaron el sitio web abierto, de mismo título, en donde se puede analizar la economía de cada país en gran detalle. Entre muchos otros desarrollos online.

Si bien Cesar Hidalgo no es candidato para la primera temporada que está enfocada en la Universidad en que estudio( pero lo es para la segunda), muchos otros académicos de igual relevancia para el desarrollo de Chile y la ciencia, serán conocidos por la gente.

Consecuentemente, el éxito de este proyecto será un éxito no solo para mí y mis proyectos futuros enfocados en la neurociencia, sino que para todo el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile y más.

Nuestros científicos no solo son un aporte para el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile sino que en el mundo. El pasado lo ha demostrado. El trabajo desarrollado en Chile ha sido no pocas veces un aporte a la ciencia a nivel mundial, y eso es lo que sabrás una vez que la serie Científico Chileno sea liberada.

Riesgos & desafíos

El tiempo es probablemente el bien más preciado del que disponemos. Como tal, trabajar en este proyecto será un desafío enorme a lo largo de mi año académico, pues estudiar Ingeniería Civil Informática ya es algo muy demandante.

Esto hace que todo el apoyo que reciba esta campaña sea tan valioso y útil para un desarrollo más efectivo y de calidad para Científico Chileno.

Además, es para mí un particular desafío 2 aspectos de este proyecto:

  1. Por un lado, poder retratar a cada científico y sus trabajos de manera que su relevancia pueda ser claramente percibida por el público, sin transformarlo en una serie aburrida de ver. Debe ser de interés para todo el público, tanto adultos como niños y gente pertenecientes a toda área del quehacer nacional.
  2. y segundo, lograr que sea un proyecto productivamente exitoso al nivel de lograr retribuir cada peso de la ayuda entregada a través de esta campaña a cada uno de los donadores y duplicar su donación.

Todo esto requerirá una continua planificación y ejecución ante cada imprevisto en el transcurso de su desarrollo. Evaluar cuidadosamente cada inversión monetaria, el plan de marketing y la calidad en cada detalle.

Otras formas de ayudar

Si no puedes ayudar aportando dinero o si ya aportaste y el proyecto te motiva lo suficiente para querer ayudar aún más:

  • Comenta a tus amigos acerca de esta campaña y compártela en redes sociales.
  • Suscríbete ingresando tu correo en la página principal de CientíficoChileno.cl y recibe una actualización semanal respecto al estado del proyecto.
  • Sigue la página de facebook de Científico Chileno, el canal de YouTube.

... y ya estamos en la ruta, por el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile y el mundo.
Alejandro.

( Para ver el cronograma del proyecto, revisa en el sitio web. Click aquí )

Además de eso, obtendrás una recompensa detallada en la columna derecha de esta página, acorde al monto de tu aporte. Para ver en qué consiste cada recompensa, debes hacer click en la imagen correspondiente a la recompensa que quieres conocer.... o mira los siguienes videos:

 

 


 

 

 

Programa de retribución: Y por último, porque quiero retribuir tu colaboración y para que te intereses en que este proyecto en verdad sea exitoso: El 25% de todo lo que recaude el proyecto "Científico Chileno"( todo lo que recaude que no provenga de esta campaña de Indiegogo), estará dirigido a retribuir las donaciones realizadas en esta campaña y hasta completar al menos el doble de la donación inicial que hayas entregado.
Las ganancias del proyecto provendrán principalmente del patrocinio de empresas cuya publicidad aparecerá en la serie y el sitio web, suscripciones de pago al sitio web CientificoChileno.cl para acceso a material complementario de la serie, y cualquier otro evento que tenga relación directa con el proyecto, tales como entrevistas, shows y marchandising.

El impacto
Pocas personas saben la calidad e importancia del trabajo de nuestros científicos.
Un solo ejemplo de esto, es el desconocimiento de Cesar Hidalgo( no quiero ser repetitivo en mencionar a Eric Goles) quién es el único chileno que se ha convertido en profesor en la Universidad más importante del mundo en Ingeniería y ciencias, el MIT. Cesar Hidalgo junto a Ricardo Hausmann( Venezolano, profesor de Harvard) entre otros, crearon el "Atlas of economic complexity", y quién junto a su equipo del MIT desarrollaron el sitio web abierto, de mismo título, en donde se puede analizar la economía de cada país en gran detalle. Entre muchos otros desarrollos online.
Si bien Cesar Hidalgo no es candidato para la primera temporada que está enfocada en la Universidad en que estudio( pero lo es para la segunda), muchos otros académicos de igual relevancia para el desarrollo de Chile y la ciencia, serán conocidos por la gente.
Consecuentemente, el éxito de este proyecto será un éxito no solo para mí y mis proyectos futuros enfocados en la neurociencia, sino que para todo el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile y más.
Nuestros científicos no solo son un aporte para el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile sino que en el mundo. El pasado lo ha demostrado. El trabajo desarrollado en Chile ha sido no pocas veces un aporte a la ciencia a nivel mundial, y eso es lo que sabrás una vez que la serie Científico Chileno sea liberada.

Riesgos & desafíos
El tiempo es probablemente el bien más preciado del que disponemos. Como tal, trabajar en este proyecto será un desafío enorme a lo largo de mi año académico, pues estudiar Ingeniería Civil Informática ya es algo muy demandante.
Esto hace que todo el apoyo que reciba esta campaña sea tan valioso y útil para un desarrollo más efectivo y de calidad para Científico Chileno.
Además, es para mí un particular desafío 2 aspectos de este proyecto:

Por un lado, poder retratar a cada científico y sus trabajos de manera que su relevancia pueda ser claramente percibida por el público, sin transformarlo en una serie aburrida de ver. Debe ser de interés para todo el público, tanto adultos como niños y gente pertenecientes a toda área del quehacer nacional.
y segundo, lograr que sea un proyecto productivamente exitoso al nivel de lograr retribuir cada peso de la ayuda entregada a través de esta campaña a cada uno de los donadores y duplicar su donación.

Todo esto requerirá una continua planificación y ejecución ante cada imprevisto en el transcurso de su desarrollo. Evaluar cuidadosamente cada inversión monetaria, el plan de marketing y la calidad en cada detalle.

Otras formas de ayudar
Si no puedes ayudar aportando dinero o si ya aportaste y el proyecto te motiva lo suficiente para querer ayudar aún más:


Comenta a tus amigos acerca de esta campaña y compártela en redes sociales.

Suscríbete ingresando tu correo en la página principal de CientíficoChileno.cl y recibe una actualización semanal respecto al estado del proyecto.

Sigue la página de facebook de Científico Chileno, el canal de YouTube.

... y ya estamos en la ruta, por el desarrollo de la ciencia en Chile y el mundo.Alejandro.( Para ver el cronograma del proyecto, revisa en el sitio web. Click aquí )

story:
“They will pay… with rivers of blood!”

It may sound corny now, but if you grew up in the early 80s, those words turned every broomstick into a lethal katana. Martial Arts films dominated the American imagination, and kids everywhere devoured the canon. Many were lost to time. But one staple, one classic of the genre, kicks the most ass: Shogun Assassin. The bloodiest of them all. In humble tribute to Shogun Assassin, we warmly present WOLF, an original web series.

Set in present-day Las Vegas, WOLF, follows Judah WOLF, a dishonored ex-cop, searching the streets of Las Vegas with his 7-year-old daughter, Kikuyu WOLF, seeking bloody revenge on Korando Shinoda, the Yakuza boss responsible for his wife’s murder.

We, the producers of WOLF, want to offer a new generation a tale of revenge, loyalty, and honor. But we need bloodthirsty heroes to help!

We are raising $250,000 to create the highest quality web series.  You have watched the sizzle. That is just a taste of what the nine-episode series will be. Your awesome donations will go toward:

Nine quality episodes: 10-12 minutes each.

SAG Cast

Film Equipment

Set Design

Location Fees

Post Production, i.e., Editing, Sound Design, and more.

We're a Mixed Bag

The good folks in front of the camera look a lot like the good folks behind the camera. This series is a true melting pot. Broadcasting characters of varied races, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations.  To add, our team of producers is made up of all women. 

WOLF presents and represents a healthy American tapestry. And we welcome everyone to contribute to this series. Your love and support means more than written words can express.  

The Team

Sean Jackson - Writer/Director

Native Detroiter, Sean Jackson has written, directed and produced over 30 short films and one feature film. Sean has honed his craft by focusing on high impact content with strong themes. 

Kiki Knowles - Producer

Native Detroiter, KiKi Knowles is an independent film producer, who made her debut producing the web series sizzle Wolf directed by Sean Jackson. KiKi was first introduced to the industry as a child performing in stage productions across the Detroit Metropolitan Area. Her early training and background groomed her for the position to later serve as a manager for two of her children for several years propelling her into the film industry. 

In addition to film, KiKi enjoys writing poetry and is set to release her first published work of art this year. She is a devoted wife and mother of 3 who loves to travel and has a passion for working with underprivileged children. Paying homage to her Detroit roots, KiKi and her spouse are currently working to create a group home for children and veterans in the heart of the city.

Kathleen Shinn - Producer

Kathleen Shinn has had an interest in fine art since high school, she enjoys working with all mediums including collage, acrylics and clay. In college she continued her love of fine art but her area of concentration was in healthcare. Equipped with her artistic capabilities and knowledge in nursing, Shinn was exposed to filmmaking as a set nurse/EMT and with that exposure, a new passion took over. With an interest in film and a background in Healthcare, she developed an interest in special effects makeup. Working with these skills she served as a special effects artist on films “Sweet Ninja Brown” and “Territory 8”. Her love of filmmaking grew over the next several years working alongside writer/director Sean Jackson. She has produced several short films such as “It’s Karma, Baby,” “Dying to Tell You,” “Sweet Ninja Brown,” “House Rules,” “The Nowheres,” “The Bay Laurel,” and feature film “Bubblegum & Broken Fingers.” Shinn is writing her first screenplay and directed her first short film “Unintended”.

story:
WHO ARE WE & WHY ARE WE ASKING FOR YOUR MONEY?

Hey there! we are Chattabox, a Caribbean talk show started in 2016 with hopes of reaching a much wider market and bringing authentic caribbean culture to those who wouldn't usually get to experience it. This campaign is important because after years of being portrayed incorrectly or by people faking our accents we want people to see the real thing, Cool Runnings was a GREAT movie but it would've been greater if they were all really Jamaican. Contributions of even a dollar would help us with quality, scheduling, & expanding this as far was we really want it go, every little bit helps. This is a By Us For Us show & we want to be able to do it right.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need all the help we can get we are asking for a modest 6,000 cause even that can go a long  way, for your contribution you'll have a better watching experience, and way more than content before (with better audio lol)
  • We want you to know we are real and we are thankful for each and every fan we have so our perks stemming from personal thank you's to rare merch is our way of letting you know that.
  • The money will go toward a sound engineer, paying to rent our set, equipment, advertising & expanding production personnel

The Impact

  • Throughout history we have been misrepresented in mainstream media & with such a colorful culture this show can help us finally share our voice as well as unite the caribbean, eventually we want every west Indian to be able to hear themselves on our show and be entertained while watching.
  • The project is great already and if you check out the show while you are here you will see that, we just need help to make it greater and wider known
  • This is a real project that only wants to do good and grow, please be apart of that.

Risks & Challenges

  • There are similar shows out there, we want to make sure we become a staple as a caribbean editon of this model and we need to do so before it's too late.
  • We plan to grow this show so much that we don't need to worry about competitors or look alikes.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute you can share this campaign or just go watch the show that is a contribution in it self & we appreciate all of it!
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!

story:
Garage Gang is dramedy series consisting of 10 ten-minute 

episodes loosely based on the real life events of a group of 

talented, intelligent young black men on their own missions to 

escape the ills of urban society. Learning to laugh at their own 

struggle they start to devise a collective plan to change their 

reality. Following our ensemble through a maze of their own 

drunken retelling of events, we see the Chicago landscape 

through the eyes of it’s natives, never seen. Set on the East 

side, however they have been all over and represent their 

culture as a whole or individually. Much of their time together 

was spent in the Garage, a hip hop and house shrine nestled in 

the Chatham neighborhood. Also, a home away from for the main 

characters, as it serves as their clubhouse through their coming 

of age. 

 

In the web series, we are introduced to our characters in their 

most comfortable environment as they tell stories detailing 

their origins, as well as how they became the close crew they 

are. They realize they have a chance to make an impact with 

their collective ability and decide to take a shot while they 

work through obstacle after obstacle. “How to Make it in 

America? First we gotta make it out the Ghetto!” The different 

dynamics and viewpoints make for hilarious yet thought provoking 

themes and dialogue. Their antics, pointless arguments, and 

dreams of success color the reality of black men trying to be 

more than products of the same environment they love.

Also, a home away from for the main characters, as it serves as their clubhouse through their coming of age.  In the web series, we are introduced to our characters in their most comfortable environment as they tell stories detailing their origins, as well as how they became the close crew they are. They realize they have a chance to make an impact with their collective ability and decide to take a shot while they work through obstacle after obstacle. “How to Make it in America? First we gotta make it out the Ghetto!” The different dynamics and viewpoints make for hilarious yet thought provoking themes and dialogue. Their antics, pointless arguments, and dreams of success color the reality of black men trying to be more than products of the same environment they love.

story:
WE ARE...

9 Lime Films, AKA - Kris Taylor, Adrian Hadlington and Dan Hadlington.

A newly formed, small production team, based in North East England.

Last year, we produced our first short film, The Price, which was made with no budget, shot in 2 days using a compact camera, a £20 voice recorder and some home-made props. Oh, we acted in it too. If you have 4 minutes 53 seconds to spare, you can watch it here....

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oRzCRW-vZ24

Sooooo.... 

What We're Doing Next?

Our next project and the subject of this campaign SHORTCUT, is what we're dubbing a Limited, 3 Part, Micro Web Series (rolls off the tongue eh!). Episodes of 8-10 minutes each. 

We begin shooting on April 12th 2020 (Not a lot of time but hey....schedules!)

The series follows Michael, an average, working class dad, who's life is changed forever when taking a shortcut home,  where he witnesses a brutal gangland murder. 

As he attempts to protect his family from the fall out, Michael embarks on a journey of self discovery, digging deep to find the courage needed to fight back against the forces casting a dark shadow over his once perfect life.

What We Need...

Simply.... This is a much more ambitious project for us as new filmmakers but one we are confident about and really excited to make. So... we're looking for any assistance that allows us to suitably look after the cast (and crew... us) that have generously agreed to be part of this project i.e. food, travel expenses etc. After that, anything that helps us with other production costs would be a huge bonus. 

We've learned a lot since making 'The Price' and we're confident the overall production value will be far greater this time around. Your contribution will go a long way to helping us achieve that and also help us create a film worthy of the story being told.

Unable to Donate?

Don't worry... We appreciate the time you took to read this and maybe watch our film, but if you feel strongly enough, you can help by sharing this campaign on social media or simply by telling your friends about it.

Anything helps.... and again, thanks for your time. 

The 9 Lime Films Team

story:
Hello. My name is Terrence Patterson (picture below) and I am the creator/writer and executive producer of the web series, Half Past Jump Time. I have been involved in the entertainment industry for 10+ years starting in theater Off Broadway as an actor/Producer.  I also trained as an actor at HB Studios but I realized I was a better producer and then I started to trust my writing instincts.  I co-produced a play, The Newlyweds, for over 100 performances and I gained experience hiring actors, writing, audition, social media campaigns, budgeting and marketing among other skills. I formed my own digital media/streaming company and my first project (I have a few in development as well) is this web series.

The campaign is extremely important to me (and my team) as a newly proclaimed media entrepreneur because it would mean I am on the right path. I had a "day job" for many years and I would like this campaign to allow my team and myself to continue to do what we love. Create compelling stories within the web series space in which we would stand out as having a high production value and interesting characters/episodes. I financed the first two episodes and it was money well spent. I personally have skin in the game, the total production costs for episodes 1 and 2 were $11K, with more funding from you we are more than committed to seeing that we produce all of the first season episodes (8 - 9 episodes). Through my experience in theater, independent film, this web series and having a mentor who has network episodic series experience we are on a solid foundation. I will make sure the contributions are spent in the right areas (mostly post-production) for us to continue producing compelling stories.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will go toward the following:

1. 1920s wardrobe for entire cast (5 actors) - we have identified reasonably priced websites so that the main characters and extras have wardrobe that are period appropriate.

2. Post production - The show is scifi based so we would need the effects to be as organic as possible with the execution that modern audiences have grown accustomed to, but within budget. I have an advisor for post-production who works for a large, international VFX firm who will assist in making sure we attain maximum value for funds raised through this campaign.

3. Locations - Most will be under $1000/day. Period appropriate locations are hard to find even in New York City. We will shoot multiple scenes on the same day for locations that appear in more than one episode to conserve time and production time.

4. Food - It is always surprisingly more than you budgeted for initially. But I have used online resources which takes a few clicks and you can appeal to many food requests from vegan to all inclusive diet all in one space. 

5. Hiring one or two additional writers to help shape the series and to ensure all of the characters have distinctive voices and depth.

6. Salaries for cast/crew.

Unique Perks:

We have consciously created perks that we knew would get fulfill on a timely basis and that we thought would resonate with our donors.

A few of the Perks are:  walk-on part/background acting for NYC area residents; your photo (aged to appear from 1920s) in random scene or newspaper/magazine prop; early release of Episodes; invite to Harlem Renaissance party in NYC after production of Season 1.

The Impact of our show

My track record, the impact of the show and unlimited potential for our web series:

Having successfully financed, written and produced 2 episodes of the web series and over 100 performances of an Off-Broadway play, The Newlyweds (at the Producer's Club and at the American Theater of Actors) I am fully qualified (with my outstanding team of producers and mentors) to produce high quality episodes.  I have learned from my past mistakes on set, hiring actors for the wrong parts and having to find replacement for actors who fail to show up for a performance or on set.  My past productions have truly informed me on the art of being able to be a leader through all phases of production and post-production. I can ensure that your investment will be allocated to making the best production while being mindful of where the money is spent. I have been producing since 2006 and it is the only job that I have every had that does not feel like work.  I put my all into any creative endeavor that I am apart of and I am confident that now with a team behind me that believes in the project odds are we will be successful producing the remaining episodes. We believe the show is a valuable contributor to the modern landscape of online web series. Our project stands out from the crowd and with your help you can help us spread the word to others about our amazing story and character. A sci-fi, web series with not one but two female leads is rare and extraordinary. There is a definitely an underserved market for this type of production. It is the main reason we created the show.

In addition, our first (2) episodes of Half Past Jump Time are currently available for viewing on Facebook, Amazon Prime, Vimeo and our website (www.halfpastjumptime.com). We are humbled by the many hours of viewing of our web series across many viewing platforms (well over 10,000 minutes). The platform with the most views is LinkedIn, which I did not see coming or expect it.  My network (comprised of film and TV professionals, actors, production designers) on LinkedIn have responded very positively about the episodes and they see the unlimited potential in how we can present the Harlem Renaissance and introduce hip-hop elements from modern day New York.  Feedback from our audience has been positive as well and we would like to continue to provide more episodes to of course retain the subscribers as well as attract new viewers.

Risks & Challenges

With any production there are bound to be hurdles, unanticipated obstacles and just the unknown that can and will occur.  Some hurdles that I have encountered in the past have been locations not being available at agreed upon times, actors and crew late to set and holding up the entire production and of course going over budget.  The most important way to handle these specific challenges and others is to have as much planning/scheduling time during pre-production.  Project management skills, which I acquired at law firms in NYC, have saved me on theater and film/web series productions.  That is not to say that I will have all scenarios planned out and have action items to address them, but I will be as prepared. We are more than prepared to finish production on the remaining episodes.  Once the campaign is successful we can start dance and dialogue rehearsals.  Locations, wardrobe and the last actor have been cast for the main cast.  We are fully aware of where we want to go with the story but your investment will help get us there. Without it we will produce great episodes but with your donation and trust we can create something very special. Our audience deserves it and we want to provide interesting stories with characters that resonate well after our episodes are viewed.

To prepare for any of these obstacles that may arise during pre and postproduction I am being mentored by (2) very experienced producers. One has a background in TV network episodic material and the other has many years of experience film production at an international VFX shop. In addition to their advisory roles I have a background as a Producer for over 10 years, so I have a solid plan to achieve the highest quality production based on our budget.  Having gained valuable experience producing Off-Broadway theater, independent film and this web series I know that I am in a great space to make my team proud.  We have an outstanding choreographer (he also is an actor in the show) so that dance portion of the show will be on point. The cast are experienced actors/dancers and from the first (2) episodes you can see the potential of where we can take their storyline.

Other Ways You Can Help

What you can do to help outside of donations/investing:

If you are a fan of female driven, sci-fi action adventures please help us get the word out about this unique and compelling show.  The show is definitely going to explore the lives of New Yorkers in the Harlem Renaissance and juxtapose that against the lives of contemporary New Yorkers. With hip hop dancing thrown in for good measure I think we can agree that we are off to a great start. You have to be intrigued at this point and you can appreciate the potential of this show and its important as a web series.  We will provide all of our social media names/handles so that you can further spread the word on this new and unique show.  

Remember Indiegogo has its own sharing tools that help facilitate putting our show on the radar for people to view on their phone/laptops/televisions.  

Without your assistance in sharing to your friends, coworkers, ex-coworkers, friends in film, actor friends, family we have to stretch our marketing dollars to the maximum.  Your involvement is crucial in spreading the word as you are apart of the audience so your perspective is valued to your friends and family. It takes just a few seconds to share and you will help my team and for me as an entrepreneur I welcome any fan-based marketing of our production.

Social Media Links:

Facebook: @halfpastjumptime

YouTube:  Paragon Multimedia TV channel

Twitter: @HalfWeb

Instagram: hpjt_thewebseries

Pinterest: Half Past

 

TEAM:

Director:  Jingjing Tian

Jingjing Tian is a Sundance Writer's Lab and Sundance Sloan Foundation semifinalist. She has held fellowships at the NYPL and the Middlebury Script Lab and won best female director at an AT&T event. She has been interviewed on XM Radio and LeanIn.org.

With degrees in Biomedical Engineering, English, and an MFA in Creative Writing, she has worked on life support systems on the ISS (International Space Station), built jet engines, and holds a seat on the Democratic Committee in Brooklyn.

DP:

Matthew Levine

Matthew Levine is a cinematographer based in Brooklyn. He's worked on numerous films, music videos, commercials, and documentaries.

Choreographer:

Michael Bishop, professional choreographer and dancer, started dancing at age 21 at Belhaven University in Jackson, MS. Michael moved to New York upon graduating and has danced nationally and internationally gaining his union status in AGMA, AEA and is now SAG-AFTRA eligible. In addition to being the choreographer/ actor for Half Past Jump Time, Michael is now starting his own dance company titled Mollét Contemporary Ballet based in Manhattan New York.

Producer/Cast (Harriet - Time Traveler):
Shawnette Hamilton Robertson

American actress, director, producer and playwright has worked behind and in front of the stage/screen for 17 plus years. Her professional career began as an actress touring Off Broadway shows throughout NYC as well as being featured in several independent film shorts, web series and as a current member of the OPEN END REP theater group formerly known as American Ensemble Theater.  And now a writer performing in the leading role as Mary Abrams in her original stage play “MORE” and “MORE 2 POWER” she tells a story of her very own.

Creator/Producer:

Terrence Patterson

Terrence graduated from Oglethorpe University in Atlanta with a BA in Economics. He later moved to New York to pursue acting. He worked in a few international law firms during the day (honing budget skills, hiring a team and advising demanding law partners about e-discovery technology) while also working at an independent film production company (Aditi Pictures) for 10 years. Terrence also co-produced an Off-Broadway play, The Newlyweds, at The Producers Club and eventually for a few years at ATA (The American Theatre of Actors). He later founded his own independent production company, Paragon Multimedia LLC, as a way to create content for streaming and/or theatrical release.

Cast:

Caci Pritchett - "Aliya" (modern day dancer)

Caci Cole Pritchett began her dance training in Atlanta, GA at North Atlanta Dance Academy under the direction of Michael Garrison. She received her Degree in Dance from the Alvin Ailey/Fordham BFA Program as an E. Corrigan Scholar and Sr Leadership Awardee with a concentration in Pre-Med studies.  She has had the chance to grace the stages of the Apollo Theatre and the Dutch National Opera. She has performed works by several NY based choreographers including Ron K. Brown, Bill T. Jones, Matthew Rushing, Laurie Taylor, Maleek Washington etc. This year she’s also made her on screen debut on Amazon’s “ The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel”,  HBO’s “Succession”, and “Half Past Jump Time”. She will be joining the Broadway Lab for the remake of West Side Story choreographed by Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker this Winter. 

Galen Wesson - Charli (1920s scientist and friend of time-traveler)

Galen Wesson is actress from Tallahassee, Fl with a Bachelors of Arts from the Florida A&M University and Masters Degree from California Institute of the Arts.  She has worked on various plays and short films.

Michael Bishop - Tariq (and he is the Choreographer for the show)

Michael Bishop, professional choreographer and dancer, started dancing at age 21 at Belhaven University in Jackson, MS. Michael moved to New York upon graduating and has danced nationally and internationally gaining his union status in AGMA, AEA and is now SAG-AFTRA eligible. In addition to being the choreographer/ actor for Half Past Jump Time, Michael is now starting his own dance company titled Mollét Contemporary Ballet based in Manhattan New York.

Wendell Bullen - Elias "Eli" (modern day hip hop dancer)

A professional dancer/choreographer and actor Born and raised in Carriacou, Grenada, West Indies, Wendell Bullen started training in Dance as soon as he moved to New York City. He has trained in styles like hiphop(breaking, popping, locking, waving), ballet, modern, contemporary, jazz, street jazz, salsa, african and dancehall in facilities such as Steps on Broadway, The Door with Anthony Rodriguez  and Broadway Dance Center through a scholarship program. He has also received ballet training from Obediah Wright through his dance intensive.  Over the years Wendell has worked with a number of industry professionals and has performed at many charity events as a way to give back to people, some hosted by Danny Glover and Dr.Oz and he has also danced for NBC's Rednose Day Danceathon hosted by Nick Cannon and even appeared on an episode of the TV show "Impractical Jokers". You can catch Wendell modeling for popular brands such as Reebok, teaching dance workshops at IVY leagues through Redbull(MIT, BU, Harvard, Berkely College), acting and dancing in the new Vinci Headphone commercial and even modeling and performing in lots of music videos all over the internet for a number of major artists. He's also been in an Off-broadway play of 'In The Heights', Zombie Strippers (NYMF), Etymology of Bird. His biggest accomplishment is performing for Prince William and Dutchess Kate Middleton of England. Wendell is an amazing choreographer and teacher and also teaches classes in dancehall,hiphop choreography and freestyle and breaking. Wendell continues to show is love for the arts especially dance everywhere he goes. As well as teaching weekly dancehall classes with the worldwide collective of dancehall instructors and influencers known as "Danca Family", created by Redbull signee "Blacka Di Danca". He has also taught at many prestigious dance centers such as Broadway Dance Center, Peridance Capezio Center, Colgate University, Dancing Preachers International Conference, World Changers(Indiana), Movement Lifestyle(L.A)

In his spare time he also goes back to his country, Grenada, to donate his time to giving back to young up and coming talent and gives advice on the process of becoming a professional artist.

Behind the scenes and stills from Episodes 1 and 2:
story_txt:
Hello. My name is Terrence Patterson (picture below) and I am the creator/writer and executive producer of the web series, Half Past Jump Time. I have been involved in the entertainment industry for 10+ years starting in theater Off Broadway as an actor/Producer.  I also trained as an actor at HB Studios but I realized I was a better producer and then I started to trust my writing instincts.  I co-produced a play, The Newlyweds, for over 100 performances and I gained experience hiring actors, writing, audition, social media campaigns, budgeting and marketing among other skills. I formed my own digital media/streaming company and my first project (I have a few in development as well) is this web series.
The campaign is extremely important to me (and my team) as a newly proclaimed media entrepreneur because it would mean I am on the right path. I had a "day job" for many years and I would like this campaign to allow my team and myself to continue to do what we love. Create compelling stories within the web series space in which we would stand out as having a high production value and interesting characters/episodes. I financed the first two episodes and it was money well spent. I personally have skin in the game, the total production costs for episodes 1 and 2 were $11K, with more funding from you we are more than committed to seeing that we produce all of the first season episodes (8 - 9 episodes). Through my experience in theater, independent film, this web series and having a mentor who has network episodic series experience we are on a solid foundation. I will make sure the contributions are spent in the right areas (mostly post-production) for us to continue producing compelling stories.
 


What We Need & What You Get
The funds will go toward the following:
1. 1920s wardrobe for entire cast (5 actors) - we have identified reasonably priced websites so that the main characters and extras have wardrobe that are period appropriate.
2. Post production - The show is scifi based so we would need the effects to be as organic as possible with the execution that modern audiences have grown accustomed to, but within budget. I have an advisor for post-production who works for a large, international VFX firm who will assist in making sure we attain maximum value for funds raised through this campaign.
3. Locations - Most will be under $1000/day. Period appropriate locations are hard to find even in New York City. We will shoot multiple scenes on the same day for locations that appear in more than one episode to conserve time and production time.
4. Food - It is always surprisingly more than you budgeted for initially. But I have used online resources which takes a few clicks and you can appeal to many food requests from vegan to all inclusive diet all in one space. 
5. Hiring one or two additional writers to help shape the series and to ensure all of the characters have distinctive voices and depth.
6. Salaries for cast/crew.
Unique Perks:
We have consciously created perks that we knew would get fulfill on a timely basis and that we thought would resonate with our donors.
A few of the Perks are:  walk-on part/background acting for NYC area residents; your photo (aged to appear from 1920s) in random scene or newspaper/magazine prop; early release of Episodes; invite to Harlem Renaissance party in NYC after production of Season 1.


The Impact of our show
My track record, the impact of the show and unlimited potential for our web series:
Having successfully financed, written and produced 2 episodes of the web series and over 100 performances of an Off-Broadway play, The Newlyweds (at the Producer's Club and at the American Theater of Actors) I am fully qualified (with my outstanding team of producers and mentors) to produce high quality episodes.  I have learned from my past mistakes on set, hiring actors for the wrong parts and having to find replacement for actors who fail to show up for a performance or on set.  My past productions have truly informed me on the art of being able to be a leader through all phases of production and post-production. I can ensure that your investment will be allocated to making the best production while being mindful of where the money is spent. I have been producing since 2006 and it is the only job that I have every had that does not feel like work.  I put my all into any creative endeavor that I am apart of and I am confident that now with a team behind me that believes in the project odds are we will be successful producing the remaining episodes. We believe the show is a valuable contributor to the modern landscape of online web series. Our project stands out from the crowd and with your help you can help us spread the word to others about our amazing story and character. A sci-fi, web series with not one but two female leads is rare and extraordinary. There is a definitely an underserved market for this type of production. It is the main reason we created the show.
In addition, our first (2) episodes of Half Past Jump Time are currently available for viewing on Facebook, Amazon Prime, Vimeo and our website (www.halfpastjumptime.com). We are humbled by the many hours of viewing of our web series across many viewing platforms (well over 10,000 minutes). The platform with the most views is LinkedIn, which I did not see coming or expect it.  My network (comprised of film and TV professionals, actors, production designers) on LinkedIn have responded very positively about the episodes and they see the unlimited potential in how we can present the Harlem Renaissance and introduce hip-hop elements from modern day New York.  Feedback from our audience has been positive as well and we would like to continue to provide more episodes to of course retain the subscribers as well as attract new viewers.


Risks & Challenges
With any production there are bound to be hurdles, unanticipated obstacles and just the unknown that can and will occur.  Some hurdles that I have encountered in the past have been locations not being available at agreed upon times, actors and crew late to set and holding up the entire production and of course going over budget.  The most important way to handle these specific challenges and others is to have as much planning/scheduling time during pre-production.  Project management skills, which I acquired at law firms in NYC, have saved me on theater and film/web series productions.  That is not to say that I will have all scenarios planned out and have action items to address them, but I will be as prepared. We are more than prepared to finish production on the remaining episodes.  Once the campaign is successful we can start dance and dialogue rehearsals.  Locations, wardrobe and the last actor have been cast for the main cast.  We are fully aware of where we want to go with the story but your investment will help get us there. Without it we will produce great episodes but with your donation and trust we can create something very special. Our audience deserves it and we want to provide interesting stories with characters that resonate well after our episodes are viewed.
To prepare for any of these obstacles that may arise during pre and postproduction I am being mentored by (2) very experienced producers. One has a background in TV network episodic material and the other has many years of experience film production at an international VFX shop. In addition to their advisory roles I have a background as a Producer for over 10 years, so I have a solid plan to achieve the highest quality production based on our budget.  Having gained valuable experience producing Off-Broadway theater, independent film and this web series I know that I am in a great space to make my team proud.  We have an outstanding choreographer (he also is an actor in the show) so that dance portion of the show will be on point. The cast are experienced actors/dancers and from the first (2) episodes you can see the potential of where we can take their storyline.
Other Ways You Can HelpWhat you can do to help outside of donations/investing:If you are a fan of female driven, sci-fi action adventures please help us get the word out about this unique and compelling show.  The show is definitely going to explore the lives of New Yorkers in the Harlem Renaissance and juxtapose that against the lives of contemporary New Yorkers. With hip hop dancing thrown in for good measure I think we can agree that we are off to a great start. You have to be intrigued at this point and you can appreciate the potential of this show and its important as a web series.  We will provide all of our social media names/handles so that you can further spread the word on this new and unique show.  Remember Indiegogo has its own sharing tools that help facilitate putting our show on the radar for people to view on their phone/laptops/televisions.  Without your assistance in sharing to your friends, coworkers, ex-coworkers, friends in film, actor friends, family we have to stretch our marketing dollars to the maximum.  Your involvement is crucial in spreading the word as you are apart of the audience so your perspective is valued to your friends and family. It takes just a few seconds to share and you will help my team and for me as an entrepreneur I welcome any fan-based marketing of our production.Social Media Links:Facebook: @halfpastjumptimeYouTube:  Paragon Multimedia TV channelTwitter: @HalfWebInstagram: hpjt_thewebseriesPinterest: Half Past TEAM:Director:  Jingjing TianJingjing Tian is a Sundance Writer's Lab and Sundance Sloan Foundation semifinalist. story:
About The Resistocrats

In 2018, late night host Stephen Colbert shoved yet another anti-POTUS offering down America’s cultural gullet with the launch of “Our Cartoon President” on the Comedy Central network.  Out of revulsion to this, The Resistocrats was born.

What happens when a bitter bunch of celebrities and Hollywood has-beens
band together to undermine the leader of the free world?

The Resistocrats is an animated cartoon in the American satirical tradition that takes aim at the current crop of hard-left Hollywood hysterics and establishment media mouthpieces who can’t seem to get over the last election, and who rail daily for a coup de grace to the current administration.

The Resistocrats are driven by their seething contempt for alternative leadership and American prosperity, and are willing to do anything in their pulpit power to not make America great again. But despite all their rage, they are still just brats on a stage.

The Resistocrats features a revolving cast of mass-media malcontents and
tantrum-prone turncoats from across the worlds of entertainment and fake news!

 

MEET YOUR STAR, STEPHEN COLBORE:

Superiorific. Sarcastuous. Snedgy. As the host of TV’s “The Lame Show”, STEPHEN coats his comedy with more spin than a Chinese wind farm. Under the watchful eyes of the secretive Mr. and Mrs. “C”, Stephen organizes a crack unit of crazed celebrity operatives dedicated to resisting the “regime” at any cost.


 

Why We're Doing This

This series is the most creative way we could think of to express our first amendment rights, protest hellish Hollywood and the monstrous mainstream media, and have some laughs while doing it. They beg for ridicule and we’re here to dish it out.

Hollywood thinks it has the entertainment market cornered. Wrong!

Main Stream Media thinks the American people will buy their lies: Wrong!

Entertainment gutter rats think they should lord over us? :Wrong!

We invite any and all liberty-loving brothers and sisters to join us on this adventure. We're going to have a great time!

A SAMPLING OF OUR CAST OF CHARACTERS:

 

Get Excited!

Tech has changed the way audiences consume entertainment. We are currently experiencing a renaissance within the entertainment industry and we’re no longer bound to the swamp of “the business” to produce a high quality show. There’s no creepy couch cushion crawling execs to please and we can bring our much needed comedy series directly to its deplorable audience. You! By supporting this campaign you not only help us create something truly hilarious, you get to help build a nuke aimed at the MSM and armed with our most potent weapon, ridicule.

OVERSIZE COLLECTOR'S CARDS (3" x 4")

What's in it for You?

Besides helping us jam a thumb into the eye of the swamp, your donation will score you some really fun stuff! Imagine the look of shock on your annoyingly Anti-Trump Aunts face when she sees the animated you, smashing a trash can or sporting a pink p***y hat in our hilarious pilot. Get an extra Resistocrat Tee for your well meaning lefty nephew; he might think it’s cool to be a Resistocrat. Check out all your options here to the right---------------->

PILOT SCRIPT OUTTAKES

 

 

THE RESISTOCRATS: MISSION UNLIKELY (PILOT)

Synopsis:

Stephen has a nightmare about America’s revival and thriving economy and wakes up in the middle of the night in a cold sweat.

At the Late Show writer's meeting, Stephen dumps on his writers' lousy material and schools them on their lack of Snedge. The meeting is interrupted by a phone call from the mysterious Mr. and Mrs. C who demand to take over as the show’s joke writers.

At that night's taping, Stephen is joined by Grossie O'Donnell, Phallic Baldwin and Michael S’more. Impressed with his guests' like-mindedness, Stephen organizes his activist celebrity friends into The Resistocrats and arms them with an unlikely mission.

About the Creators

Scott and Christy McKenzie founded Meep Morp Studio in 2010 and have created animated content for independent films, corporate clients, children’s artists and more.  In 2013 they raised $117,000 through crowd funding to create a feature length documentary.

Risks and Challenges

All creative projects come with inherent risks. This project in particular is going to make plenty of people mad. Please know we are well aware that this could be a bumpy ride, but we're in for the long haul. We don't scare easily and can be quite stubborn when someone tries to trample our rights. This show needs to be made and released to the public ASAP. With your support we're going to make that happen.

Staying on top of the news cycle is a challenge! Things change quickly and we'll do our best to stay relevant to the news cycle.

PLANNED STORY LINES (SUBJECT TO CHANGE)

Can't financially support this campaign?

We absolutely understand! If you like the idea and want to help please share the campaign on your social media. There's buttons near the top of this page to the right of the intro video. Just click and share. It would mean so much to us! 

ON TWITTER - GAB - FACEBOOK - MINDS

Thank you for your support!

Scott & Christy

Scott & Christy

story:
Short Summary

Louis must find a way to balance his love life, high school and baseball career. He has the opportunity to keep them straight, but at what cost? Will Louis hit it out of the park in this baseball thriller series pilot? Or will he lose everything and be out at home?

Brandon Hilliard, director and writer of The Stare Down, wrote this screenplay with his hometown in mind based on a true story. West Feliciana experienced a tragic event years ago but turned it into a positive with a state baseball championship.

This was the inspiration for the story and its basics. This is his first film to fully write and direct. With the help of Alumni Arts Presents (AAP) Brandon hopes to work his way into the film industry.  https://www.alumniartspresents.org/

AAP works with students and filmmakers attempting to break into the business and also allows the opportunity for royalties to be earned. Each film that an individual works on will give them experience in the industry as well as have some earning potential. With the game on the line, Brandon and AAP look to contributors to make this dream come true with Brandon's first project in the film industry, web series pilot and Louisiana Film Prize entry.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $10,000. The funding will pay for all of the uniforms, camera crew, editing, food, and everything in between in the film world. The bulk of the cost will go to the crew, props and costuming departments but also cast, travel, production staff, insurance, equipment rentals, departmental purchases, catering, SPFX, locations, transportation, music, editing, marketing, and YOUR PERKS!

We have some AWESOME unique perks: signed baseballs, posters and one of the coolest is a golden glove award. For the big time contributors, the possibility of coming on set and seeing this come together would be an amazing opportunity as well as coming to the screening and red carpet. If we don't reach the full $10,000 goal we will evaluate and attempt to make the film from there. Our ultimate goal that lends itself to proper production value is $10,000.

Even we don't reach our goal the funds go into the budget line items we just described and you still get your perks!
 

The Impact

For anyone contributing, this project has the ability to affect an entire parish in the state of Louisiana and BEYOND! As a filmmaker, my goal is to always relate back to people and make that film inspire an audience. With this film, we hope to not only relate to West Feliciana but also relate to sports fans or players and anyone who loves great cinematic, episodic storytelling!

Risks & Challenges

Some risks that are involved deal with judging of the film at not only the beginning stage of the LA Film Prize competition but also the public who will vote.  That being said another challenge will come after the entire project is finished, as this will blossom into a full web series on YouTube Red. We plan on working through all of our obstacles to bring a beautifully developed film quality pilot and series for anyone that watches it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can only contribute $5 that is a big help. $50 to $250 a bigger help!  We know you want to hit this ball out of the park so get IN THE LINE UP with $500 plus!  But also the best way anyone can help is to share on social media. Sharing our INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN LINK, Facebook page and/ or Twitter page are ways that other people can hear about this whole campaign.  Word of mouth is the best way to get anything done and we rely heavily on that through social media. When sharing on Twitter use the hashtag #thestaredownfilm so that we can see it as well as thank you for your shares. Thanks for your help in making this film a possibility!

*Pitch video credits:  Brandon Hilliard (Director); Glen Grefe (Consulting Producer); Shelby Roberts (Editor); Cinematography Reel footage (Bryan Stafford); Andrea Belluci (Composer, "Nella Foresta" https://soundcloud.com/andreabellucci). 

Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/aapthestaredown/

THE STARE DOWN players try out for the season draft: Casting Behind The Scenes: 1ST Inning!

DONATE to "The Stare Down" - get in the batter's box: get Hit Perks & Homer Trophies! Let's get to $10,000 + budget with this Grand Slam pilot production!
