story:
Series Overview

Meter Made is a mockumentary based on a Parking Enforcement company (Meter Maids).

Skrudge and his team need to raise money for a Tow Truck, while maintaining the smallest parking lot in Landing Falls, Tennessee. Skrudge, Kibbs, and Blair must fight the everyday struggles of love, rivalry, and boredom, all while learning that life can be whatever you make it.

 

What We Need

  • Rev-X Films is looking to raise $9,000 for the 22 minute pilot episode of Meter Made.
  • All funds go toward the crew, actors, and equipment needed to complete this pilot.

 

Our Cast & Crew

We have assembled the best RAW talent of the MidWest to take part in Meter Made giving this series the most authentic, mockumentary feeling!

Ricky Wilson Jr.

(Director)

Born and raised in Tennessee, Ricky Wilson Jr has deep roots, full of Southern Charm and sweet tea. Although he created short skit-like shows with childhood friends prior, Ricky Wilson Jr did not get his career started in the film industry until 2015 with his ‘rugged farmer’ role in the Netflix film “Brave New Jersey”. Shifting from acting to directing/writing, he directed his first short film, MalacHIGH, in late 2017. He then created his most popular short, Sci-fi Western, “Draw”, with a combined total of 300,000+ views.

 

 

Brian Bowles

(Skrudge)

Brian is an award-winning director and actor based out of Indiana. His directorial and acting debut Batman: The Death of Robin won best fan film at Gencon’s Film Festival as well as best Indiana based film at Poocon International Film Fest. He has trained in voice-over with award winning Nancy Wolfsen and Jeannie Elias.

 

 

RJ Cecott

(Kibbs)

RJ is a multi award-winning actor, based in Illinois with a Bachelor of Science in Theatre. He can be found in many films and series, such as Chicago Med, House of Whores, and upcoming slasher, Cruel Summer.

 

 

S Lynn Riley

(Blair)

Riley began her acting career competing during AMTC Shine’s talent showcase in Orlando, FL in 2012. Shortly after, she joined a community theatre and trained in improv and acting under the guidance of Peter Spellos.

 

 

Jordan Mullins

(Tony)

Jordan, an award-winning actor based out of the Northern Indiana area, is a chameleon in the film world; taking on many different looks & roles. Currently he has 17 Film Credits to his name and continues to add more.

 

 

Brandon Benz

(Director of Photography)

Born and raised in Indiana, Brandon began his interest in filmmaking during 2012. After a few acting roles, Brandon fell in love with the production side of things and worked his way to becoming a Director of Photography.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Filmmaking is no easy task. There are financial risks, as well as the daunting task of scheduling and meeting deadlines. Your contribution will help ease many of these burdens.

  • Paying experienced crew will help overcome the hurdles of meeting daily deadlines in filming and potential set-up time.
  • Providing quality props and wardrobe can highly increase the production quality, making for a more appealing viewer experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow our series on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/metermade.tv
  • Follow our production company! https://www.facebook.com/RevXfilms/
  • Share this campaign!

Your support can help this project become, Meter-Made.

story:
Overview

Hey guys! 

We are Moon Light Productions and we are developing a fan-made show called Wally West Forward! We need USD 800 to create models for each of the characters and to pay our animators. Our project has been in development for the past year now and we finally feel we're in a position to start funding! We've created a teaser that you can watch to give you guys a feel for how the show will look. Almost all the characters have been cast and you can find more info on our Instagram Wally West Forward and Moon Light Productions 

This is a passion project so we, the creators, make no profit from it. All proceeds go to paying our 3D model artist Fanvax Studios and our other animators.

What You Get

Our Perks have included:

  • Name in Credits
  • An exclusive Digital Artbook
  • Digital copies of the Script and the 1st Episode
  • And we've included many more that you guys can view!

Why Are you Making this?

We feel that the character Wally West has been misrepresented for the past few years by DC comics. It's our goal to show fans the ultimate representation of Wally West as The Flash. Creating this series is a huge passion project and we need your help to create this first episode!

More Info

If you want to find more info please feel free to contact us on Instagram:

  • Rayan Ghorbani (Executive Producer)
  • Yigit Arslan (Executive Producer and Writer)
  • Saarukan Suhanthan (Executive Producer and Lead Concept Artist)

Disclaimer:

This is in NO WAY associated with Warner Bros or DC Comics. This is a non-profit fan series solely created for entertainment. Created by the fans, for the fans. Wally West created by John Broome and Carmine Infantino

story:
In Short I need your help:

I need your support to be able to do this both financially to get the project off the ground and then in watching the videos and giving feedback. There will also be a patreon account set up to help continue the project once it is up and running, but you do not need to be part of that if you don't want to.

What we need:

  • A reasonably good digital video camera that will enable us to film at events.
  • Licence for the better video editing software!
  • Some items to review!

The Impact:

We will not change the face of larp, that is not our aim.

What we will do is show you honestly and openly what kits and costume is like before you buy it online. So that you as the buyer can make an informed decision on what you will be buying before you part with your hard earned cash,

We will also interview makers and retailers so that you know who you are buying from.

We will attend events and report on their organisation and style of play.

We will provide simple how to videos from every thing from how to put your tent up to ordering a bespoke item of kit. 

We are not chasing sponsorship for makers or retailers we will be independent funded by larpers for larpers.

Risks & Challenges:

The challenges are that there is so much kit and costume to review.

Swords, armour, makers, tents, sellers, costume, boots... arghhhhh so much.... and thats before we get to events that clash!

I must also point out that there is a chance this will all fall flat on it's arse if no one watches the videos. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There will be a patreon link so that you can help fund the project month by month by donating a small amount.
  • Message us with things you think we should review or you would like seeing reviewed.
  • If your a maker or manufacturer then please send us your goods so that we can review them. 
  • Share details of the project so that we can hit the goal and get this up and running asap.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
All About Masterclasse

 

Who's behind MasterClasse

 

We're a group of film students based in Milan. After a series of short film we self-funded this project out of sheer passion producing the first three episodes with the help of young professionals.

This campaign is very important for us: it will make the difference between stopping here and keeping on making episodes. We have a lot of ideas and our dynamic team of writers is already at work on the scripts for the next trailers. All we need to go on is you.


Where does the funding go?
 

As much as we would like to flee to Mexico, we just care too much about this project. That’s why we need to gather 2000 euros to produce the next episodes: one in particular will be set in the beautiful mountains of Bergamo in Italy, and we intend to increase the quality as each episode comes out. This means more lighting, more publicity and more perks!

Speaking of perks, we are thrilled to have you as a part of the MasterClasse family, and by donating you’ll be able to choose different options, from personal “Thank yous” up to actual cameos in the episodes themselves!

If we won’t reach the entire goal, your help won’t be wasted! Depending on the amount, we’ll rewrite the episodes or only produce one of them, in full glory, using your precious help.

But it doesn't end here - keep an eye on the campaign to get to know us and learn everything about Masterclasse!

story:
Calendar Boys is a series created by actors who write, direct and produce. As an actor, you spend most of your time auditioning, looking for auditions, or waiting for that 'You're Booked' call. So why not spend your time creating your own work.

Be the one creating the roles!

Here's the deal, we know what happens behind the scenes. But do you really know? From the juicy, the grit, the stumble, and the fall this series will tell it all. What happens when sex, greed, friendship, and drugs get caught in a world spin, something has to win. Help us tell that story.

Although we have created a trailer, this is just a sneak peek of what our vision has in store. The process has just started. 

Funding is needed to produce a quality and lasting show like this!

Equipment, Actors, Crew, and Marketing  = $$$

Production costs (60%)

Yes, this is the bulk of the funding, but it's also the best part! Equipment, securing locations, lighting, sound, wardrobe, props... The list can go on, but I'll spare you the details! 

Cast and Crew costs (20%)

We could just make them work for FREE, but... we are trying to have more seasons, ya know! 

Marketing/Post-production costs (20%)

Calendar Spread (hey, we are working with models right!), Editing, and marketing materials. People need to continue to follow, hear about us, and know what when and where. 

The reality of things... 

EVERY contribution supports those costs, big or small. 

Our team; cast and crew, are dedicated to bringing you something to crave for episode after episode, so this journey is just beginning.  

CAST

BRYAN SNELL as BRANDEN

SHON BERRY as DARRYL

OBIO JONES as ADRIAN

LLAURYN HENDRIX  as VANESSA

 

LET THE CREDITS ROLL....

 

Tairat Omotola Baoku - Creator/Writer/Executive producer 

Omar Holland - Creator/Editor 

Dele Nonye-John  - Executive Producer

Toya M Nelson- Producer

Racquel B Townsend- Writer/Producer 

Ibrahim Thompson - Director/DP

WE CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YALL ON THE OTHER SIDE!

Make a contribution. Share this Campaign. Get to know the characters.

story:
The Director and I start the project "Soulmates The Series" 3 years ago. At the beginning, we tried to make it just for our 60,000 fans on our YouTube channel. But because of the feedback from the 2-minute teaser was beyond our expectation, many companies contacted us for joining our project. Finally, WebTVAsia (Thailand) supported us with 5,700 USD for the kickstart. After that, we couldn't find more budget to complete it. So, we dicided to cancel the project and officially announced to public. However, our fans has not gave their hope to watch it. Until now, our subsribers are up to be 88,340 and the fans from worldwide still waiting for Soulmates the series. Some audiences watch our clips and teaser everydays. Now, the teaser and clips reaches 7-million views. So we would like to complete it ; not for us but just for all fans. Within you support and fund, we will try our best to make it and give Soulmates the series to all audiences. It not just our web series, but The web series for everyone who still believe in love and hope!Short Summary

C

story:
Short Summary

History's Deadliest Gunfighter is a fun, provocative project that will pit old and new rivals against each other to determine who was the fastest gun in the old west. 

I'm producer/writer Michael Anthony Giudicissi. This project is my brainchild and will appeal to anyone with an interest in the old west, as well as those who ask "What if" these legends had one more day to settle their scores!

I've worked on casting some great re-enactors in these key roles, and have already worked with many of them in their own episode of "One Day Only". They are historians of the characters they portray and bring unique insight to the role. What would happen if Pat Garrett came back from the grave in 2019 and face off against Billy the Kid one more time? We're going to show you!

What We Need & What You Get

I'm raising money for my production and post production budget. This project is slated for release on Amazon Prime Video when completed as a 90 minute special. There is always the possibility that it might be picked up by another network prior to release. 

The money raised will ALL go to paying actors and crew, paying for insurance and site fees for the production, set catering, as well as final editing prior to release. As the producer, writer, and host of the show I will not be using any of this money for myself or my contributions to the project. 

I would like to raise $5000.00 which will be enough for us to shoot for 2 days in May of 2019. Any excess raised over that amount will go into set dressing, props, and post production costs to bring you the absolute highest quality film possible!

The Impact

There is a HUGE community of old west re-enactors who live and breathe to watch projects like this. With high profile characters like Billy the Kid and Jesse James, this project will also appeal to anyone with a passing interest in the old west, outlaws, or lawmen. Your contribution will help bring fun, provocative entertainment to the masses via Amazon Prime Video (or other distribution channels). YOU will help answer the questions that people STILL argue over. Finally, you'll help create film jobs for cast and crew from NM, TX, and AZ. 

I have produced short films, web series, a TV pilot, and have 2 feature films in pre production. I'm an insanely hard worker on these projects and love seeing them come to life. Thank you for being a part of it!

Risks & Challenges

Most of our casting is already done. We have also secured our filming location and I have my crew reserved. There is little standing in the way of moving into production once we raise our budget. Of course, there could be issues that would prevent or delay our filming (illness, actor scheduling, unforeseen act of God come to mind) but I intend to film this special this year and have it released by Fall of 2019, so outside of any major unforeseen incident filming is scheduled to be a GO!

Other Ways You Can Help

While we'd LOVE if you could contribute and help bring this project to TV, we understand not everyone is able to. We can always use people to spread the word to friends and via social media. We are also seeking corporate sponsors that might fit the genre of this show (Colt Firearms, Wrangler, Cavenders, to name a few) so if you have contacts at any company that serves a western audience, an introduction would be AMAZING! Aside from that, there may be things helpful to my production that I haven't even thought of....so if you can see something I missed, please contact me!

story:
Our experienced team have created an exciting new three part TV SERIES. We've spent time and money to reach this stage as shown in our Pitch Document below.

Now we need help to prepare our fully detailed pitch to interested production and TV companies.

By helping us fund the next stage you can enjoy the fun and excitement of the production on location, or join us in the recording studio.

Fancy becoming an extra on location? And how about forming part of the chorus?

Helping us get this fantastic project on the screen, you'll have been part of it.

 www.michaeljohnwilde.com 

 michaeljohnwilde@gmail.com 

Best wishes

Michael John Wilde

Creator and co-writer.

story:
Have you ever felt a sudden burst of inspiration? At first you ask yourself, “What’s that sensation in the pit of my gut? And then suddenly, what seems like an endless stream of images floods your mind. This is what it’s like for me every time I sit down to write a book. It was the sensation I experienced back in middle school, while sitting in my science class, all sparked by the word “mycelia.” Yes. I know, you’re saying April—that’s a fungus. Yes, it is, but in my mind, it was the name of this beautiful girl who had been crushed by the world and who was in search of finding her strength. After numerous spiral notebooks of this story, I finally found the strength within myself to publish this book and so many others. To date, I have sixteen books and counting. and I am ready to take my main series to the next level. 

 

Creating a web series for my books would share my message inEndurance and demonstrate its strength to the world. I don’t think there is ever a time that we won’t need endurance and inspiration to never give up on our dreams. This campaign is geared to raisefunding to cover the cost of grammatical editing for the books, hiring of a film crew for the web series, and DVD creation. 

 

As a contributor, you will help greatly with any form of sponsorship, and your contribution will not go unnoticed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

- We need to raise 12,430.00 for :

• Editing services by Epic Editing

• Film Crew & Production by 23/P Media

• Actors

• Filming location fees

• DVD production

• Marketing & promotions

• Travel expenses

• Food for the film crew and actors

- For your sponsorship please enjoy these perks: 

• Social Media Shout Out! (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Pinterest)

• A copy of my first book which started it all, Endurance: The Power Within 

• Company recognition for sponsorship in end credits

• Video ‘thank you’ from actors and crew

• Special ‘thank you’ package from author & director

• Special copy of Forbidden, in print, before it is released to the public

 

Sometimes we fall short. In the case that the goal is not fully met, and it is not enough for us to do much with, we will place funds into an account and that will be deducted from the next campaign. And, we will continue to pursue the dream of creating a web series.

 

Every share counts! Any amount pushes us forward.

You can contact me directly at endurance9@icloud.com. I will be happy to answer any questions you may have.  

In every endeavor there will be challenges, but driven determination combined with an arsenal of unique talent and skills will help us to overcome the obstacles that may come our way. 

 

The obstacles that I can foresee are slow funding. The money that we are raising now is for the first episode. We plan to make it dynamic, in the hopes that we can increase our sponsorship and support. Slow funding is understood for the first campaign;however, once we are given the chance to prove ourselves and deliver exception entertainment, we believe that additional funding will not be a major challenge. 

 

To help with funding challenges, I have also created platforms for my other talents, which include making natural, skincare products for anti-aging and vitality. My mission is to get the message out there through radio show guest spots and social media outlets. In the end, relentless pursuit of my dream will bring this web series to reality.

 

Other ways that you can help:

- Word of mouth, please talk about this campaign with others. Sharing through the social media told available on indiegogo.

 

THANK YOU!

story:
About Us

Hello!

We are United States of Purple, a production company started by passionate filmmakers who want to become better informed citizens and voters.

We are currently in the process of creating a web based docu-series that follows two vloggers, with opposing views, as they make their way across the country testing gun regulations in different states.

We believe, with unfiltered facts and an open perspective, we can begin to bridge the gap between sides and start a productive dialogue that leads to actual change.

We have already done some filming in Los Angeles and Las Vegas but, with your help, we can head farther east and examine the regulation of guns in many more states; all 50 if you love our idea that much!

 

What We Need & What You Get

With $60,000 we will be able to fully cover the production and post production costs for the series.

This includes:

  • Travel expenses for our 10 day road trip that spans across 9 different states
  • Important costs like gear rentals, legal fees and licensing fees
  • Paying our editors and post production staff after filming is done

We don’t take your generosity lightly either. If you contribute, you will have access to some really cool perks!

We have everything from United States of Purple merchandise (stickers, popsockets and t-shirts) to custom made art pieces by several of our collaborating artists. Trust us. There is something cool for everyone.

And if you are worried that this awesome docu-series you are dying to watch doesn’t get fully funded, don’t sweat it. We will tailor the length of our trip and series based on the amount of funds we receive. 

 

The Impact

Gun control has been a topic of debate for decades. However, despite its recurrent presence in society, not a lot of change has been made in an effort to stop the violence associated with guns.

A lot of the problem stems from being a divided country. We want to fight this divide by providing an outlet where people can listen to individuals with differing opinions, who are also actively working towards finding a compromise and solution.

All of this sounds nice but you may also be wondering how our show will make an impact in a sea of social media content on this topic.

Our team has worked for AwesomenessTV Productions for two years. The company is a well-known YouTube channel for young adults. With our experience producing and working on the hit docu-series shows “My Dream Quinceañera”, “Life After Quince”, and “Growing Up Eileen”, we know that young adults are looking for outlets to learn from and discuss topics that directly affect them. There is a generation of young voters who are passionate about our country and demanding relevant content like ours. 

So let's give it to them!

 

Risks & Challenges

Filming a show about obtaining guns is not an easy task. We are doing massive amounts of research and talking to legal experts to make sure we go about this trip in the safest way possible.

We would also like to stress that absolutely NO Indiegogo funds will be used for the purchase of any weapons on the show. Any weapons purchased will be paid for by our personal funds and any money made off their resale (we will not keep any weapons purchased) will be donated to the charities you all suggest in our comments section.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, no worries! Like and follow us on social media:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/United-States-of-Purpl...

Instagram: www.instagram.com/usofpurple/

Twitter: www.twitter.com/usofpurple/

Youtube:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVOwL2lQsAfwYc...

And spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm Donovan Victoria, a film student studying production design at Columbia College. I've always wanted real stories shown on screen that my friends and I could relate to as well as seeing representation on screen for all people. 
  • This campaign is created, written and produced by students. We are all passionate about storytelling and bringing our visions to the screen. Whether that is a movie screen, television screen or your mobile device. We simply want our work to be seen and stories to be heard on a grand scale. 
  • With your contribution you are not only making a series that has been almost 2 years in the making come to life, but giving many of us a real experience of what it is like going through the creative process of making a series. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our main goal is to get funding for locations, craft and equipment
  • With your contribution you will receive early access to the ENTIRE season, behind the scenes exclusives, your name in the post-credits and a hand written note from the creator. We are truly thankful for any contribution put forth.
  • If we don't get to goal the funds will all go to location and compensation for crew. 

Risks & Challenges

Of course with any campaign the biggest risk is having that project fall through. But with any funds we get it will all go toward making sure this web series happens. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute spreading the word works just as well! If you're a firm believer in the arts or just simply like watching television please share with everyone you know! Artists, musicians, filmmakers, all are welcome! Let's grow together!

story:
The Charity Shop

As this is will be our last production we ever make at westminster we would like to go out with a bang. We've spent time writing a great script that we're all extremely proud of and are working hard in order to do it justice. It's a great idea, a great concept and really showcases who we've become throughout our three year degree. Together we have made a number of productions but none like this. With your help we are guaranteed to make this dream a reality. Any donation is a step towards achieving our goal so if you can and if you believe in us as much as we believe in ourselves then please help us get there. Please help us make this production look as authentic and professional as it possibly can.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise £500 to cover the cost of our actors and extras travel, printing, refreshments for cast and supporting cast, costumes, props and set design.
Depending on the amount you donate, contributors will receive a credited thanks at the end of our programme, a digital 'The Charity Shop' poster signed by the writers and cast, behind the scenes digital images.


What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

If we do not reach our entire goal. All funds will go towards as much as we can cover. We will prioritise actors expenses, set design and contributors rewards.

We have made a number of projects over the course of our three year degree including documentaries, adverts and multi-camera shows. All of which can be viewed on our universities vimeo page. Please search for University of Westminster on vimeo if you would like to see what we have created so far. Our course is also known for winning a number of awards at events such as the Royal Television Society Student Awards.

Risks & Challenges

We are really hoping to reach our entire goal. However, it is well known that many do not have a lot of faith in student projects and because of this students can sometimes struggle to create a professional piece of work. 
We have anticipated this and there for are only raising as much money as we need in order to make our show a success. Just because we are students doesn't mean that we are less capable of creating something great and worth backing. We are talented and hard working and work just as hard as people in the industry. Sometimes even harder as we have less resources and less access. Our actors that we have auditioned fantastic and will really help to drive this production.

As a precaution we have tried to fundraise within the university through bake sales. However, this only raised enough money to cover the cost of paint and wallpaper.

What If I Can't Contribute?

If you just can't contribute financially then don't worry there's still a way to help us.
Share our campaign with friends and family and help us get the word out!

Also follow our Facebook and Instagram pages and get people to like and share them. 
Facebook: @TheCharityShopW
Instagram: @charityshopwmin

And don't forget to use the indigogo share tools!

Thank You All!

story:
Short Summary:

Monica & Eric are roommate’s that find out one day that they are much MUCH more. Except it’s not quite what you think. Things get strange and then just outright weird, as they learn to live as One Strange Happy.

Who We Are:

We are 2nd Team Entertainment, a Woman/Minority Male owned entertainment company based in Portland, OR. This show is created, written & directed by an African American, the cast and crew is made up of mainly Multi-ethnic Men, and Women, including members of the LGBTQA community. With and full cast of and crew of different backgrounds we are a very diverse team!

Distribution Producer- Zac Madson(12 Pound Balls); Executive Producer- Kolby Talbert; Line Producer- Gurunam Atwal(Greenrush); Producer- A.T Nguyen; Co-Director/Creator/Showrunner- Bryan Maurice (Greenrush); Executive Producer- Kevin White; Co-Director- Anna Bremer-Smith (Doomtown); Art Director- Steven Christian (Island Of Iltopia, Greenrush); Director Of Photography Davied Kelly(The System); Editor- Hasson Mamood.

We are all talented artists, passionate about creating art through the medium of film and are dedicated to creating the highest quality content together as a diverse team. Will you help us bring this project to life?

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are just starting out as a production company therefore we are a little short on funds. We need to be able to compensate the people who we have hired to help us with this project as well as the actors who are not a part of our company. (All of us who are a part of 2ndTeam are working for free on this)

Please help us pay our hired help AND also feed people on set so they don't turn into zombies and try to eat us (or worse....quit). We have crunched the numbers and $3,000 should be enough to pay people, feed people and also rent additional equipment we need for our set that we don't already have (some fancy lenses, and a few lights). You are pretty much saving our lives (from the potential zombie actors). No pressure.     ;P

Below is SOME of what you get from us in return (look to the right for the FULL LIST OF PERKS!!!)

  • $25 gets you an autographed cast photo and a THANK YOU shoutout in the credits! 
  • $50 gets you previous perks and a kick ass show poster
  • $500 gets you a date with Sticky...cuz we all need a date with a Sticky plus all previous perks
  • $1,000 gets you a VIP pass to be on the set of One Strange Happy to watch the behind the scenes operation, and a meeting with the writers to collaborate with them in writing a joke for the show! Pretty sweet! You will definitely be in the credits!
  • $3,500 gets you all previous perks plus some other stuff (we will talk and you will be very pleased just saying)

The Impact

This project is important to us mainly because of who we are. We are a group of multi-talented and diverse in ethnicity and gender individuals who are passionate about storytelling using film. We are stretching our wings so to speak with this production and solidifying our ability to work as a team. If this project goes well, we have a few other projects lined up (with funding already in place) that we will be producing in the Portland, OR area. We are representing underrepresented talented people in the Portland film market and with your help in making this project a reality, we will be able to make sure our hard work pays off and this project is completed! Our overall goal as a production team is to change the world, one film at a time by the way that we work, who we are and the type of content we create (by highlighting strong female roles and people of color).

 :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute at this time you can still support us! 

SHARE our campaign and go and 'Like' our Facebook page and Instagram (@onestrangehappy) to stay updated on our progress to make One Strange Happy come to life!
story_txt:
Short Summary:
Monica & Eric are roommate’s that find out one day that they are much MUCH more. Except it’s not quite what you think. Things get strange and then just outright weird, as they learn to live as One Strange Happy.
Who We Are:
We are 2nd Team Entertainment, a Woman/Minority Male owned entertainment company based in Portland, OR. This show is created, written & directed by an African American, the cast and crew is made up of mainly Multi-ethnic Men, and Women, including members of the LGBTQA community. With and full cast of and crew of different backgrounds we are a very diverse team!
Distribution Producer- Zac Madson(12 Pound Balls); Executive Producer- Kolby Talbert; Line Producer- Gurunam Atwal(Greenrush); Producer- A.T Nguyen; Co-Director/Creator/Showrunner- Bryan Maurice (Greenrush); Executive Producer- Kevin White; Co-Director- Anna Bremer-Smith (Doomtown); Art Director- Steven Christian (Island Of Iltopia, Greenrush); Director Of Photography Davied Kelly(The System); Editor- Hasson Mamood.
We are all talented artists, passionate about creating art through the medium of film and are dedicated to creating the highest quality content together as a diverse team. Will you help us bring this project to life?
 

What We Need & What You Get
We are just starting out as a production company therefore we are a little short on funds. We need to be able to compensate the people who we have hired to help us with this project as well as the actors who are not a part of our company. (All of us who are a part of 2ndTeam are working for free on this)
Please help us pay our hired help AND also feed people on set so they don't turn into zombies and try to eat us (or worse....quit). We have crunched the numbers and $3,000 should be enough to pay people, feed people and also rent additional equipment we need for our set that we don't already have (some fancy lenses, and a few lights). story:
Short Summary

Hi there. My name is Marc Lovallo, and I’m the creator of a series I'm developing called Anytown. Thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign.

When coming up with the idea for Anytown, I originally thought of it as just an excuse to do whatever I want (it’s where the “Any” in Anytown comes from). Then it became much more grounded and autobiographical as I started incorporating aspects of my life into the show, such as people I’ve met, places I’ve been to, and the fact that the show takes place in New Jersey.

I’ve been developing Anytown for two years now. I already have a great voice cast, I’m storyboarding the pilot episode right now, and I feel like the show could become something really special. So this campaign represents my passion and drive to make Anytown a reality.

Once the pilot is finished, I plan on uploading it to YouTube and possibly pitch it to certain networks. I also intend to partially fund the pilot myself, but with your help, I can find the talent needed to bring it to life. Something like this is going to be difficult for someone like me to do by myself, so your support would be greatly appreciated.

What I Need

My basic goal is to raise $5000 solely to fund the pilot. The money raised from this campaign goes straight into paying:

  • Art and animation directors to help define the show's overall look
  • Animators to animate the episode
  • Artists to paint the backgrounds
  • The voice actors for providing the characters' voices

Any contributions you make won't go unnoticed. Depending on how much you donate, you can earn exclusive rewards like:

  • Printed Anytown posters
  • A digital copy of the episode's script
  • Having your name listed in the credits of the episode
  • A version of the episode with an exclusive commentary track
  • A chance to see the episode before it comes out
  • A chance to make an appearance in the episode

There's also a chance where I won't be able to reach my goal. So if this happens, I will save up more of my own money to put into the remainder of the budget.

The Impact

Anytown is a project that I am incredibly passionate about for many reasons. I never had the biggest amount of confidence in myself. There have been times where I would get depressed about things, and I know several people that go through the same struggles. I've made contributions to popular web cartoons such as Eddsworld, and I've posted my own artwork online that's left a positive influence on tons of people. It's been incredibly humbling and overwhelming for me to be in a position like this, so I want to use Anytown as a means of bringing joy and happiness to people of all ages.

Even though Anytown will primarily appeal to kids, I want to use it to convey endearing morals and tackle certain subjects that I feel need to be addressed. I already have episodes planned that talk about prejudice, xenophobia, being in a long distance relationship, sexual identity, dealing with the death of a family member, feminism, the dangers of the internet, and too many others to list here. I don't want to do this to get my show trending on social media. I genuinely care about topics like the ones I just brought up, and I want to help kids and young adults that are going through trouble times related to those topics get through them a little easier and more comfortably.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign directly, any other support you can give would still be appreciated. Feel free to spread the word on social media, and share this around as much as you can.

But anyway, thanks for taking the time to look at my IndieGogo campaign. Feel free to donate if you're able to, and have a wonderful day!

story:
The Story

Eric Alexander has just changed his life from a famous murder-mystery writer to a creative writing professor. The peacefulness of his new environment seems broken when a series of seemingly unrelated murders occur in the surrounding areas. The last thing he needed now, getting reeled into the cases, happens shortly after, when his assistant's brother becomes the latest victim of this killing spree.

The Director

Originally from Costa Rica, Angie Loveday is a senior film student at Seton Hall University. She has had experience in production through PirateTV and as an assistant editor for Sundance-winning director, Michael Rossato-Bennett. Her short film "Do Not Press the Red Button" was featured as part of the 2018 SOMA Film Festival and special projects in video production have also earned her the Japanese Digital Storytelling Award two years in a row. 

Director's Statement

"I found inspiration for the characters in Machiavellian while watching the Korean Drama ‘Voice’. I loved some of the psychopathic villains shown and it gave me the idea for Eric Alexander, a charismatic lead who is secretly evil, and for Anne, a girl who when thrown into a situation becomes maniacal and will not stop at anything to get what she wants. Right after finishing ‘Voice’, I watched a non-comedic web series and I was so disappointed in the lack of plot that it made me want to challenge that style. I want to create a web series with a deeper plot than the ones I had seen so far. With this in mind, I have been developing Machiavellian. Like Voice, Machiavellian is a crime drama but developed over a short course of time. A short length web series containing complex plot elements is my goal."

What will the funds be used for?

The funds collected through this campaign will be used for the following:

1. Lead actors casting. To have a great performance we need a solid cast. 

2. Music acquisition. Part of what makes a production great is the soundtrack behind it. There are several artists that we have in mind and we want to compensate them accordingly for their work.

3. Feeding the crew. One of the most important lessons we have learned in production is that a hungry crew does not work. Keep the crew happy and you'll have great results.

Production is a long and arduous process. We want everyone who helps us make Machiavellian to stay in touch and anticipate its official release. If you become a contributor, there are several perks that you will receive during, and after production. We will keep you constantly updated about Machiavellian's status and what is happening. Our goal is not only to produce the series but also for everyone to enjoy the finalized product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you interested in the project but can't help by funding us?

SPREAD THE WORD!

The more awareness that is brought to the project, the more likely that we will be able to accomplish our goals. Share on social media. Talk about it to everyone you know. 

And keep in touch with us!

Follow us on social media or contact us at machiavellian.webseries@gmail.com

story:
Who Are We?

Glitched is a web series for popular platform release being developed by creator Laura Noel along with Charity Dehmer & Jim Dougherty. 

  • Laura Noel - multi-award winning Actress, Writer & Director.
  • Charity Dehmer - award winning Actress and Associate Producer for Glitched.
  • Jim Dougherty - actor, producer and an award winning Cinematographer. 
  • Andy Ahrens - actor (Chicago Fire, Dead Draw)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $3,000 to support our production and post production costs and bring this web series to popular new media platforms.
  • Your contributions can help bring this unique short episode series to its audience. Check out the perks we are offering for your gift.
  • All funds will go directly to productions and post production costs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but still want to help?

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Show:

The Untitled Project Show is an up and coming comedy series produced  by Dauphine Productions. The series is starring, written by and created by Rory James and Connor Patrick Griffin.

The series is "REAL PEOPLE. REAL CONVERSATIONS. FAKE SHOW." meaning that all of the show's insane fictional guests are based on and inspired by actual people we have anonymously interviewed, spoken to and interacted with to create a real, unique and fun twist on the "bad talk show" genre. The show itself also features sketches, pranks, music, and other pieces of media and entertainment to add variety to the show. Over the course of the eventual series we intend to continue to interview interesting/despicable people of outrageous hobbies, beliefs, theories, hobbies, careers, etc. to provide the most original, fresh and relevant comedy series to date.  

The first episode of The Untitled Project Show was well received on Youtube, seen by thousands of people and actually was seen by and enjoyed by Adult Swim's Development Meeting program which would also lead to the episode being given feedback and a small amount of money by Adult Swim to help contribute towards the budget of future episodes. We intend to and will pitch this show to them and other networks and streaming services in the future.

You can watch the pilot episode by clicking here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gYQ0qibyfi0

Or You can watch the pilot episode here:

 

About Dauphine Productions:

Dauphine Productions, LLC, is a film production company based out of Tucson, Arizona. Founded by Connor Patrick Griffin and Joseph Yearego, Dauphine has produced a variety of work for private clients and federal clients such as the Department of Homeland Security. They also host a YouTube channel providing film reviews and original short-film content.

Connor Patrick Griffin is an actor, director, and writer who has produced music video, feature film, and short-film content for more than a decade, and produced the Department of Homeland Security Active Threat Awareness video series with millions of views nationally. He also starred as Dr. Ian Buckley in the pilot episode of The Untitled Project Show,

Joseph Yearego has been involved in film production for nearly three decades. He has been involved with several feature film and documentary film projects in a variety of capacities from director, producer, editor, and more. He also served as the Director of the pilot episode of The Untitled Pilot Show.

 

What You're Helping Pay For:

With your gracious donations you will be helping fund a budget for traveling, props, extra filming locations, extra cast, extra crew, etc. Dauphine Productions already owns and has mastered the use of all equipment required for filming episodes of The Untitled Project Show whether that be the video equipment, audio equipment, lighting equipment, etc.

 

"I love the idea and/or pilot but can't donate! What can I do to help?"

We completely understand that not everyone who watched the pilot or enjoys the concept is going to be able to participate in the donation aspect of the campaign and we appreciate the thought, as that is what truly counts. All support is appreciated and encouraged. The best thing you can do to help support The Untitled Project Show if you are unable to do so financially is to share this campaign page and/or the pilot episode on your social media whether that be Reddit, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, etc. We also would appreciate you sending the pilot episode and/or the campaign page to any and all of your friend's who you think would enjoy this type of comedy/content!

story:
LOGLINE

In coping with bipolar disorder, Malcolm crafts the newest comic book superhero “ManicMan!”  with the help of his small-town friends.

 

MISSION

I want to spread awareness for bipolar disorder in a fun way that will not be triggering or harmful to the community. I want people to see us, know us, and I want people who are like us to feel comfortable sharing who they are (as long as they feel safe doing so). People with bipolar are just human, and they cannot fight this battle alone; they need a support system, and Malcolm’s friends are the perfect example of a support system. Maybe they don’t always do what’s best for him, but they are constantly working on learning more about the illness and adjusting themselves to help Malcolm get better, even if that just means making sure he gets up in the morning. 

Lavender Blackbird's mission has always been to tell the stories that need to be told, that provoke real human emotion and real global change. It is part of our mission to provide visibility and representation to minority groups, especially people of color in the LGBTQ community. With an ensemble cast made up of diverse characters with different backgrounds, sharing stories from the Asian-American population as well as the Queer community.

 

GENRE

This is a comedy-drama hybrid, kind of like Schitt’s Creek or Parks and Recreation meets Breaking Bad. It’s dark and deals with really scary topics sometimes, but it isn’t meant to send your heart palpitating. It’s meant to teach you while still putting a smile on your face. The point is to show how crazy of a life a life with bipolar can be. From climbing out your window because your friend didn’t say goodnight to looking down from a tall building to staying up until eight in the morning working on that project that you said you’d put down to scheduling thirty-three meetings on the same Monday you have work and dinner with the folks. Impulsive actions, impulsive shopping, and more!

story:
Have you ever wondered what happened to the really good sitcoms like Full House, Growing Pains, Facts of Life, Martin, or The Cosby Show? Although there are a few good shows out today, it is only a few. Those sitcoms taught life lessons and we are bringing wholesome sitcoms back to life.

 

Hi, I’m Jordan McCormick. I am the Writer, Producer, and Director of a healthy new sitcom called Family Life.

 

This show is about how two families have their own personal issues, but together, they work them out with love and free from judgment.

 

The two families, the Blunts and the Smiths, are co-workers. They are also next door neighbors who are so close they consider each other family.

 

This show will tackle many issues that we face today; issues like adult ADD, OCD, homosexuality, bullying, and how to handle peer pressure about sex at a young age.

 

In order for us to complete this show we need your help in funding the first pilot. Please be a part of bringing a wholesome and healthy new sitcom back to television.

story:
What & Why

Thank you for taking a moment to review our project! We're a group of Milwaukee filmmakers led by award-winning actor and producer, Thomas Adisi. We are raising funds to complete the edit of a powerful sci-fi episodic pilot right here in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

We have already filmed and edited the first act as a proof of concept (link above), and are raising money to complete the now fully-filmed 1-hour pilot episode.  Every cent raised will go directly toward the editor, sound design, VFX and composer fees - all of whom are Milwaukee artists! 

Upon completion, the full 50-minute pilot will be pitched to executive producers, producers, and sales agents in the belief it will be picked up for continued production with a major network like NBC, Amazon, etc. Our goal is for the show to continue filming in the greater Milwaukee area.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $3,500 will go towards:

  • Editing
  • Sound Design
  • Coloring
  • Scoring
  • VFX 
  • Any ancillary costs

Project backers will receive these perks based on their contribution:

  • $40 Donation - Special Thanks IMDb Credit
  • $100 Donation - Special Thanks + Full Screenplay Signed by Writers, Thomas & Danielle Adisi
  • $200 Donation - ANTIBODY Custom Baseball Cap + Signed Screenplay + Special Thanks
  • $500 Donation - Everything at the $200 Donation Level + 30-Minute Private Zoom Q&A with Thomas & Danielle Adisi About the ANTIBODY Journey
  • $1000 Donation - Everything at the $500 Donation Level + Associate Producer IMDb Credit and on-screen credit in the final cut.

 

The Impact

Milwaukee is full of extremely talented film and theater artists, yet this is not yet widely known, or taken advantage of in larger creative circles. The goal of this project is to create an ensemble-cast show, that will shine light on some of these artists and draw attention to the unique and excellent creative community in Milwaukee. We are entertainment pros, workers, students, teachers, parents, and neighbors, coming together with a common vision to elevate each other to higher levels of production expertise. 

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any project, there are chances of it falling through. Scheduling issues, weather, lack of funds, etc. all pose some risk for the project. However, we are committed to creating this show,  whether or not we receive donations, and we have the whole pilot shot and already partially completed to prove we can pull it off! We believe the challenge is worthy.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Regardless of whether you are able to support our story financially, you can help us simply by sharing our campaign across your social networks! Not only will your generous sharing raise the chances of funding success, but it will spread the word about the show in general. And we appreciate all the word of mouth we can get.

 

 

TAGLINE
A group of people with addiction issues meet secretly, amidst a plague-riddled
dystopian world, trying to cope with life and cobble together a community amidst an increasingly chaotic world. What they don’t yet know is they’re very life force could contain the antidote the whole world needs - and another world does’t want to be found.


SYNOPSIS
It’s 2045. A plague unlike any before it sweeps the world off its feet
and redefines life for everyone. In the midst of unpredictable quarantines, death, and
uncertain futures, a group of socially awkward addicts secretly meet to process
their world, while still trying to live in it. What they don’t know is how significant
they are to the future of the human race - and how significant they are to
another race that wants to use humanity’s unique and hidden qualities for its own gain.

When a being not of human blood has an unexpected encounter, his eyes are opened to the potential for human beauty, for love - a quality unfamiliar to him until now. Quietly, he now works to shepherd the addict group members together. Each of these seemingly
ordinary people contain a unique aspect in their blood, that if combined
correctly, could create a powerful antidote for humanity. Alone, they are
useless. Together, they are the Antibody.

But they won’t get their solution easily. Word of the alien sympathizer’s actions makes it to the top of their ranks, and what was already a risky weekly meeting transforms into a run for
their lives. A group of social misfits, running from supernatural beings, in a highly controlled
world. What could go wrong? What could go right?

SHOW TONE
Think a blend of LOST, Mad Max, The Office, Avatar, and Equilibrium. This is a
post-apocalyptic-ish sort of America, where everyone has to carry a mini
quarantine bag, because the government could send an alert to you at any moment, where then you must shelter in place - wherever you are.

The country is broken up into sectors, change is happening every day, and no one really
knows what’s going on. We’re playing this serious, dramatic; there is a sense of urgency to
everything, even when there isn’t a direct reason to be hurried, and yet humor seeps in.

The look is a blend of hand-held, intimate shots, and wide, smooth sweeping images, giving
a sense of vastness and claustrophobia at the same time. The palette will be
desaturated, yet colorful, gritty. This is all about the relationships and the
unanswered questions, the suspense, and the human ability to overcome fear and find oneness despite endless challenge and division.


SERIES REGULAR CHARACTER LIST


PAIGE BOURNE - RIAN, 25 - Online shopping addict, loves the shopping,
loves the delivery person interaction, has a bag with random helpful deliveries,
handy for others. Privileged upbringing and had both parents pass away from
the plague, now sitting with tons of money and loneliness. No real relationships
outside the group. Is frenemies with KAYLEE.


CHLOE LEE - SOFIE, 15 - Born during the plague, doesn’t know any other life,
normal for her, sort of street thief vibe, hard time connecting in person, uses
devices too much, sees everything, doesn’t say everything. Orphan, lost both
parents as well. Is the conscience for DYLAN. First to discover SOKILI is alien.


JOE TURCZYN - DYLAN, 22 - Gaming addict, plus other things(anime, comics
etc)...tech guru, sarcastic, sort of a jerk, but then helpful as well. “He’s done
the math, and it’s shitty.” He is a clone but doesn’t know it, was released by
government as a test, but then it drew alien attention due to the reality rift, and
so they are on earth to sort things out and recreate universe balance.

KEVIN ROMANO - CHARLIE, 25 - mystery guy happens upon group and
becomes window into bigger life situation at large, mysterious, maybe good,
maybe bad, not one of Antibody, but hey not everything goes to plan. Shows up
wounded, starts having weird memories of some alien encounter...builds
connections.


THOMAS ADISI - SOKILI, 30 - One of the Nophlim, helpful, accidental hero
vibes. Has defected from his race on account of the humans, and is now
protecting them, hoping to convince them to help him create an anecdote for
the plague, and wondering where his future will lead.


DANIELLE ADISI - KATE, 30 - Group therapist, meeting coordinator for
Absolutely Anonymous, may or may not actually be licensed therapist. Addicted
to solving people’s problems too much, helpful, but goes to far and makes it
awkward. Way more brave and intuitive than she seems. Mother of the group.
Looking for love.


ANNETTE DUNCAN - MONICA, 45 - Top lawyer/political judicial person, but in
group secretly. Two lives, the sharp front person and the warm-hearted human
beneath. Possible government plant, trying to spy or oust the group, but may
be won over. She knows about the Alien presence and suspects something is
up in the group. Keeps “forgetting” her addiction. Weary of technology. Is
DYLAN’s handler, she knows he’s a clone, using him to get info on the
Nophlim.


SARAH GUDMONSON - KAYLEE, 23 - Addicted to tinder, but never dates
anyone. Likes to be told she’s pretty. Has crazy dreams, tells tinder peeps
about them...not cool. But then, the Nophlim are actually communicating
through her to the group somehow...fairly distracted all the time, but seems to
end up in key situations at the wrong moments, but becomes important. Is
frenemies with RIAN.


DONTAE DICKERSON - DETECTIVE DAVIS, 35 - Son of a former cop who was killed while
working one of his shifts. Years later becomes a very successful detective,
does things by the book, but has his own mind, which he’ll need as things
begin to unfold beyond his expectations of reality.. Still looking for his father’s
killer.

NATHANIEL DUNCAN - BROOKS, 25 - A fresh cop, turning detective. He is
Davis’ understudy. Naive, positive, and not dumb, but too talkative. He loves to
learn. A balancing force with Davis. He’s a good guy through and through, but
he’s also a human who wants meaning and significance more than anything.


DAVID DUNCAN - WENABISHKOO, 35 - Also a Nophlim alien, and Sokili’s older
brother. He is on the fence regarding his brother’s actions toward the humans.
He is also from a high-ranking family on his planet and has a flair for the
theatrical, and sarcastic. We don’t know if he will help or hurt his brother and
the group.


JOY SUNG KIM - YEONGI, 55 - A high council member of the Nophlim, she is
sent to quell Sokili’s experiment with the humans as the Nophlim don’t want
any interference with their plan for earth. She and Sokili go way back, and
despite her loyalty to her people, there is an unknown family hiccup forcing her
to be more careful with the group than she would like to be.

 

Meet the Writers

Thomas and Danielle Adisi have over 15 years combined experience in the professional entertainment world. Initially building their careers in Los Angeles on multiple major network television, award-winning short film, studio feature film, and major international brand commercial acting roles, they have now taken their journey to the next level in co-creating the world of ANTIBODY. 

They moved from LA five years ago to Milwaukee where they are now raising their four children. Thomas and Danielle produce creative content with their production company, Adisi Imagery, and teach on-camera acting through their CoLAB classes community.

 

“Treat each person as amazingly as you can, and the universe will have no other choice but to return an amazing life to you.”   - Someone Amazing

story:
We are a team based in New York City in need of help to fund the continuation of our indie comedy television series, FREETOWN TO FLATBUSH.

SUMMARY: 

Karla Conteh is lieutenant of a Woman’s militia organized by her mother to maintain Wildlife Protection...she hunts poachers. And pretty damn good at it. Her parents sent her sister Tamara directly after elementary school to go live in Brooklyn.  Karla is unaware that Tamara has been living what their parents would think is “A Reckless Life”. She manages to convince her mother to allow her to go visit her sister in America to assist in getting her life straight. 

HISTORY:

Freetown To Flatbush was first conceptualized in the spring of 2020. Keef Louda (Creator/ Director) originally wanted to tell a story of Black Women from different backgrounds coming up together in Brooklyn, NY.  While researching for different backgrounds to the characters he also saw there was a lack of African representation in television and media at a time the continent needed a voice in America and decided to make it a fish out of water story for an African girl. That's when he decided to team up with Fionia Amara, a Sierra Leonean-American (Actress, Executive Producer), to tie in Freetown. Fionia has since helped attract contributors also from Sierra Leone to our cause. In June we developed our first script and began casting throughout August. Shawn Gooden (Co-Writer, Comedian) was brought in as writer during the finalization of the script and  wrote all our Narrative work for our Lead. Since then she's assisted with the actresses on set in delivering comedic lines and has proceeded as Co-Writer in helping us conceive episodes 2 through 6 of Season One.  Freetown To Flatbush has the balance of being a comedy about a group of Friends that lends itself to a African Soap Opera.  The layered story of what it's like being a Black Woman in American society and how unification is our greatest Asset everywhere, while pushing the limits of what's "Allowed" from Black Women on Television.

In October of 2020 we filmed Our Pilot Episode with a budget mostly funded by Fionia Amara and Slate Reel LLC and A LOT of hard work from our small cast and crew. We were successfully able to wrap in December 2020. Despite the given times, we had so much fun bringing this story to life. Our cast and crew remained healthy during and after shooting as we made sure to film under the Covid Protocol for film sets. We are currently on the market looking to be picked up and funded by a Major Network. We understand getting picked up by a major network can sometimes take awhile. Our plan is to try and raise as much funding as we possibly can to continue making the show with full creative agency if the projected time frame isn't met.  We will then continue to film Episodes 2 through 6 ourselves with the help of other paid professionals and possibly YOU!  

Our Pilot is currently in Post Production!

What We Need

As many of you may know, it’s hard for young, Black and/or female, independent filmmakers to get their voices heard. We’d love to continue making the show with full creative control meaning our vision remains that of the Directors and Production Staff.  We are looking to raise money for all necessary production needs for Episodes 2 through 6 Including a possible trip to Africa for our Season One conclusion.

  • $50,000 -  Pays Actors & Crew such as Lighting & Sound; Location Costs;  Equipment Costs; Transportation; Craft Services; Wardrobes & Props; and  Post Production (Editing; Coloring; Sound Mix) and Legal/Licensing Fees for 5 Episodes.

 

Funding Stretch Goals:

$50,000 - Home base! This will allow us to cover all of our production AND post-production costs and ensures that production can run smoothly.  

$75,000 - I'm on A New Level! This will allow us an added layer of financial comfort on-set in case anything in production goes awry (as it inevitably does!) It also means that we can take more creative risk and rent some additional equipment that will make our episodes look even better. We'd also have a budget to work with for marketing the series as a whole afterwards.

$100,000 - The Dream! This will allow us to go above and beyond on all of our production and post needs, therefore elevating our episodes across the board. This will also allow us to explore our marketing options even more. 

Any contribution is greatly appreciated and thank you for the support! 

 

SOCIAL LINKS

http://instagram.com/freetowntoflatbush

http://facebook.com/freetowntoflatbush

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In these times some people just CAN'T contribute, and we understand...but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please feel free to promote our Campaign!

Thank You! - Team FTF

Production Announcement

Tamara Bangura- Fionia Amara

Karla Conteh - Donalia Jones

Joyce Chapman - Ananiki Peoples

Melinda Jones - Alysha Wright

Shelli Sumpter - Shantelle Watkins

Supporting:

Kenny Smith - Cory Black

Anthony Williams - Reggie Weldon

Sim Taylor - Shawn Gooden

Shawn Gooden - Writer
 

The Cast

story:
Short Summary

Hi, fans! Hopefully, if you're taking the time to read this you know who we are and more importantly, you enjoyed our award-winning cinematic fan film, The Black League of Superheroes!  Well, what you saw was part 2 of a trilogy, and to complete the story we need funding that will allow for the first and third chapters to be completed at the level that it deserves.  Everyone who contributes to this project will be credited in the film!  

The Black League of Superheroes was a labor of love and entirely self-funded starting out as a simple one-day shoot with a single camera, a single Actor, and a BIG idea.  The project only began to grow from there until it got a life of its own and a one-person show ended up becoming a modestly budgeted ensemble cast fan film which is now a multiple festival award-winner! 

What We Need & What You Get

So where do you come in? Well, it's simple, filming is not cheap, and as wonderful as it was to introduce the Black League to you for free, doing it a second and third time on an even bigger budget would downright be insane.  So we're hoping that what we've done was strong enough to inspire you to contribute towards the completion of our next chapter.  Part 1, titled Black Son of Krypton will offer a dramatic and powerful origin story of The Black League's founder Superman/Jal El bringing us right to the moments that take place in the sequel.  

So what's in it for you? Other than getting to see the full vision of this story in its entirety and receiving you also will receive additional benefits depending on how big of a contribution you're willing to make! But before we get there, let's start with what it will cost to fund this film.  We're seeking a total budget of $12,000 which is extremely modest for a film but with our 20+ years of experience, resources, and filmmaking savvy, it will be enough to make it happen.  What will that cost cover?  A 20-25 minute cinema-quality part 1 origin tale of Jal-El aka Superman who was introduced in The Black League of Superman.  The money will pay for the following:

-Set Locations ($1500)- Jim Logan Studios will be used for Watchtower scenes/Jal El's home and on-location filming will be needed for primary scenes including a Church exterior.    

-Actor Pay- 9 total ($2000)-Visit our IMDB page for our current cast list:

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt14616296/reference

-Cinematography ($2500)- Returning Director Steven Alan Davis along with In Reel Time Productions for drone/action shots 

-Costumes/Make-Up ($2500)- Costumes/Masks by REEVFX/Pro Cosplay

-Post Production ($3500)- Q-Logic Entertainment, the cinema wizards behind the success of The Black League of Superheroes 

The Impact

If you've watched The Black League of Superheroes you know that it is more than a standard fare fan film, but a story with a deep-rooted message. Let's take a look at a synopsis of Black Son of Krypton: 

In 1955, 2 Kryptonians landed on Earth from the doomed planet Krypton.  One, the world knows, the other has been hidden by choice.  Jal-El, The Black Son of Krypton had a very different experience on Earth.  A Kryptonian with the complexion of an African American, he was raised in the Jim Crow era to know that revealing his abilities could prove a death sentence for his family and loved ones.  In 2017, Kal-El Superman visits a now-adult Jal El in an effort to have him finally take up the mantle and join the battle against modern-day evils.  Is it too late or will Jal-El finally become the hero he was meant to be?

Risks & Challenges

There are very few risks as pre-production is intended to map out a very strategic and realistic method of completing the film.  The first film was able to be shot in a total of 4 days, The Black Son of Krypton will take about the same. Once shooting is completed we will immediately jump into post-production with our uber-talented team Q-Logic Entertainment who will help convert footage into a masterpiece of a film as they did for the award-winning Black League of Superheroes.  

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways that you can help even if you can't financially contribute.  Sharing this campaign, sharing direct links to our official website www.blackleagueofsuperheroes.com and YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-VsEIaB6fGUrTlnU8JDiPQ and simply staying engaged with our ongoing progress, following our social media including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tik Tok and just liking/loving/reposting/commenting and giving encouragement for the production team as well as the fans who will be looking forward to seeing the finished product along with you!

story:
WHAT'S MY STORY?

At the young age of fourteen, something was ignited inside of me upon reading about the unjust killing of an 18 year old black boy named Michael Brown. Ever since that day, making a change in the world and being an inspiration became my number one goal.
I have been making videos for as long as I can remember. From evolving from my Grandfather's camcorder to my first DSLR, making videos has always been my favorite outlet to translate my feelings and share my thoughts with the world. Growing up in the age of technology has been beyond a blessing.
One day, I decided to combine these passions together and Brewing Taboos was born. Brewing Taboos is my one-woman web show in which I discuss politics, social justice, and pop culture predominately in the Black community. My intention with this web show is to create a spark in as many minds as possible and encourage people to challenge everything they're taught. I want to inspire as many people as possible to be the change they wish to see in the world, and to be a teacher, a leader, and a light.

 

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?

Making a change in the world is a project that is much bigger than me. I need your help. I have set a small goal of $1,000 for this campaign. With this $1,000 I will be able to not only say I have a great support system behind my web show, but I will be able to take on a task bigger than online content creating.
I will begin by investing in better video equipment such as updated lights, microphones, and editing softwares. This will help increase the quality of my videos and content overall. A small portion of the money will also go to promoting my content so I will be able to get my message out on a broader scale.
Most importantly, a great majority of the funds will go to projects that are bigger than online content creation. My goal is to organize fundraising events that will benefit inner cities, ghettos, and hoods, attend public speaking events to share my thoughts and ideas, and host events that will raise awareness of social and political issues.

HELP SPREAD MY MESSAGE.

Contributing to my project is not just supporting my web show, it is supporting a bigger idea and eventually a movement.
Any smallest bit will help and will be greatly appreciated. You can also choose to help spread the word by sharing this campaign on Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, etc.
Or, you can simply tune in biweekly and show your support on my YouTube Channel.
